acctime.title: accTime
acctime.description: Returns the current simulation acceleration factor.

faderadio.title: fadeRadio
faderadio.description: Changes the radio volume smoothly within the given time.

fademusic.title: fadeMusic
fademusic.description: Changes the current music volume to the given value smoothly within the given time.

args.name: time: Number  - Fade interval in seconds

fadesound.title: fadeSound
fadesound.description: Changes the sound volume smoothly within the given time.

fillweaponsfrompool.title: fillWeaponsFromPool
fillweaponsfrompool.description: Adds magazines from the campaign pool to the given unit, depending on his weapons. Available in campaigns only.

flag.title: flag
flag.description: Returns the original flag pole of the flag the unit is carrying.

returns.desc: flag pole object the flag belongs to. If the unit carries no flag, objNull is returned.

fleeing.title: fleeing
fleeing.description:
Checks if a unit is fleeing.

Notes:
* Fleeing only affects AI led groups.
* Only the group as a whole can flee (or not).
* The courage of the AI group is based on the group's leader courage subskill.
* Each group has a max strength (summed "armor" of all infantry units - plus armor when inside vehicles).
* If the group losses by injury/damage or death/destruction are higher than the max strength, multiplied by leader's courage or allowFleeing level , then the group will start fleeing.
* As result primarily the AI flees to a nearby "supply point" (some friendly units - preferably with medic or engineer, or a vehicle with repair/ammo/fuel cargo). Alternatively it will try to find a safe position within a 600m radius from the initial waypoint (danger, distance, amount of cover positions are taken into account).
* After the fleeing has been finished the group's initial strength is reset.
* Fleeing units in combatMode red, will be set to yellow when fleeing to avoid engaging enemies while doing so.
* While fleeing, the group leader will be set to green, to avoid giving engage or fire orders, unless in combatMode blue already. Also speedMode is set to full.
* When reaching their flee point/destination, they will change to combatMode yellow and speedMode normal.
* With allowFleeing one can make unit's flee earlier (or essentially never flee). Apply it, overrides the courage subskill influence.

returns.desc: Returns true if a unit is fleeing, false if not. Dead or empty units return false.

flyinheight.title: flyInHeight
flyinheight.description: Sets the flying altitude for aircraft relatively to the ground surface. Avoid too low altitudes, as helicopters and planes won't evade trees and obstacles on the ground. The default flying altitude is 100 meters.

forceend.title: forceEnd
forceend.description: Forces mission ending (set with endMission) even if a camera effect or any another condition delays the endMission (mostly in ).

forcemap.title: forceMap
forcemap.description: Opens non-interactive main map in background that overrides user screen. To force open interactive map use openMap command.

args.name: show
args.desc: true to force, false to go back to normal map behaviour

foreach.title: forEach
foreach.description: Executes the given command(s) on every item of an Array or a HashMap.

args.name:
code: String in  and , Code since  - available variables:
* : iterated item
* : item's index

returns.desc: Will return the value of last executed statement

args.name:
code: Code - code applied to each key-value pair - available variables:
* : key
* : value
* : iteration number
hashMap : HashMap - The HashMap to iterate over

returns.desc: Will return the value of last executed statement

formation.title: formation
formation.description: Returns the current formation of a group.

formleader.title: formLeader
formleader.description:
Returns the formation leader of a given unit.
This is often the same as the group leader, but not always, for example in cases when a unit is ordered to follow another unit.

returns.desc: the leader of the formation is returned. If used on a dead unit, the returned value is objNull

fuel.title: fuel
fuel.description: Checks how much fuel is left in the gas tank of a vehicle.

returns.desc: the returned number is in range 0 (empty tank) to 1 (full tank).

finishmissioninit.title: finishMissionInit
finishmissioninit.description: Finish world initialization before mission is launched.

formattext.title: formatText
formattext.description: Creates a Structured Text similar to format command.

args.name: format
args.desc: a string containing text and/or references to the variables listed below in the array. The references appear in the form of %1, %2 etc.

args.name: argument
args.desc: use Structured Text where necessary (see Example 2)

else.title: else
else.description: Executes else code when if condition returns false.

enableenddialog.title: enableEndDialog
enableenddialog.description: Enables the execution of a custom camera sequence after the players death, coded in onPlayerKilled.sqs.

enableradio.title: enableRadio
enableradio.description: Enable and disable radio messages to be heard and shown in the left lower corner of the screen. This command can be helpful during cutscenes.

args.name: state
args.desc: true to enable the radio, false to disable it

engineon.title: engineOn
engineon.description: Activates and deactivates the engine of a vehicle.

args.name: state
args.desc: true to turn the engine on, false to turn it off

estimatedtimeleft.title: estimatedTimeLeft
estimatedtimeleft.description: Sets the estimated time left in the game that is shown in the "Game in progress" screen or in the master browser.

args.name:
seconds: Number - Estimated time in seconds. Maximum value:
* Prior to  v1.70: 7200 seconds (2 hours)
* Since  v1.70: 36000 (10 hours)

exec.title: exec
exec.description:
Execute a script using (the deprecated but still available) SQS Syntax. SQF Syntax (and execVM) is the most recent scripting language.
The magic variable _time used within the script contains the elapsed time in seconds since the script started.

args.name: argument
args.desc: the argument passed to the script through the _this variable. To pass multiple arguments, use an Array.

args.name: script
args.desc: the file path to the script. It should be given relatively to the mission folder, campaign scripts subfolder or global scripts folder and is searched there in the same order.If you refer to a script packed together with an addon, the path should look like this: "\ADDON_PBO_NAME\script.sqs" where ADDON_PBO_NAME is the name of the addon's PBO file without extension.

exit.title: exit
exit.description:
Stops the execution of a SQS script.

It is ignored in SQF Scripts.

exp.title: exp
exp.description: Exponential function with the base . Equal to . File:A3 expx.jpgSee how green and blue are identical except for the offset

enableai.title: enableAI
enableai.description: Enables parts of the AI behavior that was disabled by disableAI.

debuglog.title: debugLog
debuglog.description: Dump argument type and value to debugging output.

deg.title: deg
deg.description: Converts given value in radians to degrees. 1 degree equals 0.01745 radians or pi / 180.

deleteidentity.title: deleteIdentity
deleteidentity.description: Deletes an identity created with saveIdentity from the campaign's progress file.

returns.desc: true if the identity was deleted successfully, false if not

deletestatus.title: deleteStatus
deletestatus.description: Deletes a status created with saveStatus from the campaign's progress file.

returns.desc: true if the status was deleted successfully, false if not

deletevehicle.title: deleteVehicle
deletevehicle.description: Deletes an object. Only objects inserted in the mission editor and objects created during the game's progress can be deleted by this command. Terrain objects and players cannot be deleted.

dialog.title: dialog
dialog.description: Tests whether any user dialog is open.

returns.desc: true if a dialog is open, false if not

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Returns the direction an object or a location is facing (differs from getDir in that this also works with locations).

disableai.title: disableAI
disableai.description: Disables parts of the AI behaviour to get a better control over the actions of a unit. If the unit changes locality, this command might need to be executed again at the new locality to maintain effect.

args.name:
feature: String - Possible values are:
<spoiler text="Show list">
{! classwikitable
!-
! Feature !! Description !! Since
!-
! "all" !! Disables all features. !! 
!-
! "AIMINGERROR" !! Prevents AI's aiming from being distracted by its shooting, moving, turning, reloading, hit, injury, fatigue, suppression or concealed / lost target. !! 
!-
! "ANIM" !! Disables all animations of the unit. Completely freezes the unit, including breathing and blinking. No move command works until the unit is unfrozen. !! 
!-
! "AUTOCOMBAT" !! Disables autonomous switching to "COMBAT" AI Behaviour when in danger. !! 
!-
! "AUTOTARGET" !! Essentially makes single units without a group "deaf". The unit still goes prone and combat ready if it hears gunfire. It will not turn around when gunfire comes from behind, but if an enemy walks in front of it it will target the enemy and fire as normal. Does not work for grouped units as the leader will assign targets to the units, effectively reenabling this feature. !! -
!-
! "CHECKVISIBLE" !! Disables visibility raycasts. Useful in PvP missions where these raycasts are not needed. !! 
!-
! "COVER" !! Disables usage of cover positions by the AI. !! 
!-
! "FSM" !! Example  Disables the attached FSM scripts which are responsible for the AI behaviour. Enemies react slower to enemy fire and the enemy stops using hand signals. Disabling FSM can give the impression of untrained units as they react slower and are more disorganized compared to when FSM is enabled. !! 
!-
! "LIGHTS" !! Stops AI from operating vehicle headlights and collision lights. !! 
!-
! "MINEDETECTION" !! Disable AI's mine detection. !! 
!-
! "MOVE" !! This will stop units from turning and moving, including vehicles. Units will still change stance and fire at the enemy if the enemy happens to walk right in front of the barrel. Units will watch enemies that are in their line of sight, but will not turn their bodies to face the enemy, only their head. Works for grouped units as well. Good for staging units and holding them completely still. Movement can not be controlled via script either, this feature has to be reenabled for that. The unit will still be able to aim within its cone of fire. !! -
!-
! "NVG" !! Stops AI from putting on NVGs (but not from taking them off). !! 
!-
! "PATH" !! Stops the AI's movement but not the target alignment. !! 
!-
! "RADIOPROTOCOL" !! Stops AI from talking and texting while still being able to issue orders. !! 
!-
! "SUPPRESSION" !! Prevents AI from being suppressed. See Arma 3: Suppression. !! 
!-
! "TARGET" !! Prevents units from engaging targets. Units still move around for cover, but will not hunt down enemies. Works in groups as well. Excellent for keeping units inside bases or other areas without having them flank or engage anyone. They will still seek good cover if something is close by. !! -
!-
! "TEAMSWITCH" !! This will disable AI unit when teamswitching. !! -
!-
! "WEAPONAIM" !! Disables weapon aiming. !! -
!}
</spoiler>

disableuserinput.title: disableUserInput
disableuserinput.description: Disables or enables the keyboard and mouse input. Usually used during cutscenes.

args.name: state
args.desc: true to disable, false to enable

distance.title: distance
distance.description:
Image:distance2D.jpg400
Returns a distance in meters between Objects, Positions or Locations.

args.name: param1: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D
param2: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D

returns.desc: distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

args.name: location1: Location or Array in format Position or Position2D
location2: Location or Array in format Position or Position2D

returns.desc: distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated

do.title: do
do.description: Executes code. Used as part of a construct, such as while, with, for and switch. The code is always executed in missionNamespace unless do is used with with as an argument.

args.name: construct: While Type (while), With Type (with), For Type (for), Switch Type (switch)

dofire.title: doFire
dofire.description:
Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages).

The target is set with doTarget or commandTarget.

The target can be a unit or a vehicle, but not an object.

dofollow.title: doFollow
dofollow.description:
Order the given unit(s) to follow another from his own group as his formation leader (without radio messages).
It is also used to order the unit to return to formation after e.g doStop even if it is the leader himself that should return to formation (see Example 2).

args.name: unit: Object or Array of Objects

domove.title: doMove
domove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given position (without radio messages). Upon reaching its destination, if it is the group leader it will order the group to form around it's new position. If it is not the leader, it will immediately be ordered to return to formation by the group leader and begin moving back to the group. Use doStop to stop units returning to formation. moveToCompleted will return true when a unit issued this command reaches its destination.

dostop.title: doStop
dostop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop (without radio messages). The units stopped in this way will leave the groups formation. It will prevent them from moving around with their group (or formation leader), while still being able to turn around and even move to a new position if they see fit. The units will still respond to orders from their group leader (like engage, rearm, board a vehicle), but all of their actions will be separate from the group formation. To resume group default behaviour, use doFollow command. For example:  inlineunits _group doFollow leader _group;

args.name: unit(s): Object or Array of Objects

dotarget.title: doTarget
dotarget.description: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (without radio messages).Targeting can be stopped by _unit doWatch objNull; or_unit commandWatch objNull;

args.name: unit: Object or Array - a single unit or array of units

driver.title: driver
driver.description: Returns the driver of a vehicle.

drop.title: drop
drop.description:
Creates a particle effect.
This command is used to create smoke, fire and similar effects.
The particles are single polygons with single textures that always face the player.
They can be set to dynamically change their position, size, direction, can be set to different weights and to be more or less dependent on the wind.

deletecenter.title: deleteCenter
deletecenter.description:
In a nutshell, this command removes gaming Side (see createCenter). If a side has >0 Groups it cannot be deleted. Center can only be created for: east, west, resistance, civilian and sideLogic, therefore only centers from the mentioned sides can be deleted.
Old description: Destroys the AI center of the given side.

deletegroup.title: deleteGroup
deletegroup.description: Destroys the given group - the group must be empty and local to the machine executing this command.

dissolveteam.title: dissolveTeam
dissolveteam.description: Dissolves the given team. All members become members of the main team.

args.name:
teamColor: String - can be one of:
* "RED"
* "GREEN"
* "BLUE"
* "YELLOW"

dogetout.title: doGetOut
dogetout.description:
Orders one or multiple units to get out from the vehicle (silently). Same as commandGetOut with latter being shown via radio chat.

Notes:
* Works for both AI and player entities
* AI unit gets back in - unless is under player command or combined with other sqf commands (orderGetIn false, allowGetIn false or leaveVehicle)
* Ignores vehicle's lock state - unlike action "Eject" and moveOut
* AI waits for execution until vehicle has stopped/is no longer flying (unclear if any timeout exists for order to be discarded) - unlike action "Eject" and moveOut
* Plays the vehicle's position's get out animation (same as action "Eject") - unlike moveOut
* When execute for multiple units, it waits till the action is completed, before the next to take his turn (same as action "Eject") - unlike moveOut
* AI gets back into formation afterwards
* Works only on alive units - unlike action "Eject" (one after another) or moveOut (instantly)
* Does not work on unconscious - unless the AI is under player command. Unlike moveOut or action "Eject" (but one after another))

args.name: units: Object or Array of Objects

acos.title: acos
acos.description: ArcCosine of a number, result in Degrees

addaction.title: addAction
addaction.description: Adds an entry to the action menu of an object. The action can only be activated when in proximity to the object and looking at it. Adding an action to the player makes that action available to the player at all times. For event handling of user interaction see inGameUISetEventHandler.

syntaxes.code: object addAction  [title, script, arguments, priority, showWindow, hideOnUse, shortcut, condition, positionInModel, radius, radiusView, showIn3D, available, textDefault, textToolTip]

args.name: object
args.desc: Unit, vehicle or static object. No agents!

args.name: title
args.desc: The action name which is displayed in the action menu, may contain Structured Text. Because of that < and > symbols will be interpreted as opening and closing XML tags. To avoid this use  for < and  for >. The title text appearance can be changed with setUserActionText

args.name:
script: String - path to the script file, relative to the mission folder. It will run in scheduled environment, i.e. it is ok to use sleep. Parameters array passed to the script upon activation in _this variable is:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"];
* target: Object - the object which the action is assigned to
* caller: Object - the unit that activated the action
* actionID: Number - activated action's ID (same as addAction's return value)
* arguments: Anything - arguments given to the script if you are using the extended syntax
arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default nil) arguments to pass to the script. Accessible with  inline_this select 3 inside the script. If Array is used as an argument for example, its first element reference would be  inline_this select 3 select 0

args.name: priority
args.desc: (Optional, default 1.5) Priority value of the action. Actions will be arranged in descending order according to this value. Every game action has a preset priority value. Value can be negative or decimal fraction. Actions with same values will be arranged in order which they were made, newest at the bottom. The bigger the number the higher the action will be positioned on the menu. Typical range is 0 to 6

args.name: showWindow
args.desc: (Optional, default true) If set to true, players see "Titletext" at mid-lower screen, as they approach the object. Only the title text for the action with highest priority and showWindow set to true will be shown

args.name: hideOnUse
args.desc: (Optional, default true) If set to true, it will hide the action menu after selecting it. If set to false, it will leave the action menu open and visible after selecting the action, leaving the same action highlighted, for the purpose of allowing you to re-select that same action quickly, or to select another action

args.name: shortcut
args.desc: (Optional, default "") One of the key names defined in bin.pbo (e.g. "moveForward"). Adding available shortcut will bind corresponding keyboard key to this action. Shortcut availability can be tested with inputAction command

args.name:
condition: String - (Optional, default "true") Expression that must return true for the action to be shown. Special variables passed to the script code are:
* _target: Object - The object to which action is attached or, if the object is a unit inside of vehicle, the vehicle
* _this: Object - Caller person to whom the action is shown (or not shown if condition returns false)
* _originalTarget: Object - The original object to which the action is attached, regardless if the object/unit is in a vehicle or not
radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) Maximum 3D distance in meters between the activating unit's eyePos and the object's memoryPoint, selection or position. -1 disables the radius

args.name: radiusView
args.desc: (Optional, default unknown) Maximum distance in meters the cursor can be away from the 3D action to activate it. -1 disables this radius

args.name:
showIn3D: Number - (Optional, default unknown) Condition for showing the action in 3D space. Can be combined e.g.  inline2 + 32
* 1 - show
* 2 - draw if unit is pilot
* 4 - draw if unit is inside vehicle
* 8 - draw if unit is outside vehicle
* 16 - draw if not in external camera
* 32 - draw if not in internal camera
* 64 - draw if not in gunner camera (turret optics)

available: Number - (Optional, default unknown) Condition for being able to activate the action. Can be combined e.g.  inline1 + 4
* 0 - disabled
* 1 - unit is pilot or copilot
* 2 - unit is inside target
* 4 - unit is not inside target
textDefault
args.desc: (Optional, default "") Structured Text which is shown as the 3D action (so it can be an icon), or in the center of the screen when the action is highlighted in the action menu for a 2D action

args.name: textToolTip
args.desc: (Optional, default "") Structured Text which is faded in under the textDefault when hovering over the action in 3D space

returns.desc: The added action's ID. Action can be removed with removeAction (see also removeAllActions). IDs are incrementing, the first given action to each unit has the ID 0, the second the ID 1, etc. IDs are also passed to the called script (see script parameter)

action.title: action
action.description: Make a unit perform an action. See :Category:Actions for action names and syntaxes.

addmagazine.title: addMagazine
addmagazine.description:
Adds a magazine to a person. Infantry units can only carry a specific number of magazines, once the magazine slots are filled (or uniform/vest/bagpack are full in ), any further addMagazine commands are ignored. If class of magazine does not exist, an error message is printed in .rpt:
player addMagazine "dasdsa"; // .rpt: Given magazine[dasdsa] not found)

args.name: unitName
args.desc: person to add the magazines to

args.name: magazineName
args.desc: magazine name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

args.name: unitName
args.desc: person to add the magazines to

args.name: magazineName
args.desc: magazine name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

args.name: ammoCount
args.desc: Ammo quantity to be added to magazine. If it goes beyond maximum magazine capacity, the magazine will be given full and not overloaded.

addmagazinecargo.title: addMagazineCargo
addmagazinecargo.description: Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Once the magazine cargo space is filled up, any further addMagazineCargo commands are ignored.

args.name: vehicleName
args.desc: vehicle to add the magazines to

args.name: magazineName
args.desc: magazine name. See :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

args.name: count
args.desc: number of magazines to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove magazines.

addmagazinepool.title: addMagazinePool
addmagazinepool.description: Adds magazines to the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

args.name: magazineName
args.desc: Magazine class name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

addscore.title: addScore
addscore.description: Adds a number to the score of a unit. Negative values will remove from the score.

addweapon.title: addWeapon
addweapon.description:
Add a weapon to a unit. For a global version of this command see addWeaponGlobal.

Infantry units can only carry a specific number of weapons, once the weapon slots are filled, any further addWeapon commands are ignored.

args.name: object
args.desc: unit or vehicle to add the weapon to

args.name: weapon
args.desc: weapon class name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

addweaponcargo.title: addWeaponCargo
addweaponcargo.description: Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units. Ignores available cargo space.

args.name: vehicleName
args.desc: vehicle to which add the weapons

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: weapon name. See :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values

args.name: count
args.desc: number of weapons to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove weapons.

addweaponpool.title: addWeaponPool
addweaponpool.description: Add weapons to the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: Weapon name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

alive.title: alive
alive.description: Check if given vehicle/person/building is alive (i.e. not dead or destroyed).

returns.desc: true if alive, false if dead/destroyed

allowdammage.title: allowDammage
allowdammage.description: Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). The command does not prevent object from taking scripted damage such as setDamage or setHit.

allowfleeing.title: allowFleeing
allowfleeing.description:
Sets the cowardice level (the lack of courage or bravery) of a group or unit. 

Notes:
* Fleeing only affects AI led groups.
* Only the group as a whole can flee (or not).
* The courage of the AI group is based on the group's leader courage subskill.
* Each group has a max strength (summed "armor" of all infantry units - plus armor when inside vehicles).
* If the group losses by injury/damage or death/destruction are higher than the max strength, multiplied by leader's courage or allowFleeing level , then the group will start fleeing.
* As result primarily the AI flees to a nearby "supply point" (some friendly units - preferably with medic or engineer, or a vehicle with repair/ammo/fuel cargo). Alternatively it will try to find a safe position within a 600m radius from the initial waypoint (danger, distance, amount of cover positions are taken into account).
* After the fleeing has been finished the group's initial strength is reset.
* Fleeing units in combatMode red, will be set to yellow when fleeing to avoid engaging enemies while doing so.
* While fleeing, the group leader will be set to green, to avoid giving engage or fire orders, unless in combatMode blue already. Also speedMode is set to full.
* When reaching their flee point/destination, they will change to combatMode yellow and speedMode normal.
* With allowFleeing one can make unit's flee earlier (or essentially never flee). Apply it, overrides the courage subskill influence.

args.name: cowardice
args.desc: 1 is maximum cowardice and 0 minimum. A value of 0 will disable fleeing all together

allowgetin.title: allowGetIn
allowgetin.description: Set if the units given in the list are allowed to enter vehicles.

args.name: allow
args.desc: true allows the units to enter, false denies them

ammo.title: ammo
ammo.description: Check how many rounds are left in the currently loaded magazine in the given muzzle. Since Arma v1.56 the command also returns ammo for units in vehicles.

args.name: muzzle
args.desc: muzzle of a weapon. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

animate.title: animate
animate.description: Activates given object animation. Animation is defined in CfgModels animations class. Class names listed in CfgVehicles AnimationSources bound to "Proxy" controller can also be animated with animate command (see Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles).

args.name: animationName
args.desc: Name of the animation. This is the class-name of the animation defined in the config

args.name: phase
args.desc: Range 0 (start point of the animation) to 1 (end point of the animation). The speed, in which the animation is processed, is defined in the addon's config.cpp and cannot be changed during running missions

args.name: speed: Boolean or (since ) Number - (Optional, default false) when true animation is instant; Number > 0 is treated as config speed value multiplier

animationphase.title: animationPhase
animationphase.description: Returns the phase of the given animation on the given object. Animation can be scripted (animate, animateSource, animateDoor) or engine driven. Animation names for an object could be found out with animationNames command. When animation is rotation, like with "MainTurret" for example, the output is in radians, to convert to degrees use deg command.

args.name: animationName
args.desc: Name of the animation. This is the class-name of the animation defined in the addon's config.cpp

returns.desc: Range 0 (start point of the animation) to 1 (end point of the animation)

asin.title: asin
asin.description: Arcsine of a number, result in Degrees.

assignascargo.title: assignAsCargo
assignascargo.description: Assign a unit as cargo of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order a unit to get in as cargo into a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the cargo space of the vehicle.

assignascommander.title: assignAsCommander
assignascommander.description:
Assign a unit as commander of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as commander of a specific vehicle.
Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the commander place of the vehicle.

assignasdriver.title: assignAsDriver
assignasdriver.description: Assign a unit as driver of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as driver of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the driver place of the vehicle.

assignasgunner.title: assignAsGunner
assignasgunner.description: Assign a unit as gunner of a vehicle. Used together with orderGetIn to order subordinate units to get in as gunner of a specific vehicle. Before usage of this command a subordinate unit has not got the option to get into the gunner place of the vehicle.

atan2.title: atan2
atan2.description: Image:atan.jpg200 ArcTangent of y/x. Used to determine the angle of a vector [y,x]. Result in Degrees between -180 and 180.

actionkeys.title: actionKeys
actionkeys.description:
Returns Array containing dikCodes of keys, buttons and combos assigned to the given user action. Action names could be found in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names or user profile, for example:
 langcpp
keyWatch[] = { 24 };

To retrieve the value, use the property name without 'key':
actionKeys "Watch"; // 24
In addition, some of the actions are also listed in here: inputAction/actions

actionkeysimages.title: actionKeysImages
actionkeysimages.description:
Returns a list of button images or names assigned to the given user action.
A maximum of maxKeys keys is listed.
You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

actionkeysnames.title: actionKeysNames
actionkeysnames.description:
Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action.
Action names can be found in config class  or user action names.

args.name: maxKeys
args.desc: maximum number of keys to return

args.name:
inputDevicePriority: String - result sorted by inputDevicePriority with values:
* 
* 
* 
* 
* 
*  (mouse and keyboard combinations)
*  (any controller other than mouse or keyboard)
Other values are considered as: 
*

activatekey.title: activateKey
activatekey.description:
Activates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.
See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the description.ext file of the missions.

addlivestats.title: addLiveStats
addlivestats.description: Adds score to the Xbox Live Statistics score for the given unit (or the commander unit of the given vehicle).

addwaypoint.title: addWaypoint
addwaypoint.description:
Adds (or inserts when index is given) a new waypoint to a group.

The waypoint is placed randomly within a circle with the given center and radius.

The function returns a waypoint with format [group, index].

args.name: center: Array format PositionAGL (PositionASL if radius is negative!) or Object
radius
args.desc: random waypoint placement within radius from center

args.name: index (optional): Number - can be used to insert a waypoint in between existing waypoints

assignteam.title: assignTeam
assignteam.description:
Assigns the unit (in case of a vehicle, its commander) to the given team. Team is an option in group control (unit management) menu that allows to split player group in teams and then give bulk order to separate teams. In order to operate properly, the command requires specific conditions:
* the command requires player to be fully initialised
* the unit getting assigned must be either player himself or a unit in player's group
The colour of the assigned team for a unit is seen on the group management UI as well as squad radar.
{! classwikitable align-center
!+ Possible teams and values
! Team
! White
! Red
! Green
! Blue
! Yellow
!-
! Value
! "MAIN"
! "RED"
! "GREEN"
! "BLUE"
! "YELLOW"
!}

join.title: join
join.description:
{! classwikitable stylefloat: right; font-size: 0.9em; margin: 0 0 0.5em 1.5em
! colspan2  Maximum number ofunits per group
!-
!  !! 12
!-
! Later titles !! 10000+
!}
Joins units into a given Group.

To make a unit leave its current group, join it into grpNull (e.g.  inline[MyUnit] join grpNull) - but beware: A new group is created for the leaving unit; this could result in the number of groups growing out of control.

knowsabout.title: knowsAbout
knowsabout.description:
Checks if a group or a side knows about target.
* Enemy knowledge is instantly shared among the group units
* Units in the same group always perfectly know about each others
* AI knowledge cannot check beyond current viewDistance and it resets to zero as soon as the target's distance is over itNote: neither fog nor daylight affect this behaviour
* Losing sight of a target for more than 120 seconds resets its knowsAbout to zero as well
* Magic number is the value that must be reached for a unit to shoot at an enemy (used by "Detected by" triggers as well):
:{!classwikitable align-center
! Game
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
!-
! Magic value
! 0.7
! 0.105
! ?
! ?
! ?
! ?
!}

args.name: who: Object, Group or Side - if a unit, unit's group is considered; if a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is used.

keyimage.title: keyImage
keyimage.description: Returns a structured text, containing an image or name (if no image is found) of the button, on the keyboard, mouse or joystick, with the given code.

args.name: dikCode: Number or String (since Arma 3 v2.08)

keyname.title: keyName
keyname.description: Returns the name of a button with extra quotation marks (on the keyboard, mouse or joystick) with the given code.

args.name: dikCode: Number or String (since Arma 3 v2.08))

behaviour.title: behaviour
behaviour.description: Returns the behaviour of the individual unit, this is why it only accepts Object as the argument. For Arma 3 behaviour explanation see Arma_3_AI_Behavior

benchmark.title: benchmark
benchmark.description: Returns the value of "3D Performance" in OFP Preferences (flashpoint.cfg). This can be used to estimate the computer performance to adapt CPU and GPU demanding settings like view distance dynamically in missions.

buildingpos.title: buildingPos
buildingpos.description: Returns position of a given indexed position in a building.

returns.desc: A single building position in format PositionAGL. If building position with given index does not exist,  is returned

buttonaction.title: buttonAction
buttonaction.description: Returns the action assigned to a control of the currently active user dialog. Can be used for buttons and active texts. Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.

buttonsetaction.title: buttonSetAction
buttonsetaction.description:
Set the action of a control of the currently active user dialog. The script statement is executed on button release and  is available, but contains ""; See Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs. Works with:
* CT_BUTTON
* CT_XBUTTON
* CT_ACTIVETEXT
* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON

args.name: action
args.desc: SQS code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked

args.name: action:  String - SQS code body that should be executed when the button/active text is clicked

querymagazinepool.title: queryMagazinePool
querymagazinepool.description: Return number of magazines of type name in magazine pool (used in campaign to transfer magazines into next mission).

queryweaponpool.title: queryWeaponPool
queryweaponpool.description: Return number of weapons of type name in weapon pool (used in campaign to transfer weapons into next mission).

camcommand.title: camCommand
camcommand.description:
Executes a command on the given camera / actor object. Known commands:

{! classwikitable
! All cameras !! "Camera" !! "Seagull" !! "CamCurator"
!- stylevertical-align: top
!
* 
* 
!
* 
* 
!
*  lands the seagull
*  makes the seagull fly
!
*  (number, in degrees)
*  (number, in degrees)
*  (number)
*  (number)
*  (number, in meters, ASL)
*  (on/off)
*  (on/off)
!}

camcommit.title: camCommit
camcommit.description: Smoothly conduct the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately. For  commands use camCommitPrepared.

args.name: time
args.desc: time in seconds during which the changes shall be done

camcommitted.title: camCommitted
camcommitted.description: Checks if the conduction of the last camCommit call already finished.

returns.desc: true if the last camCommit already finished, false if not

camcreate.title: camCreate
camcreate.description:
Create a camera or a seagull object on the given position. The creation happens immediately and doesn't wait for camCommit.
Among other commands, cameraEffect must be used to enter the camera's view and camDestroy to delete the created camera. See also Camera Control.

args.name:
type: String - camera type, one of the following:
* "camera"
* "seagull" (a crow in Arma 2)
* "camconstruct"
* "camcurator" (Since Arma 3 Zeus)
* "crowe" (crow - Arma 3)
* or any vehicle class suitable to be spawned with cam
position
args.desc: format PositionAGL - position to create the object at

camdestroy.title: camDestroy
camdestroy.description: Destroys camera object created with camCreate. This command doesn't need camCommit.

cameraeffect.title: cameraEffect
cameraeffect.description:
Sets the given effect on the given camera. If you want to switch the screen directly to the first-person, aiming, third-person or group view of an object, use switchCamera instead. The effect type "Terminate" is used to exit the current camera view and switch back to the player's view. Does not need camCommit.

Since , it is possible to terminate individual r2t source. For example:

cam cameraEffect ["terminate", "back", "rtt1"]; // would terminate "rtt1" r2t source
cam cameraEffect ["terminate", "back"]; // would terminate all r2t sources

args.name: effectName
args.desc: the effect type (defined in main config or CfgCameraEffects >> Array). Defaults are: , , , ,

args.name:
effectPosition: String - position of the effect. Can be one of:

These are usually used with "Fixed" and "FixedWithZoom" effect types. If not sure which position to use, set it to .

camsetbank.title: camSetBank
camsetbank.description: Sets camera bank angle. Does not commit changes.

camsetdir.title: camSetDir
camsetdir.description: Sets the orientation of the given camera in the direction of the given vector. Needs camCommit.

args.name:
direction:
* Number (before ) - camera azimuth
* Array in format [x,y,z] (since ) - direction of camera. Must be a valid vector.

camsetdive.title: camSetDive
camsetdive.description: Sets camera dive angle. Does not commit changes.

camsetfov.title: camSetFov
camsetfov.description:
Set the zoom level (Field Of View) of the given camera.

The zoom level is from  for the nearest and  for the furthest zoom value, with a default zoom level of 

The angle of the field of view is  radians when in 4:3 aspect ratio. Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted.

args.name: level
args.desc: zoom level, range 0.01 to 8.5 (see description above)

camsetfovrange.title: camSetFovRange
camsetfovrange.description:
Set the zoom level (Field Of View) start and end values for automatical zooming.  "automatical"? LoL ;-) 

The default zoom level is  where  is the nearest and  is the most far zoom value.

args.name: fovRange
args.desc: zoom level, range 0 to 1 (see description above)

camsetpos.title: camSetPos
camsetpos.description: Sets the position of the given camera or seagull (see camCreate). It is worth mentioning that camera position can also be set with setPos, in which case it would be instant. With camSetPos it is possible to make smooth position transition in time, defined with camCommit, which is required in this case.

args.name: position
args.desc: Position to set the object to

camsetrelpos.title: camSetRelPos
camsetrelpos.description: Sets the position of the given camera relative to its target, set with camSetTarget. Needs a call to camCommit to be conducted.

camsettarget.title: camSetTarget
camsettarget.description: Set the target object or position where the given camera should point at. Needs the call of camCommit to be conducted. To reset the target use objNull.

canfire.title: canFire
canfire.description: Returns true if the given vehicle is still able to fire. For the command to return true, vehicle must be alive, have weapon operator and the weapon cannot be damaged ≥ 0.9 but can be empty due to running out of ammo. If mission starts with vehicle having no ammo or setVehicleAmmo 0 command is executed on the vehicle, then canFire will always report false for it.

canmove.title: canMove
canmove.description:
Returns if the given vehicle is still able to move.
* This command does not check for the amount of fuel the vehicle has, except for helicopters and airplanes.
* A helicopter with a damaged tail rotor may return that it cannot move, where a skilled pilot could use it.

returns.desc: true if the vehicle is able to move, false if not

canstand.title: canStand
canstand.description: Returns if the given soldier is able to stand up. It only checks for the unit's legs and not its alive/dead status - it can return true for a dead unit.

returns.desc: true if the unit is human and is still able to stand up, false otherwise.

captive.title: captive
captive.description: Returns the captive state of the given unit (set with setCaptive). A captive unit will not be attacked by its enemies.

returns.desc: true if the unit is captive, false if not

civilian.title: civilian
civilian.description:
Pre-defined variable for the civilian side.
When used in a format statement (), the string returned is .

clearmagazinecargo.title: clearMagazineCargo
clearmagazinecargo.description: Remove all magazines from the given vehicle's magazine cargo space.

clearweaponcargo.title: clearWeaponCargo
clearweaponcargo.description: Remove all weapons from the given vehicle's weapon cargo space.

clearweaponpool.title: clearWeaponPool
clearweaponpool.description: Remove all weapons from the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

clearmagazinepool.title: clearMagazinePool
clearmagazinepool.description: Removes all magazines from the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

closedialog.title: closeDialog
closedialog.description:
Close the currently active user dialog with exit code. Most common exit codes are:

#define IDC_OK            1 // emulate "Ok" button
#define IDC_CANCEL        2 // emulate "Cancel" button

combatmode.title: combatMode
combatmode.description: Returns the combat mode of the given AI  group. See setCombatMode for more information about combat modes.

args.name: group: Group or Object - If the argument is unit Object, unit's current group is used.

commander.title: commander
commander.description: In  it returns the commander of a vehicle. Since  it returns the primary observer. The commander of a vehicle can be found with effectiveCommander.

returns.desc: The unit sitting in the commander place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

commandfire.title: commandFire
commandfire.description:
Order the given unit to fire on the given target (via the radio).
If the target is objNull, the unit is ordered to fire on its current target (set with doTarget or commandTarget).

commandfollow.title: commandFollow
commandfollow.description:
Order the given unit(s) to follow another from his own group (via radio).
It can also be used to resume unit formation after e.g doStop.

args.name: unit: Object or Array of Objects

commandmove.title: commandMove
commandmove.description: Order the given unit(s) to move to the given location (via the radio). Exactly the same as doMove, except this command displays a radio message. The command will not put a visible waypoint marker unlike when move command is given via commanding menu.

args.name: unitName: Object or Array of Objects

commandstop.title: commandStop
commandstop.description: Order the given unit(s) to stop via radio. A stop command will never finish, the unit(s) will never be ready.

args.name: target: Object or Array of Objects

commandtarget.title: commandTarget
commandtarget.description: Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (via the radio). Command given to the player, puts a red square with words Target and Distance on player's HUD at target location. If player in vehicle and has radar facilities, it also adds target marker to the radar.

args.name: target: Object or Array of Objects

commandwatch.title: commandWatch
commandwatch.description: Orders the unit(s) to watch the given position or target (via the radio). Use objNull as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.

comment.title: comment
comment.description: Defines a comment. See  to learn more about comments.

cos.title: cos
cos.description: Cosine of a number, argument in degrees.

countenemy.title: countEnemy
countenemy.description: Count how many units in the array are considered enemy to the given unit.

countfriendly.title: countFriendly
countfriendly.description: Count how many units in the array are considered friendly to the given unit.

countside.title: countSide
countside.description: Returns how many units in the given array belong to given side.

args.name: array: Array of Objects and/or Groups

counttype.title: countType
counttype.description: Count how many objects in the array are of given type. This command also works with parent classes like "Air", "Tank", and "Car". For a full class reference see Classes.

countunknown.title: countUnknown
countunknown.description: Count how many units in the array are unknown to the given unit.

createdialog.title: createDialog
createdialog.description: Creates a dialog which is defined either in the mission's description.ext, in the campaign's description.ext or in the global resource.cpp. The given name has to be the class name used in one of these files. If another dialog is already opened, the desired dialog is created as a child dialog of the one already opened.

args.name: dialogName
args.desc: Class name used in the description.ext, resource.cpp or config.cpp

returns.desc: true when the dialog was created successfully

args.name: dialogName
args.desc: Class name used in the description.ext, resource.cpp or config.cpp

args.name: forceOnTop
args.desc: If true, dialog will be rendered on top of displays. Default: false

createunit.title: createUnit
createunit.description:
Create a unit of the provided CfgVehicles class.



{! classwikitable stylewidth: 100%
!
! stylewidth: 50%  
! stylewidth: 50%  
!-
! Group's locality
! the provided group can be non-local, but a warning will be logged
! the provided group must be local
!-
! Unit's side
! using a classname from a different side than the provided group will result in the unit itself being of a (config-defined) side inside a group of another side - see  for more information
! using a classname from a different side than the provided group will result in the unit being of the same side as the provided group
!-
! Other
! the unit's init code will execute after a slight delay if the provided group is not local
! this syntax does not return a reference to the created unit (see )
!}

syntaxes.code: group createUnit [type, position, markers, placement, special]

args.name: group
args.desc: existing group new unit will join; if the group is not local, a warning will be logged

args.name: type
args.desc: classname of unit to be created as per CfgVehicles

args.name: position: Object, Group or Array format Position or Position2D - location where to create the unit. In case of Group, the group leader's position is used

special: String - unit placement special, one of:
*  - The unit will be created at the first available free position nearest to given position
 * {{hl|"FORM"}} - Not implemented, currently functions the same as "NONE" 
*  - The unit will be created exactly at passed position
*  - The unit will be created in cargo of the group's vehicle, regardless of the passed position (see ). If group has no vehicle or there is no cargo space available, the unit will be placed according to .  placement excludes cargo positions with personal FFV turrets. To check available cargo space use:
{! stylewidth: 100%
! rowspan2 stylewidth: 2em 
!  FFV
! private _hasCargo = { isNull (_x select 0) } count (fullCrew [_veh, "cargo", true]) > 0;
!-
! before
! _hasCargo = _veh emptyPositions "CARGO" > 0;
!}

syntaxes.code: type createUnit [position, group, init, skill, rank]

args.name: type
args.desc: classname of unit to be created as per CfgVehicles

args.name: position: Object, Group or Array format Position or Position2D - location at which the unit is created. In case of Group position of the group leader is used
group
args.desc: existing group the new unit will join

args.name: init
args.desc: (Optional, default "") unit init statement, similar to unit init field in the editor. The code placed in unit init will run upon unit creation for every client on network, present and future. The code itself receives the reference to the created unit via local variable this. Do not use global commands in a unit's init as it runs on every client.

createvehicle.title: createVehicle
createvehicle.description:
Creates an empty object of given classname type.
See Arma 3 Assets / Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles, or :Category:CfgVehicles for earlier games.

args.name: position: Array format Position - desired placement position. If the exact position is occupied, nearest empty position is used.
position: Object; Array format Position2D or PositionATL (PositionAGL if watercraft or amphibious) - desired placement position

markers: Array of Strings - (Optional, default []) if the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with setMarkerPos, the vehicle will also be created at given z coordinate.
placement
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) the vehicle is placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius.

args.name:
special: String - (Optional, default "NONE") can be one of the following:
*  - will look for suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before placing vehicle there.
*  - places vehicle at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model.
*  - if vehicle is capable of flying and has crew, it will be made airborne at default height.
If special is "" or not specified, default  is used.

returns.desc: created vehicle or objNull if failed

crew.title: crew
crew.description: Returns the crew (both dead and alive) of the given vehicle.

returns.desc: An array with all units in the vehicle is returned.

ctrlenable.title: ctrlEnable
ctrlenable.description:
Enables or disables a control of the currently active user dialog.
Disabled controls cannot be clicked onto.
Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.

args.name: enable
args.desc: true to enable the control, false to disable it

ctrlenabled.title: ctrlEnabled
ctrlenabled.description: Returns if a control on the currently active user dialog is enabled. Disabled controls cannot be focused. Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.

returns.desc: true if the control is enabled, false if not
true if the control is enabled, false if not

ctrlsettext.title: ctrlSetText
ctrlsettext.description:
Sets the text of a control of the currently active user dialog or display. This command can be used for static texts, buttons, edit lines and active texts as well as for images, where you can use it to set the image path.
Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.
Use endl to insert line breaks.
Since Arma 3 v2.05.147765 supported control types are:
* CT_STATIC
* CT_EDIT
* CT_XKEYDESC
* CT_XBUTTON
* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON
* CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT
* CT_BUTTON
* CT_ACTIVETEXT

args.name: text
args.desc: Text or image path, depending on the control type

ctrlshow.title: ctrlShow
ctrlshow.description: Shows or hides a control. Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.

args.name: show
args.desc: true if the control should be shown, false if not

ctrltext.title: ctrlText
ctrltext.description:
Returns the text of a control of the currently active user dialog. This command can be used on static texts, buttons, edit lines and active texts as well as for images, where it returns the image path. Does not work on HTML control and returns empty string "". Since Arma 3 v2.05.147765 supported control types are:
* CT_STATIC
* CT_EDIT
* CT_XKEYDESC
* CT_XBUTTON
* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON
* CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT
* CT_BUTTON
* CT_ACTIVETEXT

returns.desc: The text or image path is returned, dependent on the control type
The text or image path is returned, dependent on the control type

ctrlvisible.title: ctrlVisible
ctrlvisible.description: Returns if a control of the currently active user dialog is shown or not. Read Arma: GUI Configuration for more information about user dialogs and controls.

returns.desc: true if the control is shown, false if not

cutobj.title: cutObj
cutobj.description: Displays an object defined in the global config in .

args.name: class
args.desc: the className of the object defined in

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

args.name: layer
args.desc: layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100

args.name: class
args.desc: the className of the object defined in

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

args.name: layerName
args.desc: layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE

args.name: class
args.desc: the className of the object defined in

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

cutrsc.title: cutRsc
cutrsc.description: Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's Description.ext, the campaign's description.ext or the global config.

args.name: class
args.desc: the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)

args.name: effect
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource.

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened.

args.name:
layer: Number or String
* Number - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100
* String -  layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE.
class
args.desc: the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)

args.name: effect
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened.

cuttext.title: cutText
cuttext.description:
Displays a text message in the center of the screen. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "
" new line characters:  inlinecutText ["line1
line2
line3", "PLAIN"];

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) time in seconds to fade in resource. If 0 or less, default value is used

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

args.name: isStructuredText
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to switch support for Structured Text formatting - see

syntaxes.code: layer cutText [text, type, speed, showInMap, isStructuredText]

args.name:
layer: Number or String
* Number - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100.
* String - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE.
type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource. If 0 or less, default value is used

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

args.name: isStructuredText
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to switch support for Structured Text formatting - see

camsetfocus.title: camSetFocus
camsetfocus.description: Sets camera focus range in format [distance, blur]. blur param - sets the camera focus blur. It does not automatically commit changes (see camCommit). Use [-1, -1] to disable focus completely.

camusenvg.title: camUseNVG
camusenvg.description: Set / clear using of night vision during cutscenes. This command only works with camCreate created camera that is currently the main camera for the player (see example).

clearradio.title: clearRadio
clearradio.description: Clean up the content of radio protocol history.

commandgetout.title: commandGetOut
commandgetout.description: Orders one or multiple units to get out from the vehicle (via the radio). Same as doGetOut with latter being silent.

args.name: unit(s): Object or Array of Objects

composetext.title: composeText
composetext.description: Creates a Structured Text by joining the given  structured or  plain text arguments.

args.name: arguments: Array of String and/or Structured Text - use Structured Text where necessary (see )

createcenter.title: createCenter
createcenter.description:
Instanciate a Side center. A Side center is required to be able to create groups of this side.
Centers can only be created for east, west, resistance, civilian and sideLogic sides.
Created sides must have their "side-friendship" defined with setFriend.

creategroup.title: createGroup
creategroup.description:
Creates a new Group for the given Side. Using this command if the group limit is reached will return grpNull. The new Group exists globally, but it's locality is where this command was executed.
{! classwikitable styletext-align: center
! Game
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
!-
! Group auto-deletion
! colspan6  
! colspan2  
!-
! Group limit per side
! 63
! colspan6  144
! 288
!}

returns.desc: grpNull if the group limit is reached

args.name:
deleteWhenEmpty: Boolean - true to delete the group when empty.
* If set to true, forces a group to get deleted when empty - it does not prevent its deletion by other commands when set to false.
* Deletion may take up to a minute after the last unit is removed.

returns.desc: grpNull if the group limit is reached

createguardedpoint.title: createGuardedPoint
createguardedpoint.description:
Adds a point guarded by the given side (scripted way of adding equivalent of "GUARDED BY" trigger in Editor). A closest AI group in the given side with assigned "GUARD" waypoint will attempt to secure this guard point. The actual guarded position is determined via the following rules:
* Given "position" is always considered. It could be Object, Group, Position2D or Position3D. In every case, z coordinate will be ignored and point will be placed on nearest surface.
* If "objectMapID" is not negative, the position of the object with the given ID is used (Overrides "position"). -1 to ignore this argument. z of the object position will be intact.
* If the given "vehicle" is valid, the position of the vehicle is extracted and guarded (Overrides both "position" and "objectMapID"). objNull to ignore. z of the vehicle position will be intact.
To be used with "GUARD" waypoint.

args.name: side
args.desc: The side which will be guarding

args.name: position: Object, Group, Position2D or Position3D
objectMapID
args.desc: static id of map object. -1 to ignore

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle to be used for position. objNull to ignore

createmarker.title: createMarker
createmarker.description: Creates a new map marker at the given position. The marker will be created for every connected player as well as all JIP players. The marker name has to be unique; the command will be ignored if a marker with the given name already exists.

args.name: name
args.desc: the marker's name, used to reference the marker in scripts.

args.name: position: Array or Object - Position2D, PositionAGL or Object. In case of an object, the object's model centre's PositionASL is used (see getPosWorld)
channel
args.desc: (Optional) the marker channel - see Channel IDs (for multiplayer)

returns.desc: The marker's name or empty string if the marker name is not unique.

createmine.title: createMine
createmine.description:
Creates a mine of the given type.
If the markers array only contains one marker name, it is ignored and the position parameter is used instead. If markers contains multiple marker names, one of them is chosen randomly and used as the center of the placement area.
This command creates objects of the  class named in  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> _type >> "ammo".

args.name: position: Object or Array format PositionAGL
markers: Array of Strings - marker name(s)

createsoundsource.title: createSoundSource
createsoundsource.description:
Creates a sound source of the given type (type is the name of the subclass of CfgVehicles which is pointing to the sound defined in CfgSFX). The actual sound object created is of type  and could be detected with allMissionObjects. If the markers array contains several marker names, the position of a random one is used, otherwise, the given position is used. The sound source is placed inside a circle with this position as its center and placement as its radius. Some of the vanilla classes pre-configured in :


Since  v1.70 it is possible to define sounds for use with createSoundSource in mission config. As mentioned earlier, the sounds needed for this command should be defined inside CfgVehicles class, which itself references CfgSFX class. If given class searched in main config and is not found, the search will continue in description.ext - see .
Note that the sound created by createSoundSource will always be looping.
Also when CfgSFX sound definition contains more than 1 sound, there is no guarantee that the sound played will be the same on every PC in Multiplayer.

args.name: position:  PositionAGL, Position2D or Object - Desired placement position
markers
args.desc: If the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with setMarkerPos, the sound will also be created at given z coordinate

args.name: placement
args.desc: The sound is placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius

createvehiclelocal.title: createVehicleLocal
createvehiclelocal.description: Creates an object of the given type. Created object is not transferred through network in MP games. netId of such vehicle in multiplayer will be "0:0". To disable local vehicle creation, use CfgDisabledCommands to blacklist this command. Alternatively, you can use createSimpleObject with local option enabled where applicable.

getdammage.title: getDammage
getdammage.description: Returns the object damage in the range from 0 to 1.

getdir.title: getDir
getdir.description: Returns the object heading in the range 0..360.

args.name: pos1: Object, Position2D or Position3D - from where
pos2: Object, Position2D or Position3D - to where

getmarkercolor.title: getMarkerColor
getmarkercolor.description: Returns marker color for given marker.

returns.desc: format PositionAGL if preserveElevation is true or [x,y,0] if preserveElevation is false

getmarkersize.title: getMarkerSize
getmarkersize.description: Returns the size of the given marker. A getter for setMarkerSize and an alias of markerSize.

getmarkertype.title: getMarkerType
getmarkertype.description: Gets type of marker. See CfgMarkers for a list of standard markers.

getpos.title: getPos
getpos.description:
Returns object or location position. If the argument is an object, the return value is in format PositionAGLS.
The alternative syntax gets the position given distance and heading away from provided object or position - the command equivalent of BIS_fnc_relPos.

returns.desc: format [x,y,z], where z is land surface position in format PositionAGL

getwppos.title: getWPPos
getwppos.description: Returns the position of a selected waypoint of a given group. Waypoints include only those which were placed in the mission editor.

args.name: groupOrUnit: Group or Object - the group (or unit) of which to select a waypoint

index: Number - 0 equals the starting position of the group.
The number used in this and other waypoint commands is one more than the one displayed in the waypoint window in the editor. (i.e. if the editor labeled a WP  the you would have to use  to access this particular WP)

returns.desc: format Position3D. The returned position equals [0,0,0] if the selected waypoint doesn't exist.

globalchat.title: globalChat
globalchat.description: Types text to the global radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

globalradio.title: globalRadio
globalradio.description: Sends the audio message to the global radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

goto.title: goto
goto.description: Break script flow and go to given label (defined by # - NOT to be confused with SQF's hash sign!)

group.title: group
group.description: Returns the group a unit is assigned to.

returns.desc: for dead units, the returned group equals grpNull.

groupchat.title: groupChat
groupchat.description: Types text to the group radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

groupradio.title: groupRadio
groupradio.description: Sends the audio message to the group radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol.

grpnull.title: grpNull
grpnull.description:
A non-existing Group. To compare non-existent groups use isNull or isEqualTo:

grpNull == grpNull;			// false
isNull grpNull;				// true
grpNull isEqualTo grpNull;	// true

gunner.title: gunner
gunner.description: Returns the gunner of a vehicle.

returns.desc: The person sitting in the gunner place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned.

getposasl.title: getPosASL
getposasl.description: Returns the object position height above sea level.

glanceat.title: glanceAt
glanceat.description:
Control what the unit(s) is/are glancing at (target or Position). If target is used, it will get revealed fully.

How frequently the unit(s) is/are glancing there depends on behaviour.

handshit.title: handsHit
handshit.description: Checks if a soldier's hands are hit, which results in inaccurate aiming.

returns.desc: if the hands are not damaged, the returned value is 0. If the hands are hit or the unit is dead, the returned value is 1.

hasweapon.title: hasWeapon
hasweapon.description: Checks if a unit has the given weapon in hands or on back/in holster. Weapons inside unit containers such as vest and backpack are not counted.

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: the name of the weapon to check for.

returns.desc: returns true if the unit has the weapon, false if not.

hintc.title: hintC
hintc.description: Displays a very basic message dialog in the center of the screen. Player control is taken away until "Continue" is pressed. The message dialog can be dragged around on the screen. After "Continue" has been pressed, the content of the hintC is repeated in a normal hint.

args.name: message: String, Structured Text, Array of Strings or Array of Structured Text

hintcadet.title: hintCadet
hintcadet.description:
Shows a text hint only when in cadetMode.

The text can contain several lines. \n is used to indicate the end of a line.

inflame.title: inflame
inflame.description: Sets the state of a fireplace.

args.name: burn
args.desc: true to let it burn, false to extinguish it.

inflamed.title: inflamed
inflamed.description: Checks if fireplace is inflamed (burning) or not. To check if a unit is receiving damage from fire, use isBurning command.

isengineon.title: isEngineOn
isengineon.description: Returns true if engine is on, false if it is off.

if.title: if
if.description: This operator creates a If Type which is used in the if-construct as described here.

args.name: condition
args.desc: if it evaluates as true, the then clause is executed.  Otherwise, the else clause (if present) is executed

intersect.title: intersect
intersect.description:
Finds named selections in object which are in specified LOD, intersected by given section of a line. Return value is in the form of [selection, distance]. Multiple returned arrays are nested within a single array. No intersection returns []. lodName could be one of the following: 
* "FIRE"
* "VIEW"
* "GEOM"
* "IFIRE" - ("I" stands for Indirect, almost the same as FIRE)
*  "PHYSX" - PhysX geometry LOD

iskeyactive.title: isKeyActive
iskeyactive.description:
Checks whether the given key is active in the current user profile.

See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the description.ext file of the missions.

iskindof.title: isKindOf
iskindof.description:
Checks whether the given object or type is (a subtype) of the given type.
While  and  only support CfgVehicles, CfgAmmo and CfgNonAIVehicles,  can be used with any config, including the mission config.

ismarkedforcollection.title: isMarkedForCollection
ismarkedforcollection.description: Checks whether the object is marked for weapons collection.

args.name:
mode: String - can be one of:
* "LAND" - Complete stop
* "GET IN" - Hovering very low, for another unit to get in
* "GET OUT" - Hovering low, for another unit to get out
*  "NONE" - Cancel a landing

lbadd.title: lbAdd
lbadd.description: Adds an item with the given text to the CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO or CT_TOOLBOX.

lbclear.title: lbClear
lbclear.description: Clear all items from a CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO control.

lbcolor.title: lbColor
lbcolor.description: Returns the text color of the item with the given index of the CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO with IDC of the topmost user dialog.

lbcursel.title: lbCurSel
lbcursel.description: Returns the index of the selected item of the CT_LISTBOX, CT_LISTNBOX, CT_COMBO or CT_TOOLBOX. For CT_LISTBOX with multi selection enabled use lbSelection.

returns.desc: Selected index (row) or -1 if nothing is selected
Selected index (row) or -1 if nothing is selected

lbdata.title: lbData
lbdata.description: Returns the data set in given index of the CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO.

lbdelete.title: lbDelete
lbdelete.description: Removes the item with the given index from the CT_LISTBOX, CT_COMBO or CT_TOOLBOX.

lbpicture.title: lbPicture
lbpicture.description: Returns the picture name of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog.

lbsetcolor.title: lbSetColor
lbsetcolor.description: Sets the color of the item (left) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user Dialog to color.

lbsetcursel.title: lbSetCurSel
lbsetcursel.description: Selects the item with the given index in the listbox, listnbox, combobox, xcombobox, xlistbox

lbsetdata.title: lbSetData
lbsetdata.description: Sets the additional text (invisible) in the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given data.

lbsetpicture.title: lbSetPicture
lbsetpicture.description: Sets the left picture in the row with given index of CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO. The picture is searched for in the mission directory, the dtaExt subdirectory of the campaign directory and the dtaExt directory and the data bank (or directory).

lbsetvalue.title: lbSetValue
lbsetvalue.description: Sets the additional value in the row with the given index of a CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO control.

lbsize.title: lbSize
lbsize.description: Returns the number of items in a CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO control. For CT_TOOLBOX size see lnbSize.

lbtext.title: lbText
lbtext.description: Returns the shown text of the item with the given index of the CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO.

lbvalue.title: lbValue
lbvalue.description: Returns the additional integer value of the item with the given index of the CT_LISTBOX or CT_COMBO.

list.title: list
list.description:
List of units that would activate given Trigger.

It returns nothing before the simulation started, i.e. in (undelayed) init.sqf files. Returns a pointer to the trigger's list after the simulation started.
Since this is just a reference this means that the value in your local variable will change as the content of the trigger area changes.
To permanently copy the returned list to a different variable, use  inline_mylist = +(list triggerOne).

The second example can be used inside the trigger (in that case, no need to name your trigger).

The list returned for trigger of type "Not present" is the same as that returned for type "present".

ln.title: ln
ln.description: Returns the natural logarithm of x.  File:A3 lnx figure.jpg400ln(x) and ln(e)

loadfile.title: loadFile
loadfile.description: Returns the content of given files. If you plan to compile said string, be aware that the file should not contain comments or compile will throw an error. If there are comments, use preprocessFile/preprocessFileLineNumbers instead.

loadidentity.title: loadIdentity
loadidentity.description: Loads person's identity from Objects.sav file in campaign directory (from entry name).

loadstatus.title: loadStatus
loadstatus.description: Loads object's properties from Objects.sav file in campaign directory (from entry name).

local.title: local
local.description:
Check if given unit is local on the computer in multiplayer games - see .
This can be used to determine on which computer some code must be run. In single player all objects are local.

syntaxes.code: local variable = value  stylemargin-left: 7em - see private for later versions

localize.title: localize
localize.description: Used to internationalize text messages. The provided translation key is looked up in Stringtable.xml (or Stringtable.csv).

args.name: stringName
args.desc: string which leads to localisation. Casing does not matter. Since  a string starting with "$" is supported

returns.desc: text found in corresponding entry in stringtable file. If the key could not be found an empty string  is returned and an entry is added to .rpt file, for example

lock.title: lock
lock.description:
Lock vehicle (disable mounting / dismounting) for player.
This command will remove user get in/get out actions but will not stop player getting into or out of vehicle via script commands (e.g moveInCargo).

args.name: locked
args.desc: true to lock, false to unlock

args.name:
lockstate: Number - Can be one of the following:
0 - Unlocked
1 - Default (player subordinate cannot enter until his leader says so)
2 - Locked
3 - Locked for player

locked.title: locked
locked.description: Check if vehicle is locked. If it is locked, Persons cannot mount / dismount without order.

lockwp.title: lockWP
lockwp.description: Disable switching to next waypoint (current waypoint will never complete while lockwp is used). Sometimes used during cut-scenes.

log.title: log
log.description: Base-10 logarithm of x. File:A3 logx.jpgThe function of log(x) will never touch the y-axis.

lightattachobject.title: lightAttachObject
