lightattachobject.description: Attach light to given object at given position on object.

linebreak.title: lineBreak
linebreak.description: Creates a structured text containing a line break.

lookat.title: lookAt
lookat.description: Control what the unit(s) is/are looking at (target or Position). If target is used, it will get revealed fully.

magazines.title: magazines
magazines.description: Returns array of type names of all vehicle's magazines. When applied to a unit, the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use currentMagazine to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

args.name: includeEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to include empty magazines

mapanimadd.title: mapAnimAdd
mapanimadd.description: Add next frame to map animation.

args.name: position: Object or Array format Position2D, Position3D

mapanimdone.title: mapAnimDone
mapanimdone.description: Check if map animation is finished.

markercolor.title: markerColor
markercolor.description: Returns marker color for given marker. See also setMarkerColor.

markerpos.title: markerPos
markerpos.description: Returns marker position. See also setMarkerPos.

returns.desc: format PositionAGL if preserveElevation is true or [x, y, 0] if preserveElevation is false

markersize.title: markerSize
markersize.description: Returns marker size. This command is identical to getMarkerSize.

markertype.title: markerType
markertype.description: Gets type of marker. See CfgMarkers for a list of standard markers.

missionname.title: missionName
missionname.description: Return currently loaded mission file (path to mission.pbo, relative to game exe).

missionstart.title: missionStart
missionstart.description: Returns date and time when mission started. Because this command returns the time of the actual start of the mission, it might not be available in pre-init or init, but is guaranteed to be available in post-init when  inlinetime > 0.

mod.title: mod
mod.description: Remainder of a divided by b.

move.title: move
move.description: Let group move to given position. Active waypoints will be ignored when command is used.

moveincargo.title: moveInCargo
moveincargo.description: Moves a unit into a vehicle cargo position (immediately and without animation).

args.name: canReassign
args.desc: (Optional, default true) try to move unit into the first free vehicle cargo seat if cargoIndex is already occupied

moveincommander.title: moveInCommander
moveincommander.description: Move soldier into vehicle commander position (Immediate, no animation).

moveindriver.title: moveInDriver
moveindriver.description: Moves soldier into vehicle driver position (immediate, no animation).

moveingunner.title: moveInGunner
moveingunner.description: Move soldier into vehicle gunner position (Immediate, no animation).

musicvolume.title: musicVolume
musicvolume.description: Returns the current music volume (set by fadeMusic)

moveto.title: moveTo
moveto.description: Low level command to person to move to given position.

movetocompleted.title: moveToCompleted
movetocompleted.description: Check if latest low level moveTo command is finished.

name.title: name
name.description:
When argument is Object, the command returns the name given to a unit using the setIdentity instruction or selected randomly by the game engine if setIdentity has not been used on the unit. If used on vehicle, name of first crew member (in order commander, driver, gunner). If used on an object, "Error: No unit" is being returned.
When argument is Location, the location's name is returned. To return the textual value of a location use text command instead.

nearestbuilding.title: nearestBuilding
nearestbuilding.description: Finds the nearest building to a given object or position. A "building" is defined as an object that is of class "House" and contains a path LOD.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format Position2D or PositionAGL

nearestobject.title: nearestObject
nearestobject.description: Returns the nearest object of given type (or inherited classes) to given position within a sphere. Hardcoded radius is 50 meters. Unlike with nearestObjects, where distance is measured in 2D space, nearestObject will be closest object in 3D space.

args.name: position: Object or Array format Position2D or Position3D - position to start search at
type
args.desc: type of object (see typeOf, class type)

args.name: position: Array format Position2D or Position3D - position to start search at
position: Position3D or Position2D - position to start search at
typeOrId
args.desc: type of object (see typeOf, class type) or Visitor id (see getObjectID) in string format (since Arma 3 v2.10)

args.name: position: Array format Position2D or Position3D - position to start search at

nil.title: nil
nil.description: Nil value. This value can be used to undefine existing variables.

not.title: not
not.description: not a is exactly the same as ! a.

object.title: object
object.description: Returns Object with given id. Object's id can be checked in mission editor.

objstatus.title: objStatus
objstatus.description:
Sets the status of an objective that was defined in briefing.html.

Status may be one of:
* "ACTIVE"
* "FAILED"
* "DONE"
* "HIDDEN"

To refer to an objective that is named "OBJ_1", for example, use only the index number in this command (i.e. "1" objStatus "HIDDEN").

onbriefinggear.title: onBriefingGear
onbriefinggear.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Gear tab is selected in the briefing.

onbriefinggroup.title: onBriefingGroup
onbriefinggroup.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Group tab is selected in the briefing.

onbriefingnotes.title: onBriefingNotes
onbriefingnotes.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Notes tab is selected in the briefing.

onbriefingplan.title: onBriefingPlan
onbriefingplan.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Plan tab is selected in the briefing.

onmapsingleclick.title: onMapSingleClick
onmapsingleclick.description:
Defines the action performed when user clicks in map by executing command string. The code is executed on every click, until the command is 
* removed via  inlineonMapSingleClick "", or
* replaced by  inlineonMapSingleClick "SomeOtherCommand(s)"

In  the code should return true only if you wish to override default engine handling of the mouse click on map (see ).
For older games, when click is processed, code should ultimately return true back to the engine. If false is returned, default processing by the game engine is done.
Return value of any other type (including Nothing) is an error. In such case default processing by the game engine is done, and error message may be displayed.

args.name:
command: String or Code - Code executed on click. The following variables are available:
* _pos: Array - Clicked position
* _units: Array - Units which were selected (via function keys) before opening the map (may be non-functional in Arma)
* _shift: Boolean - Whether  was pressed when clicking on the map
* _alt: Boolean - Whether  was pressed when clicking on the map

command: String or Code - Code executed on click. The following variables are available:
* _this: Anything - Params passed to onMapSingleClick
* _pos: Array - Clicked position
* _units: Array - Units which were selected (via function keys) before opening the map (may be non-functional in Arma)
* _shift: Boolean - Whether  was pressed when clicking on the map
* _alt: Boolean - Whether  was pressed when clicking on the map

ordergetin.title: orderGetIn
ordergetin.description: Force all units in the array to get in or out of their assigned vehicles. Units must be assigned to a vehicle before this command will do anything.

onplayerconnected.title: onPlayerConnected
onplayerconnected.description: This command will execute the provided code on the server whenever a player connects to a multiplayer session.

args.name:
code: String or Code - has access to the following variables:
* _id: Number - is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.
* _uid: String - is getPlayerUID of the joining player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.
* _name: String - is profileName of the joining player.
*  _jip: Boolean - is a flag that indicates whether or not the player joined after the mission has started (Joined In Progress). true when the player is JIP, otherwise false.
*  _owner: Number - is owner id of the joining player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for publicVariableClient.
*  _idstr: String - same as  but in string format, so could be exactly compared to  user marker ids.

onplayerdisconnected.title: onPlayerDisconnected
onplayerdisconnected.description: This command will execute attached code whenever a player is leaving an MP session. The code will receive a number of special variables:

args.name:
code: String or Code - Code executed. The code will receive a number of special variables:
* _id: Number - Is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.
* _uid: String - Is getPlayerUID of the leaving player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.
* _name: String - Is profileName of the leaving player.
*  _jip: Boolean - Is a flag that indicated whether or not the player joined after the mission has started (Joined In Progress). true - if the player was JIP, otherwise false.
*  _owner: Number - Is owner id of the leaving player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for publicVariableClient.
*  _idstr:  String - Same as  but in string format, so could be exactly compared to  user marker ids.

pickweaponpool.title: pickWeaponPool
pickweaponpool.description: Transfers weapons and magazines from cargo of object into the weapon pool. This is used in the campaign to transfer weapons into the next mission.

putweaponpool.title: putWeaponPool
putweaponpool.description: Transfers weapons and magazines from weapon pool into cargo of given object. Used in campaign to transfer weapons into next mission.

playersnumber.title: playersNumber
playersnumber.description: Returns count of occupied role selection slots for given side. Players who claimed a slot in the lobby but did not start the mission are counted as well. If  langcpp inlinedisabledAI = 0; in description.ext or Enable AI option is checked in Eden Editor, AI bots will be treated as valid players and will be counted too.

playmove.title: playMove
playmove.description:
When used on a person, smooth transition to given move will be done.
The difference between playMove and playMoveNow is that playMove adds another move to the move queue, while playMoveNow replaces the whole move queue with new move (see ).

playsound.title: playSound
playsound.description: Plays a sound from CfgSounds. Sound can be defined in missionConfigFile, configFile or campaignConfigFile.

args.name:
isSpeech: Boolean or  Number - (Optional, default false)
* 0/false = play as sound (fadeSound applies)
* 1/true = play as speech (fadeSpeech applies), filters are not applied to it (i.e. house or vehicle interior one)
* 2 = play as sound (fadeSound applies) without interior/vehicle muffling
offset
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same as playMusic

preprocessfile.title: preprocessFile
preprocessfile.description:
Reads and processes the content of the specified file. Preprocessor is C-like, supports comments using  or  and  and PreProcessor Commands.
Due to the hard-drive access this command executes and the lack of caching this command should not be used in time-critical script loops.

args.name: fileName
args.desc: Path to the file and name of the file

primaryweapon.title: primaryWeapon
primaryweapon.description: Returns name of unit's primary weapon. This command will also return a weapon class name if the weapon is not used by the player, for example, it is on the unit's back. Use currentWeapon to get the weapon the unit is using.

returns.desc: Weapon class name or "" if no primary weapon

publicvariable.title: publicVariable
publicvariable.description:
Reliably broadcasts missionNamespace variable and its current value to all computers (server/client).
Variables broadcast with publicVariable during a mission will be available to JIP clients with the value they held at the time.
Such variables are persistent and sent to the JIP client before the first batch of client-side Event Scripts (such as init.sqf) is run.


The following  Data Types are supported:
{! classwikitable align-center
! Type
! Number
! Boolean
! Object
! Group
! String
! Text
! Array
! Code
! Nothing (nil)
! HashMap
!-
! Since
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
!}

parsetext.title: parseText
parsetext.description:
Creates a structured text by parsing the given XML description. Do not use parseText when displaying a localized text from Stringtable.xml.
A detailed explanation of all formatting possibilities can be found at Structured Text.

playmission.title: playMission
playmission.description: The mission is launched (from the main menu). Both campaign and mission are given as their directory name. If the campaign is empty, a single mission is launched. If skipBriefing is true, the intro and briefing are skipped.

playerside.title: playerSide
playerside.description: Returns the player's side. This is valid even when the player controlled person is dead (a difference from side player).

preloadcamera.title: preloadCamera
preloadcamera.description:
Preload all textures and models around given Position to avoid visual artifacts after camera is moved.

Should be used before any abrupt camera change/cut.

Returns true once all data is ready. See camPreload for alternative, more flexible camera preloading.

preloadobject.title: preloadObject
preloadobject.description: Preloads all textures, materials and proxies needed to render given object. Works with objects and classnames - note that classnames require an object instance in the mission.

args.name: distance
args.desc: distance at which preload the object

args.name:
thing: Object or String
* Object - existing object
* String - object classname - an object of that type must exist in the mission for it to have effect

preloadsound.title: preloadSound
preloadsound.description: Makes sure that a sound can start playing without any delay once it is needed. Command works in Arma 3, but might not be implemented in earlier Arma installments.

preloadtitleobj.title: preloadTitleObj
preloadtitleobj.description: Preloads data for the given resource object.

preloadtitlersc.title: preloadTitleRsc
preloadtitlersc.description: Resource title - preload data. The resource can be defined in the Description.ext file.

args.name: name
args.desc: defined in Description.ext for the mission

preprocessfilelinenumbers.title: preprocessFileLineNumbers
preprocessfilelinenumbers.description:
Returns the preprocessed content of the given file. The preprocessor is C-like, it supports comments using /* */ and PreProcessor Commands. The preprocessor also adds a default debug entrypoint for compiler at the begining of script: 

The #line keyword can be used in any script that are not preprocess, or with preprocess script with extra macro to protect reserverd sharp character. The format is:

followed by new line. <number> could be only positive integer and <name> could be any name. This will be used only if an error occurs in the script. The error will contain the line:

where <filename> will be the <name> you set and <linenumber> will be <number> + how many lines it is from the #line line. If the error happened on the line right under #line it will add 0 to <number>, if on second line, it will add 1 etc.
It is possible to use more than one #line keywords, but it seems having just one at the top for little script is enough to pinpoint position of the error easily.

processinitcommands.title: processInitCommands
processinitcommands.description: Process statements stored using setVehicleInit. The statements will only be executed once even if processInitCommands is called multiple times.

rad.title: rad
rad.description: Converts given value in degrees to radians. 1 radian equals 180 degrees divided by pi.

rating.title: rating
rating.description:
Check unit rating. Rating is increased for killing enemies, decreased for killing friendlies (see Rating Values). Can be changed via addRating by the mission designer. 

The rating of the player is displayed as the "score" at the end of the mission. Via Description.ext one can define how many points it takes to get a perfect score, as well as the number of stars.

removeaction.title: removeAction
removeaction.description: Removes user added action with given ID. This only removes actions added with the addAction command. You cannot remove default game actions, such as reload.

removealleventhandlers.title: removeAllEventHandlers
removealleventhandlers.description: Removes all event handlers of given type that were added by addEventHandler and resets event handler's creation index to 0.

removeallweapons.title: removeAllWeapons
removeallweapons.description:
Removes all weapons and magazines from the given unit. Does not remove items like map, compass, radio (see removeWeapon for this).
Doesn't quite work with vehicles. If you need to remove all weapons from a vehicle, remove each weapon individually (see removeWeapon).

removeeventhandler.title: removeEventHandler
removeeventhandler.description: Removes a given Event Handler that was added with addEventHandler.

args.name: type
args.desc: see Event Handlers for the full list of available options

args.name: index
args.desc: the value originally returned by addEventHandler

removemagazines.title: removeMagazines
removemagazines.description: Removes all magazines of given type from the unit. If magazine class does not exist, nothing happens, not even .rpt message, unlike with addMagazine command.

removeweapon.title: removeWeapon
removeweapon.description:
Remove weapon from a unit. The unit must be local to the computer where command is executed. For a global version of this command see removeWeaponGlobal.

Note: It is possible to create invalid combinations with this command (ie, attempting to remove a weapon that a unit does not possess). When doing so, application behaviour is undefined.

requiredversion.title: requiredVersion
requiredversion.description:
Check if version of application is available. If the current version is older than the required one, a warning message is shown and false is returned. 

Version of format Major.Minor, e.g. 1.30

resistance.title: resistance
resistance.description: Pre-defined variable for the resistance side.

resize.title: resize
resize.description:
Changes the size of the given array. The command does not return new array, it resizes the source array to the desired number of elements.
If the new size is bigger than the current size, the new places are filled with nil. The  allows to fill resized positions with a given value. Array and HashMap values are copied.

reveal.title: reveal
reveal.description: Reveals a target to a group. If toWhom is a unit, unit's group is considered. If toWhom is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.  The knowledge value will be set to the highest level any unit of the revealing side has about the revealed target. If the revealing side has no knowledge about the revealed target, the value will be set to 1.

args.name: toWhom: Object or Group - which receives revealing information
toWhom: Object or Group  which receives revealing information

radiovolume.title: radioVolume
radiovolume.description: Returns the current radio volume (set by fadeRadio).

respawnvehicle.title: respawnVehicle
respawnvehicle.description:
Sets vehicle as respawnable in MP game. The vehicle will be spawned at the locality and coordinates it was prior to destruction.
If respawn type is set to base respawn (type 3) and vehicle respawn marker is provided (respawn_vehicle_XXXSIDEXXX), vehicle will spawn on the marker.

args.name: delay
args.desc: delay in seconds between respawns. (-1 to use respawnDelay from description.ext)

args.name: count
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) how many times to respawn vehicle in total. (0 - unlimited respawns)

runinitscript.title: runInitScript
runinitscript.description: Fades in mission screen and re-executes init.sqf and init.sqs scripts. In Eden Editor the code inside the "Init" mission attribute is executed.

savegame.title: saveGame
savegame.description: Autosaves the game (used for Retry). The saving is not started immediately, the request for autosave is made instead. To check the status of the request, use isSaving. The game can then be loaded from the last autosave with loadGame. Will not save if the player is  null or dead.

saveidentity.title: saveIdentity
saveidentity.description: Saves units's identity to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

savestatus.title: saveStatus
savestatus.description: Saves object's properties to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

tan.title: tan
tan.description: Tangent of x, argument in Degrees.

textlog.title: textLog
textlog.description: Dump argument value to debugging output.

then.title: then
then.description:
Links an If Type with Code to be executed if said If Type's condition is true; otherwise, "else" code is executed if provided.
The alternative syntax allows to set "then" code and "else" code in one array.

args.name:
thenCode: Code or Array of Code. Can be one of:
* Code - code block to execure if ifType's condition is true
* Array of Code- array of two code elements in format [thenCode, elseCode]; see

time.title: time
time.description: Returns time elapsed since mission started (in seconds). The value is different on each client. If you need unified time, use serverTime.

args.name: text
args.desc: text to be displayed on screen

args.name: type
args.desc: can be one of Title Effect Types

titleobj.title: titleObj
titleobj.description: Shows object defined in global config in CfgTitles

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

titlersc.title: titleRsc
titlersc.description: Displays a resource defined in RscTitles. Also see cutRsc, with these two commands you can show two different resources at once.

args.name: text
args.desc: The class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)

args.name: type
args.desc: Can be: "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) |False to hide the text when the map is opened.

titletext.title: titleText
titletext.description:
Displays text across the screen. If used along with cutText two different texts (in different type styles) can be shown at once.
The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "\n" new line characters (see ).

args.name: type
args.desc: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) time in seconds to fade in resource

args.name: showInMap
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to hide the text when the map is opened

args.name: isStructuredText
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to switch support for Structured Text formatting - see

typeof.title: typeOf
typeof.description: Returns the class name of a given object.

returns.desc: config class name, or empty string if obj does not have a class

triggerattachobject.title: triggerAttachObject
triggerattachobject.description: Assigns a static object to the trigger. The activation source is changed to "STATIC".

triggerattachvehicle.title: triggerAttachVehicle
triggerattachvehicle.description:
Specifies the entity which will activate the selected trigger.
*If [] is given, the trigger is decoupled from the assigned vehicle (example 2).
*If the activation source is "VEHICLE", "GROUP", "LEADER" or "MEMBER", it is changed to "NONE". 
*If [vehicle] is given, the trigger is coupled to the vehicle or its group. 
*When the source is "GROUP", "LEADER" or "MEMBER", it is coupled to the group, otherwise it is coupled to the vehicle and the source is changed to "VEHICLE".

unassignvehicle.title: unassignVehicle
unassignvehicle.description:
Unassigns individual unit from a vehicle, usually previously assigned with assignAsXXX command, i.e removes assignedVehicleRole of the unit.
If the unit is currently in that vehicle, the group leader will issue an order to disembark.

unitready.title: unitReady
unitready.description: Check if the unit is ready. Unit is busy when it is given some command like move, until the command is finished.

unassignteam.title: unassignTeam
unassignteam.description: Unassigns the unit (in the case of a vehicle its commander unit) from his team. This is equal to unit assignTeam "MAIN".

vehicle.title: vehicle
vehicle.description: Vehicle in which given unit is mounted. If none, unit is returned. Alternatively, use objectParent

vehiclechat.title: vehicleChat
vehiclechat.description: Types text to the vehicle radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally, see remoteExec.

vehicleradio.title: vehicleRadio
vehicleradio.description: Sends the audio message to the vehicle radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

velocity.title: velocity
velocity.description: Returns the velocity of the object as vector in m/s.

vectordir.title: vectorDir
vectordir.description:
Returns object direction vector in world space ().

* A unit facing North would return 
* A unit facing East would return 
* A unit facing South would return 
* A unit facing West would return

vectorup.title: vectorUp
vectorup.description: Returns up vector of the given object in format Vector3D.

weapons.title: weapons
weapons.description: Returns array of names of all unit's weapons.

while.title: while
while.description: Repeats Code while the given condition is true. A part of while-do construct.

waypointattachvehicle.title: waypointAttachVehicle
waypointattachvehicle.description: Attaches the Waypoint to the provided vehicle Object.

weapondirection.title: weaponDirection
weapondirection.description: Returns the direction that the vehicle weapon is aiming in. For addons the weapon name must be an entry in CfgWeapons.

savevar.title: saveVar
savevar.description:
Save variable value into the campaign space.
This variable is available to all following missions in the campaign.

say.title: say
say.description:
Make unit say given sound. The sound is defined in CfgSounds.
If the unit is a person, it will also perform the corresponding lipsync effect provided an appropriate .lip file has been created for this sound.

* A dead or non-existent unit obviously cannot say anything.
* If the camera is not within given range, title is not shown and the sound will not be heard.
* See also playSound in order to play a sound wherever the camera/player is.

args.name:
from: Object or Array of Objects
* Object - the sound source
* Array - format [from, to]:
** from: Object - sound source
** to: Object - target

sound: String or Array
* String - class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including Description.ext
* Array - format [sound, maxTitlesDistance, speed]:
** sound: String - class name of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including Description.ext
** maxTitlesDistance: Number (Optional, default 100) - max. distance in meters at which the sound can be heard
** speed: Number (Optional, default 1) - pitch of the sound

score.title: score
score.description: Returns the person's score in MP.

scudstate.title: scudState
scudstate.description: Return the current state of given Scud launcher.

secondaryweapon.title: secondaryWeapon
secondaryweapon.description: Returns the name of a unit's secondary weapon (launcher). To detect the weapon which is currently being used by the unit use currentWeapon.

returns.desc: Class name of the secondary weapon or  inline"" if none available

args.name: muzzleName
args.desc: Name of the weapon or muzzle

args.name: unit
args.desc: person. This argument has to be local, or it can be remote when executed on the server

args.name: weapon
args.desc: Name of the weapon, personal or vehicle's weapon (see weaponState)

args.name: muzzle
args.desc: Name of the selected muzzle (see weaponState)

set.title: set
set.description: Changes the element at the given zero-based index of the array.

args.name: index
args.desc: 0 based array index. Since Arma 3 v2.11.149734 negative index can be used to select from the end of the array, i.e. -1 means last array element.

args.name: insertOnly
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if set to true, set the value only if the key does not exist already

returns.desc: False if the key is new to the hashmap, true if a value got overwritten

setacctime.title: setAccTime
setacctime.description: Set simulation acceleration coefficient. May also be used to slow time in cutscenes.

switchmove.title: switchMove
switchmove.description:
Immediately applies given animation to the unit. For a smooth transition from the current animation, use playMove.

This command first resets the unit's animation states (including aiming state, gesture state, etc.) then puts the unit in the first frame of the animation (therefore showing no transition).
If an invalid animation is provided, the unit's animations will be reset but no new animation will be played (see ).

switchlight.title: switchLight
switchlight.description: Controls whether a lamp is lit or not.

args.name: mode
args.desc: Mode can be: "ON", "OFF" or "AUTO" (lamp is on only during nighttime, default)

switchcamera.title: switchCamera
switchcamera.description:
Switch camera to given vehicle / camera. Mode is one of:
* "INTERNAL": 1st person
* "GUNNER": optics / sights
* "EXTERNAL": 3rd person
* "GROUP": group
* "CARGO": same as "INTERNAL"

If you switch to a unit in a vehicle, this command uses the correct turret.

stopped.title: stopped
stopped.description: Check if unit is stopped by stop command.

stop.title: stop
stop.description:
Stop an AI unit from turning or moving, preventing it to follow a watched object or engage an enemy properly - although if properly aligned, the unit -will- shoot the enemy.
It may still change the stance if deemed appropriate (e.g. under fire). Use disableAI to disable specific AI capabilities.

speedmode.title: speedMode
speedmode.description:
Returns speed mode of the group, which can be any of the following: 
* "LIMITED"
* "NORMAL"
* "FULL"

speed.title: speed
speed.description: Object speed (in km/h). Returns relative speed of given object along Y axis. An equivalent to:  inline3.6 * (velocityModelSpace _obj select 1)

soundvolume.title: soundVolume
soundvolume.description: Returns the current sound volume (set by fadeSound).

someammo.title: someAmmo
someammo.description: Check if unit has some ammo.

sliderspeed.title: sliderSpeed
sliderspeed.description: Returns slider step value for line and page movement of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER.

args.name: idc: Number: Idc of the control

slidersetspeed.title: sliderSetSpeed
slidersetspeed.description:
Sets slider line step and page step delta amount as well as optional step amount of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER with given idc of topmost user dialog. 
* Click to arrow - move by line
* Click to scale outside thumb - move by page.

args.name: line
args.desc: value delta to move the slider when clicking on the outer arrows

args.name: page
args.desc: value delta to move the slider when clicking inside the slider bar

args.name: line
args.desc: value delta to move the slider when clicking on the outer arrows

args.name: page
args.desc: value delta to move the slider when clicking inside the slider bar

slidersetrange.title: sliderSetRange
slidersetrange.description: Sets limits of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER.

slidersetposition.title: sliderSetPosition
slidersetposition.description: Sets current thumb position of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER.

sliderrange.title: sliderRange
sliderrange.description: Returns limits of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER.

sliderposition.title: sliderPosition
sliderposition.description: Returns current thumb position of CT_SLIDER or CT_XSLIDER with given idc of topmost user dialog.

skiptime.title: skipTime
skiptime.description: Jumps the specified number of hours forward or backward.The time of day and tides are adjusted, but no changes are made to any units. If present, the lower level of clouds instantly jump to the position they would be in if time had passed normally.

args.name: duration
args.desc: Hours to skip. A positive value will create a forward time jump, a negative value will jump backwards.

skill.title: skill
skill.description: Returns current skill of a unit, in range between 0 to 1, 1 being the highest level of skill.

sideradio.title: sideRadio
sideradio.description: Sends the audio message to the side radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

args.name: side
args.desc: side to which the transmission will be played

args.name: identity
args.desc: class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in  are:

sidechat.title: sideChat
sidechat.description: Types text to the side radio channel by the specified unit.

args.name: side
args.desc: Side to which the message will be seen

args.name: identity
args.desc: Class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in  are:

side.title: side
side.description:
Returns the side of a unit, vehicle, object or location.
* side of a renegade soldier is sideEnemy
* side of an empty vehicle is civilian
* side of a crewed vehicle is, if present, commander's > gunner's > driver's or > cargo's side, in this order
* side of a captive or dead unit is civilian. Use  inlineside group _unit to get the underlying side (see )
* you can use playerSide to know the real player's side

showwatch.title: showWatch
showwatch.description: Shows or hides the watch on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true)

showradio.title: showRadio
showradio.description: Shows or hides the radio on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true).

showpad.title: showPad
showpad.description: Shows or hides the notebook on the map screen, if enabled for the mission. (default true). It is no longer relevant to Arma 2.

shownwatch.title: shownWatch
shownwatch.description: Checks if client has Watch enabled in description.ext (showWatch param) or force enabled with showWatch command.

shownwarrant.title: shownWarrant
shownwarrant.description: Check if player has ID card enabled. Obsolete command.

shownradio.title: shownRadio
shownradio.description: Check if player has Radio enabled.

shownpad.title: shownPad
shownpad.description: Checks if client has Notepad enabled.

shownmap.title: shownMap
shownmap.description: Checks if client has Map enabled in description.ext (showMap param) or force enabled with showMap command.

showncompass.title: shownCompass
showncompass.description: Checks if client has Compass enabled in description.ext (showCompass param) or force enabled with showCompass command.

setammocargo.title: setAmmoCargo
setammocargo.description:
Set amount of ammo resources in cargo space of a rearm vehicle. Ammo resource is used to resupply vehicles that take ammo. Soldiers use individual magazines instead. Amount: 1 is full cargo.

The actual quantity to work with is determined by the model's class in CfgVehicles

setcaptive.title: setCaptive
setcaptive.description:
Mark a unit as captive. If unit is a vehicle, commander is marked. A captive unit:
* is seen as belonging to the civilian side
* will not be fired upon
* will still shoot at its real side's enemies
* will not get its weapons removed (see removeAllWeapons)
* will not trigger "detected by" conditions for its original side.

args.name: statusNumber:  Number - Zero means non-captive, a non-zero value means captive. See captiveNum

setcombatmode.title: setCombatMode
setcombatmode.description:
Sets AI  group combat mode (engagement rules). For individual unit's combat mode see setUnitCombatMode. Mode may be one of the following: 
*  : Never fire, keep formation
*  : Hold fire, keep formation
*  : Hold fire, engage at will/loose formation
*  : Fire at will, keep formation
*  : Fire at will, engage at will/loose formation
See Combat Modes for more information on combat modes.

args.name: group: Group or Object - If the argument is unit Object, unit's current group is used.

setdamage.title: setDamage
setdamage.description:
{! classwikitable float-right align-center-col-2
!+ 
! 
! Triggered
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!}

Sets the damage (or lack thereof) of an object/unit. The alternative syntax allows to skip destruction effects for vehicles and buildings.

args.name: useEffects: Boolean (Optional, default true) - false to skip destruction effects

killer: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The entity that caused the damage. If the damage leads to the death of the unit, the killer will be used as the object that caused the kill.
* it can be used to show "killed by player" in debriefing statistics and kill messages in the chat (if death messages are enabled).
* it will alter the killer's rating as if the killer directly killed the unit
* it will be listed as  inline_killer parameter in the Killed event handler
* MP restricted similar to setShotParents, will be ignored unless executed on the server or headless client in MP

instigator: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The person that instigated the damage.
* if a tank is a killer, the tank gunner that pulled the trigger is instigator
* it will be listed as  inline_instigator parameter in the Killed event handler
* MP restricted similar to setShotParents, will be ignored unless executed on the server or headless client in MP
** the above MP restriction does not apply to trees, poles and walls

setdammage.title: setDammage
setdammage.description: Damages/hurts or repairs/heals object/unit. Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.

showcinemaborder.title: showCinemaBorder
showcinemaborder.description: Forces drawing of cinema borders when using custom camera camCreate. This is normally used in cutscenes to indicate player has no control.

showcompass.title: showCompass
showcompass.description: Shows or hides the compass on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default true)

setviewdistance.title: setViewDistance
setviewdistance.description:
Set rendering distance. Setting view distance to <= 0 resets the value to the client's options (set in ).

setvelocity.title: setVelocity
setvelocity.description: Sets velocity vector of an object in m/s.

setunitpos.title: setUnitPos
setunitpos.description:
Set unit position rules. This command will not change the stance of the human player, even though it will change the output of unitPos command. To change player stance use playAction or playActionNow:
player playAction "PlayerProne"; // DOWN
player playAction "PlayerStand"; // UP
player playAction "PlayerCrouch"; // MIDDLE

args.name:
mode: String - Can be:
* "DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.
* "UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.
* "MIDDLE" - Kneel Position.  - Unit will not kneel if it is unarmed
* "AUTO" - Unit chooses mode according to circumstances.

setterraingrid.title: setTerrainGrid
setterraingrid.description: Sets the desired  terrain resolution in meters.

args.name:
grid: Number - For default landscapes the supported resolutions are: 

* 50 - smoothest, less lag
* 25 - default in multiplayer
* 12.5 - default in single player
* 6.25
* 3.125 - bumpiest, higher lag

setspeedmode.title: setSpeedMode
setspeedmode.description:
Sets group speed mode. If unit is passed as param, unit's group is used. Mode may be one of: 
* "UNCHANGED" (unchanged)
* "LIMITED" (half speed)
* "NORMAL" (full speed, maintain formation)
* "FULL" (do not wait for any other units in formation)

setskill.title: setSkill
setskill.description: Sets the skill level of given unit. The value of a sub-skill is interpolated into a range defined in CfgAISkill.

setrepaircargo.title: setRepairCargo
setrepaircargo.description:
Set amount of repair resources in cargo space of repair vehicle.
Amount 1 is full cargo.

setrain.title: setRain
setrain.description:
Sets rain density smoothly over the given transition time. A transition time of zero means an immediate change.
A rain density of zero is no rain, one is maximum rain. Rain is not possible when overcast is less than 0.7.

args.name: time
args.desc: transition time in seconds to the new value

args.name: rainParams
args.desc: array of custom   params - see rainParams. Use empty array [] to reset to default config values

args.name: config
args.desc: config path to a custom class, which contains   class. Use configNull to reset to default config values

setradiomsg.title: setRadioMsg
setradiomsg.description: Sets radio trigger menu title text (0 -> 0 -> map radio). Use "NULL" to disable radio slot. Use "" to restore default title

args.name:
index: Number - from 1 to 10

* 1 - Alpha (key 1)
* 2 - Bravo (key 2)
* 3 - Charlie (key 3)
* 4 - Delta (key 4)
* 5 - Echo (key 5)
* 6 - Foxtrot (key 6)
* 7 - Golf (key 7)
* 8 - Hotel (key 8)
* 9 - India (key 9)
* 10 - Juliet (key 0)

setpos.title: setPos
setpos.description: Sets object position to format PositionAGLS (over surface). The Z value is used to calculate the nearest surface below the provided position. If the surface is close, it uses the Z position of the surface. Otherwise, Z value becomes the offset from that surface.

args.name: pos
args.desc: position in format PositionAGL or Position2D, in which case Z will be set to 0

setovercast.title: setOvercast
setovercast.description:
Set overcast to given value smoothly during given time (in seconds). Zero time means immediate change.
An overcast setting of zero means clear (sunny) weather, and one means storms and rain are very likely. Higher overcast values also result in higher wind speeds.

setobjecttexture.title: setObjectTexture
setobjecttexture.description: Applies given texture to object's selection. See Retexturing with setObjectTexture for a short tutorial.

args.name: selection: Number or  String - Index of the selection. It is defined in the hiddenSelections array in the vehicle's config (starting with 0). If a string is given, it referes to a hiddenSelection name or clan selection instead of an index.

setmimic.title: setMimic
setmimic.description: Sets person's facial expression. To set it back to default, use "".

args.name:
mimic: String - can be one of:
{!
! stylepadding-right: 2em  Before Arma 2 OA v1.6x !! stylefont-size: small  Since Arma 2 OA v1.6x
!-
! stylevertical-align: top 
* "Default"
* "Normal"
* "Smile"
* "Hurt"
* "Ironic"
* "Sad"
* "Cynic"
* "Surprised"
* 
* "Angry"
! stylevertical-align: top 
* "neutral"
* "dead"
* "danger"
* "hurt"
* "aware"
* "safe"
* "combat"
* "unconscious"
!}

setmarkertype.title: setMarkerType
setmarkertype.description: Sets marker type. Marker type is a class name from CfgMarkers.

setmarkerpos.title: setMarkerPos
setmarkerpos.description: Moves the marker. If position is given in 3D format,  coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like createVehicle, createUnit, createAgent, createMine, setVehiclePosition for example. When Object is used for position, its getPosWorld is used.

args.name: pos: Array format Position2D or PositionAGL or  Object - object's model centre's position is used (see getPosWorld)

setmarkercolor.title: setMarkerColor
setmarkercolor.description: Sets marker color. Marker color names and their corresponding RGBA values for Arma 3 could be found here: Arma 3: CfgMarkerColors

setidentity.title: setIdentity
setidentity.description:
Sets identity of a person. The identities could be defined in a custom config in Description.ext or in the main config. For a list of available main config values see CfgIdentities.
 
This command is an aggregate of the following commands: setName, setFace, setSpeaker, setNameSound, setPitch, only the values are loaded from the given config. It also includes value for glasses for which currently there is no direct command, instead there is an inventory command addGoggles.

args.name: person
args.desc: unit to which the identity will be applied

args.name: identity
args.desc: name of the subclass in CfgIdentities

setgroupid.title: setGroupId
setgroupid.description:
Sets the group radio callsign, how it will be displayed in radio chat. Two groups on the same side cannot have the same callsign (possible on different sides) - see .
The identity setup can consist of format keywords (marked with %) and param keywords taken from CfgWorlds config.
Formatting is almost like using the format command but with some special group keywords (see ).

<spoiler text="Show Arma 3 values table">
{! classwikitable
! %GroupSquad
! %GroupPlatoon
! %GroupCompany
! %GroupNames
! %GroupColors
!- stylevertical-align: top
!
* "Squad1" → 1
* "Squad2" → 2
* "Squad3" → 3
* "Squad4" → 4
!
* "Platoon1" → 1
* "Platoon2" → 2
* "Platoon3" → 3
* "Platoon4" → 4
!

!

!
* "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
* "GroupColor1" → Black
* "GroupColor2" → Red
* "GroupColor3" → Green
* "GroupColor4" → Blue
* "GroupColor5" → Yellow
* "GroupColor6" → Orange
* "GroupColor7" → Pink
* "Six" → Six
!}
</spoiler>
<spoiler text="Show OFP values table">
{! classwikitable
! Letter
! Colour
!- stylevertical-align: top
!

!
* "GroupColor0" → (nothing)
* "GroupColor1" → Black
* "GroupColor2" → Red
* "GroupColor3" → Green
* "GroupColor4" → Blue
* "GroupColor5" → Yellow
* "GroupColor6" → Orange
* "GroupColor7" → Pink
* "Six" → Six
!}
</spoiler>

setfuelcargo.title: setFuelCargo
setfuelcargo.description: Sets fuel amount in cargo space of refuel vehicles. Note that the carrying capacity of each side's refuel trucks differ.

setformdir.title: setFormDir
setformdir.description: Sets group formation heading. Accepted heading range is 0 to 360. Formation is facing this direction unless enemy is seen. When group is moving, this value is overridden by movement direction. If the new direction is noticeably different from the old direction (approx +/- 15 degrees), units will change positions changing formationDirection.

setfog.title: setFog
setfog.description: Smoothly change the fog over given time (in seconds). See also fogParams.

args.name: time
args.desc: transition time to the new value

args.name: time
args.desc: transition time to the new value

args.name: fogValue
args.desc: normal fog value that represents fog density at fogBase level. Range 0..1

args.name: fogDecay
args.desc: decay of fog density with altitude. Range -1..1

args.name: fogBase
args.desc: base altitude (ASL) of fog (in meters). Range -5000..5000

args.name:
texture: String - flag texture. If texture is , flag is not drawn. Custom texture can be used:
* Prior : Dimension 200x200, file extension .jpg
* Since : Dimension 512×256, file extension .paa

setflagside.title: setFlagSide
setflagside.description: Sets flag Side. A flag may be taken by any unit that is enemy to the side that owns the flag. Just like with setFlagTexture, if the command executed where unit is local effect of the command will be global and JIP compatible.

setflagowner.title: setFlagOwner
setflagowner.description: Sets flag owner. When owner is set to objNull or any object other than a unit of class man or logic, flag is returned to the flagpole. A flag owned by a logic has no visual representation.

setfaceanimation.title: setFaceAnimation
setfaceanimation.description: Sets facial animation phase (eye blinking), blink is in the range from  to .

setface.title: setFace
setface.description: Set person's face. For a list of available faces, check :Category:CfgIdentities.

setdir.title: setDir
setdir.description: Sets object heading. Angles are measured in degrees clockwise from north; the regular range goes from 0 to 360 (0° = N, 90° = E, 180° = S, 270° = W). Negative angles represent counter-clockwise angles.

scriptdone.title: scriptDone
scriptdone.description: Check if a script is finished running using the Script Handle returned by execVM or spawn.

args.name: handle: Script Handle - handle returned by spawn or execVM

selectleader.title: selectLeader
selectleader.description: Select the group's leader. Group locality can be checked with local command and group ownership with groupOwner command.

selectplayer.title: selectPlayer
selectplayer.description:
Move player into given unit. Some usage advices:
* Avoid using selectPlayer on editor-placed units in multiplayer, as it may, on occasion, lead to some undefined behaviour.
* If you need to selectPlayer into another unit, consider creating a unit dynamically.

sendsimplecommand.title: sendSimpleCommand
sendsimplecommand.description:
Sends a simple command to the vehicle's driver / gunner (air vehicles ignore it). See also vehicleMoveInfo.

{! classvalign-top
! stylewidth: 33%  Gunner commands
! stylewidth: 33%  Driver Move commands
! Driver Turn commands
!-
!
* 
* 
* 
* 
* 
!
*  - move forward
*  - move forward, fast
*  - move forward, slow
*  - stop moving forward or backward
*  - move backward
* 
* 
* 
* 
!
*  - turn left, while moving or not
*  - turn right, while moving or not
*   cancel turning (special case, normally would be called by the engine when LEFT or RIGHT turn key is released by the player)
!}

setattributes.title: setAttributes
setattributes.description: Returns a Structured Text created from the given structured text and sets  attributes to the given values.

args.name: text: String or Structured Text - only passing Structured Text has any effect

setcameraeffect.title: setCameraEffect
setcameraeffect.description: Applies an effect to the current camera of the player.

args.name: triggerOrWaypoint: Object or Array format Waypoint

type: String - Effect type (a subclass of CfgCameraEffects.Array)
{! classwikitable
! Effect
! Position
!-
! stylevertical-align: top 

! stylevertical-align: top 

!}

setcamerainterest.title: setCameraInterest
setcamerainterest.description: Set camera interest for given entity. Camera interest is by default 0. Any unit which is speaking has its camera interest raised to 50. Camera interest is used to focus camera to control depth of field in cutscenes. Combination of camera interest, unit position of the screen, unit movement, unit type, and some other properties is used to determine which unit to focus at. Higher camera interest increases the chance of the unit being focused.

setdate.title: setDate
setdate.description: Sets mission date and time. Players joining after mission start will get the current server date including the year.

setdropinterval.title: setDropInterval
setdropinterval.description:
Set interval of emitting particles from particle source. In Arma 3 hardcoded limit of how many particles can exist at the same time is . Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param name and command param:
particleSource setDropInterval interval;

seteffectcondition.title: setEffectCondition
seteffectcondition.description:
The statement is executed when the trigger or waypoint is activated and the effects are launched depending on the result.

*If the result is a boolean and true, the effect is launched.
*If the result is an object, the effect is launched if the result is the player or the player vehicle.
*If the result is an array, the effect is launched if the result contains the player or the player vehicle.

setfriend.title: setFriend
setfriend.description: Sets how friendly a side is with another. The friendliness is set for one side, not for the other.  See also Side relations.

args.name: value
args.desc: a value smaller than 0.6 results in being enemy, otherwise side1 is friendly to side2

setlightambient.title: setLightAmbient
setlightambient.description: Set ambient color of light. This includes surfaces that face away from the light, unlike setLightColor.

setlightcolor.title: setLightColor
setlightcolor.description: Set diffuse color of light. Illuminates surfaces that are facing the light.

setmarkerbrush.title: setMarkerBrush
setmarkerbrush.description:
Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.


brush can be:
* "Solid"
* "SolidFull" (A3 only)
* "Horizontal"
* "Vertical"
* "Grid"
* "FDiagonal"
* "BDiagonal"
* "DiagGrid"
* "Cross"
* "Border"  (Not present in A1)
* "SolidBorder"  (Not present in A1)

setmarkerdir.title: setMarkerDir
setmarkerdir.description: Sets the orientation of the marker. Angle is in degrees.

setmarkershape.title: setMarkerShape
setmarkershape.description: Selects shape (actual type) of the marker.

args.name:
shape: String - The shape, can be one of:
* 
* 
* 
*

setmarkertext.title: setMarkerText
setmarkertext.description: Sets the text label of an existing marker.

setmusiceffect.title: setMusicEffect
setmusiceffect.description:
Defines a music track played on activation. If another track is playing already, this will stop it and start the new track.

Track is a subclass name of CfgMusic. In addition, "$STOP$" (stops the current music track) or use .
When used in a trigger, the track starts on activation but does not automatically stop on deactivation.

setparticlecircle.title: setParticleCircle
setparticlecircle.description: Updates particle source, creates particles in circle with given radius. Velocity is transformed and added to total velocity.

args.name: velocity: Array of Number - in format [X, Y, Z]

setparticleparams.title: setParticleParams
setparticleparams.description:
Set parameters to particle source. Array is in format ParticleArray. 

Since Arma 3 version 1.11.114706 you can use this command to overwrite many values set by setParticleClass, particularity those defined in ParticleArray. Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:
particleSource setParticleParams
[
	/*
		String or Array - If string then the name of the particleShape. And following default values are used:
			particleFSNtieth = 1
			particleFSIndex = 0
			particleFSFrameCount = 1
			particleFSLoop = 1
	*/
	[
		particleShape,			/* String */
		particleFSNtieth,		/* Number */
		particleFSIndex,		/* Number */
		particleFSFrameCount,	/* Number */
		particleFSLoop			/* Optional - Number. Default: 1 */
	],
	animationName,				/* String */
	particleType,				/* String - Enum: Billboard, SpaceObject */
	timerPeriod,				/* Number */
	lifeTime,					/* Number */
	pos3D,						/* 3D Array of numbers as relative position to particleSource or (if object at index 18 is set) object. 
									Or (if object at index 18 is set) String as memoryPoint of object. */
	moveVelocity,				/* 3D Array of numbers. */
	rotationVelocity,			/* Number */
	weight,						/* Number */
	volume,						/* Number */
	rubbing,					/* Number */
	sizeOverLifetime,			/* Array of Numbers */
	color,						/* Array of Array of RGBA Numbers */
	animationSpeed,				/* Array of Number */
	randomDirectionPeriod,		/* Number */
	randomDirectionIntensity,	/* Number */
	onTimerScript,				/* String */
	beforeDestroyScript,		/* String */
	obj,						/* Object */
	angle,						/* Optional Number - Default: 0 */
	onSurface,					/* Optional Boolean */
	bounceOnSurface,			/* Optional Number */
	emissiveColor,				/* Optional Array of Array of RGBA Numbers */
	vectorDirOrVectorDirAndUp	/* Optional vector dir or [vectorDir, vectorUp]
		Since Arma 3 v1.92 it is possible to set the initial direction of the SpaceObject
		Since Arma 3 v2.12 it is possible to use a [vectorDir, vectorUp] array */
];

setparticlerandom.title: setParticleRandom
setparticlerandom.description:
Sets randomization of particle source parameters. Correspondence between CfgCloudlets class param names and command array of params:
particleSource setParticleRandom
[
	lifeTimeVar,
	positionVar,
	moveVelocityVar,
	rotationVelocityVar,
	sizeVar,
	colorVar,
	randomDirectionPeriodVar,
	randomDirectionIntensityVar,
	angleVar,
	bounceOnSurfaceVar
];

syntaxes.code: particleSource setParticleRandom [lifeTime, position, moveVelocity, rotationVelocity, size, color, directionPeriod, directionIntensity, angle, bounceOnSurface]

args.name: position: Array of Number - In format [randomX, randomY, randomZ]
moveVelocity: Array of Number - In format [randomX, randomY, randomZ]

setposasl.title: setPosASL
setposasl.description: Sets the object position above sea level. Given position must be in PositionASL format.

setsoundeffect.title: setSoundEffect
setsoundeffect.description: Defines the different sound effects for a trigger or a waypoint. To stop any sound, deactivate the trigger (might take up to 0.5 seconds to stop) or delete the trigger/waypoint (immediate).

args.name: sound
args.desc: Plays a 2D sound as if playSound was used from CfgSounds (mission or main config). Use  for an empty sound

args.name: voice
args.desc: Attaches a 3D sound from CfgSounds (mission or main config) to the object that activated the trigger and plays it as if say3D was used

args.name: soundEnv
args.desc: Plays an environmental sound from CfgEnvSounds (mission or main config)

args.name: soundDet
args.desc: Creates a dynamic sound object attached to a trigger defined in CfgSFX (mission or main config)

args.name: sound
args.desc: Plays a 2D sound as if playSound was used from CfgSounds (mission or main config)

args.name: voice
args.desc: Attaches a 3D sound from CfgSounds (mission or main config) to the object that activated the trigger and plays it as if say3D was used

settargetage.title: setTargetAge
settargetage.description:
Sets how the target is known to the other centers. They behave like the target was seen age seconds ago.

Possible age values are: "ACTUAL", "5 MIN", "10 MIN", "15 MIN", "30 MIN", "60 MIN", "120 MIN" or "UNKNOWN".

settitleeffect.title: setTitleEffect
settitleeffect.description:
Defines the title effect to show on activation via [Type, Effect, Text] where

'Type' 

The title effect does not disappear on deactivation, this should be done manually if required.

args.name: triggerOrWaypoint: Object or Array format Waypoint

type: String - can be one of:
* "NONE"
* "OBJECT"
** text defines the shown object , a subclass of  (see cutObj)
** effect defines Title Effect Type
* "RES"
** text defines a resource class, a subclass of RscTitles (see cutRsc)
** effect defines Title Effect Type
* "TEXT"
** text defines text string to show (see cutText)
** effect defines Title Effect Type

settriggeractivation.title: setTriggerActivation
settriggeractivation.description:
Defines the trigger activation type. 

See ArmA:Mission Editor - Triggers for a thorough overview of triggers and its fields for activation, effects, etc.   Since Arma 3 v1.67, "ANYPLAYER" activation can be used to detect any player.

args.name:
by: String - Who activates trigger. Can be  or
* Side:  (Since Arma 3 v1.67)
* Radio:
* Object: 
* Status:

type: String -  How trigger is it activated. Can be:
* Presence: 
* Detection:

settriggerarea.title: setTriggerArea
settriggerarea.description: Image:setTriggerArea.jpg300Trigger axis a, b and c (half of their x, y and z dimensions) Defines the area monitored by the given trigger. The area could be either rectangular or elliptical.

syntaxes.code: trigger setTriggerArea [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

args.name: a
args.desc: trigger area X size / 2, in meters

args.name: b
args.desc: trigger area Y size / 2, in meters

args.name: c
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) trigger area Z size / 2, in meters. -1 for infinite height

settriggerstatements.title: setTriggerStatements
settriggerstatements.description: Defines trigger condition, activation and deactivation statements. Trigger condition has to return Boolean. true will activate the trigger, false will deactivate it (only if activation is set to repeat). thisList returns the same result as list command, which includes all entities in the trigger area that are capable of activating the trigger. Dead entities are excluded as well as crew in vehicles, vehicles themselves are included.

args.name:
condition: String - code containing trigger condition. Special variables available here:
* this (Boolean) - detection event
* thisTrigger (Object) - trigger instance
* thisList (Array) - array of all detected entities

activation: String - code that is executed when the trigger is activated. Special variables available here:
* thisTrigger (Object) - trigger instance
* thisList (Array) - array of all detected entities

deactivation: String - code that is executed when the trigger is deactivated. Special variable available here:
* thisTrigger (Object) - trigger instance

settriggertext.title: setTriggerText
settriggertext.description: Sets the text label attached to the trigger object. This is used for example as a radio slot label for radio activated triggers.

settriggertimeout.title: setTriggerTimeout
settriggertimeout.description:
Defines the time between condition satisfaction and trigger activation (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid). If the last argument is true, the condition must be fullfilled all the time. 
For a normal trigger, min, mid and max are used to generate random duration according to Technically, it is a rescaled  with n = 4. The distribution is split in two at its midpoint and scaled linearly such that its maximum lies at the specified midpoint.. For a "Seized" type of trigger, the duration value is generated using side ruling power

settriggertype.title: setTriggerType
settriggertype.description:
Sets the type of action processed by the trigger after activation (no action, a waypoints switch or an end of mission):

* 
*  - Guarded by OPFOR - (It is better to use createGuardedPoint instead)
*  - Guarded by BLUFOR - (It is better to use createGuardedPoint instead)
*  - Guarded by Independent - (It is better to use createGuardedPoint instead)
*  - Switch waypoints/break loop (see Triggers)
*  - End #1
*  - End #2
*  - End #3
*  - End #4
*  - End #5
*  - End #6
*  - (Meant to say LOSE but is misspelt in the game engine).
*  - (Not in editor. Valid enum name but when set, defaults to )

setunitability.title: setUnitAbility
setunitability.description: Sets skill of given unit. Unlike setSkill, setUnitAbility can set values > 1. Even though the skill command will correctly return set value, the actual unit ability will be capped to max available.

setunitrank.title: setUnitRank
setunitrank.description:
Sets rank of given unit.

Possible rank values, and the associated rating that is set (not added, the value replaces previous rating) with it:

{! classwikitable styletext-align: center
! colspan2  Ranks
! PRIVATE
! CORPORAL
! SERGEANT
! LIEUTENANT
! CAPTAIN
! MAJOR
! COLONEL
!-
! rowspan3  Ratings
!




! 0
! 500
! 1500
! 2500
! 3500
! 5000
! 7500
!-
!  (ca 2015)
! 0
! 50
! 150
! 250
! 350
! 500
! 750
!-
! 
! 0
! 0
! 0
! 0
! 0
! 0
! 0
!}

args.name: rank
args.desc: see above. If a wrong string is provided, the command errors and reverts to using "PRIVATE"

setvectordir.title: setVectorDir
setvectordir.description: Set object's direction vector. Up vector will remain unchanged.

setvectorup.title: setVectorUp
setvectorup.description: Set object's up vector. Direction of the object remain unchanged. Default object's vectorUp is [0,0,1].

setvehicleammo.title: setVehicleAmmo
setvehicleammo.description:
Sets how much ammunition (compared to a full state defined by the vehicle type) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will be added only to local turrets. To check locality of turret use turretLocal.

The value ranges from 0 to 1.

setvehiclearmor.title: setVehicleArmor
setvehiclearmor.description:
Sets the armor (or health for men) state of the vehicle (a value from 0 to 1). 

Works like setDamage, but the other way around: 1 is full health - see .

setvehicleid.title: setVehicleId
setvehicleid.description: Sets ID to vehicle. By this ID vehicle is referenced by triggers and waypoints.

setvehicleinit.title: setVehicleInit
setvehicleinit.description: Attach a statement to a unit. The statement is propagated over the network in MP games, it can be executed by invoking processInitCommands.

setvehiclevarname.title: setVehicleVarName
setvehiclevarname.description:
Sets string representation of an object to a custom string.
When a vehicle is created and named in the editor, the name becomes both the variable containing the vehicle object and the string representation of the vehicle object.
In scripts an extra step is needed to achieve the same effect - see .

setwaypointbehaviour.title: setWaypointBehaviour
setwaypointbehaviour.description:
Switches the unit behaviour when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are:
* "UNCHANGED"
* "CARELESS"
* "SAFE"
* "AWARE"
* "COMBAT"
* "STEALTH"

See the AIBehaviour page for details of the effect of this command on AI units.

setwaypointcombatmode.title: setWaypointCombatMode
setwaypointcombatmode.description: Changes a group's combat mode when the waypoint becomes active.

setwaypointdescription.title: setWaypointDescription
setwaypointdescription.description: Sets the description shown in the HUD while the waypoint is active.

setwaypointformation.title: setWaypointFormation
setwaypointformation.description:
Switches the group formation when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are: 
* "NO CHANGE"
* "COLUMN"
* "STAG COLUMN"
* "WEDGE"
* "ECH LEFT"
* "ECH RIGHT"
* "VEE"
* "LINE"
* "FILE"
* "DIAMOND"

setwaypointhouseposition.title: setWaypointHousePosition
setwaypointhouseposition.description: For waypoints attached to a house, this defines the target buildingPos index.

setwaypointposition.title: setWaypointPosition
setwaypointposition.description:
Attempts to move given waypoint to a random position inside a circle with the given center and radius. 
The waypoint will be placed similar to  attribute in setVehiclePosition, even if the radius is 0, which means it could still be off center. In order to force waypoint to the exact position, similar to  attribute, use a negative radius (see ).

args.name: center: Object or Array format PositionAGL or Array format PositionASL if radius is negative
radius
args.desc: random placement radius in meters. Set it to -1 and convert center to PositionASL for the exact center placement

setwaypointscript.title: setWaypointScript
setwaypointscript.description: Attaches a script to a scripted waypoint. In early versions of Arma, command consisted of a script name and additional script arguments and the script had to use SQS Syntax. The script receives the following arguments in _this variable: [group, position, target] + [the optional passed arguments]. The optional arguments are appended to the end of the arguments array.

setwaypointspeed.title: setWaypointSpeed
setwaypointspeed.description:
Switches the group speed mode when the waypoint becomes active.


Possible values are:
* "UNCHANGED"
* "LIMITED"
* "NORMAL"
* "FULL"

setwaypointstatements.title: setWaypointStatements
setwaypointstatements.description:
The waypoint is done only when the condition is fulfilled. When the waypoint is done, the statement expression is executed.
Within the Condition & Statement code string:
* this refers to the group leader
* thisList refers to the group's units

setwaypointtimeout.title: setWaypointTimeout
setwaypointtimeout.description: Defines the time between condition satisfaction and waypoint finish (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid).

setwaypointtype.title: setWaypointType
setwaypointtype.description:
Sets the waypoint type of given waypoint. 

More details at Waypoints.

showwaypoint.title: showWaypoint
showwaypoint.description: Defines how waypoints are shown to the player in map view. For 3D HUD visibility see setWaypointVisible.

args.name:
show: String - Possible values are:
* "NEVER" - Never show
* "EASY" - Show only if  is enabled in global difficulty.
* "ALWAYS" - Always show

surfaceiswater.title: surfaceIsWater
surfaceiswater.description: Returns whether there is water at given position. In Arma 3, it also detects pond objects, but only if they are loaded in memory (normally only true if the objects are within the object view distance)

args.name: position
args.desc: format Position2D  or Position3D in which case Z will be ignored

surfacetype.title: surfaceType
surfacetype.description:
Returns what surface type is at the given position. For surface texture see surfaceTexture command.


<spoiler text="Show surface types (Armed Assault)">
* #GRASSSOUTH
* #GRASSGENERAL
* #SANDGENERAL
</spoiler>
<spoiler text="Show surface types (Arma 2)">
* #UTGRASS - for natural surfaces
* #UTCONCRETE - for urban surfaces
</spoiler>
<spoiler text="Show surface types (Arma 3)">

</spoiler>

args.name: position
args.desc: format Position2D or Position3D in which case Z will be ignored

synchronizewaypoint.title: synchronizeWaypoint
synchronizewaypoint.description: Synchronizes the trigger or the waypoint with an array of waypoints.

args.name:
triggerOrWaypoint: Object or Waypoint - Can be:
* Object - trigger
* Waypoint - Array in format of Waypoint

showgps.title: showGPS
showgps.description: Shows or hides the GPS receiver on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default false).

showngps.title: shownGPS
showngps.description: Checks if client has GPS reciever enabled in description.ext (showGPS param) or force enabled with showGPS command.

waituntil.title: waitUntil
waituntil.description:
Suspends execution of scheduled script until the given condition satisfied. 
* This command will loop and call the code inside  inline{} mostly every frame, depends on complexity of the condition and the overall engine load, until the code returns true
* If the very first execution of the code returns true the command will exit immediately, therefore it will not produce any "Suspending not allowed in this context" error when used inside non-scheduled script. For all other uses it must be executed in environment that allows suspension (canSuspend), such as spawned or execVMed code
* Avoid doing  inlinewaitUntil { time > 20 }; and use  inlinesleep 20; instead!
* If you can, add a sleep to the condition to save some cpu cycles  inlinewaitUntil { sleep 1; !alive player };

args.name: condition
args.desc: The expression that must return a Boolean, true to finish waiting or false to continue waiting

returns.desc: The value the condition evaluates to when the wait is over (normally true)

wind.title: wind
wind.description: Returns the current wind vector (in m/s) as array [x, y, z].

vehicles.title: vehicles
vehicles.description: Returns an array of all vehicles available to current client. This command returns both empty and crewed vehicles but not soldiers. It will also return "WeaponHolderSimulated" of dead bodies (weapon on the ground). Vehicles created with createVehicleLocal will only be returned on the client that created them.

worldtomodel.title: worldToModel
worldtomodel.description: Converts position from world space to object model space.

args.name: position
args.desc: World position, format PositionAGL or Position2D

returns.desc: Position relative to model, format PositionRelative

vehiclevarname.title: vehicleVarName
vehiclevarname.description: Returns the variable name that contains a primary editor reference to this object. This is the variable given in the Insert Unit dialog / name field in the editor. It can be changed using setVehicleVarName.

returns.desc: variable name, if none was set, an empty string is returned

verifysignature.title: verifySignature
verifysignature.description: Check if file is signed by any key present in game keys folders. On clients, it does not check against the keys accepted by server.

unitpos.title: unitPos
unitpos.description:
Return the unit position rules.
The return value is always "Auto" unless the unit has gotten a setUnitPos command. In that case the value is the last stance the unit was ordered to.
Available modes are listed at setUnitPos.

teamswitch.title: teamSwitch
teamswitch.description:
Invoke the Team Switch dialog (force it even when conditions are not met).
There has to be at least one playable unit for team switch to work, and for this command to work in MP, respawn type in description.ext should be 5 (SIDE).

teamswitchenabled.title: teamSwitchEnabled
teamswitchenabled.description:
Check if Team Switch is currently enabled.
Team Switch is enabled by default.

text.title: text
text.description: Creates a structured text containing the given plain text if argument is String. Use setAttributes to set additional  attributes on the text. If the argument is location, returns location's text value (see Alt Syntax).

try.title: try

args.name: args
args.desc: passed arguments, will be put in _this variable inside the "code"

typename.title: typeName
typename.description:
Returns the Data Type of an expression. 

The type is returned as on of the following all-uppercase strings:

They represent the available Data Types in .

throw.title: throw
throw.description: Throws an exception. The exception is processed by first catch block. This command will terminate further execution of the code.

args.name: if (condition): If Type  - if (condition) returns true, "exception" is thrown
exception
args.desc: value that will be put into _exception variable inside catch block

to.title: to
to.description: Continue sequence of for construct. It sets the end value of the index variable.

rain.title: rain
rain.description: Returns the current value of rain density in range 0..1

rank.title: rank
rank.description:
Returns the rank of the given unit. Rank can be one of the following:
* 
* 
* 
* 
* 
* 
*

reload.title: reload
reload.description:
* Old syntax: Reload first found muzzle that needs reloading (with some inconsistencies). 
* Alternative syntax (Since Arma 3 v2.08.148609): This syntax allows to reload given muzzle with given magazine while playing proper animation. If param is omitted or is empty string, default value is used. The default behaviour is to find best matching magazine for given muzzle from the pool of available magazines. If specific magazine is requested, the reload will fail if unit has run out of this type of magazines. If empty array [] is given, the behaviour is similar to player pressing "Reload" key. The command reloads the given muzzle but doesn't select it. In case of  throwable muzzles, each throwable has own muzzle, they are autoreloaded after throw. Using reload on the trowable muzzle will just swap throwable for another one of the same type from inventory.

args.name: muzzle (Optional): String - muzzle name or "" for current muzzle. Default: currentMuzzle
magazine (Optional): String - magazine name or "" for given muzzle magazine. Default: given muzzle magazine. If given muzzle is currentMuzzle then currentMagazine

reloadenabled.title: reloadEnabled
reloadenabled.description: Check whether magazine is reloaded whenever emptied.

removeswitchableunit.title: removeSwitchableUnit
removeswitchableunit.description: Remove a unit from the list of units available for Team Switch.

posscreentoworld.title: posScreenToWorld
posscreentoworld.description: Converts map screen coordinates into world coordinates. Unlike ctrlMapScreenToWorld, this command returns world position is format [x, y, 0], otherwise it is identical to it.

posworldtoscreen.title: posWorldToScreen
posworldtoscreen.description: Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to ctrlMapWorldToScreen.

args.name: position : Array - world position in format Position2D or Position3D

precision.title: precision
precision.description: Return the movement precision of the given entity, how is the entity able to be precise when moving to given target.

overcast.title: overcast
overcast.description: Return the current overcast level. Zero is clear skies, one is maximum cloud cover.

needreload.title: needReload
needreload.description: Returns how much vehicle wants to reload its weapons.

nextweatherchange.title: nextWeatherChange
nextweatherchange.description:
Return the remaining time (in seconds) over which the current weather change will occur.

When a weather change finishes, the game engine will automatically generate a new random weather change over a realistic time period (minimum of 90 minutes).

nearobjects.title: nearObjects
nearobjects.description: Find objects (Units, Vehicles, Dead, Map Objects) in a sphere with given radius. The first object in the returned array is not necessarily the closest one. If you need returned objects to be sorted by distance, use nearestObjects. If typeName is given, only objects of given type (or its subtype) are listed.

args.name: position: Array format PositionAGL, Position2D or Object

max.title: max
max.description: The greater value of a and b.

min.title: min
min.description: The smaller of a and b.

missionconfigfile.title: missionConfigFile
missionconfigfile.description: Return root of mission Description.ext entries hierarchy.

modeltoworld.title: modelToWorld
modeltoworld.description:
Translates relative position from object model space to world space in PositionAGL format.
This command will take into account vectorUp of the object when calculating relative coordinates.
For the PositionASL version of this command, see modelToWorldWorld.

args.name: position: Array format PositionRelative - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre

moveinturret.title: moveInTurret
moveinturret.description: Moves the soldier into the vehicle's turret. (Immediately, without animation).

movetofailed.title: moveToFailed
movetofailed.description: Check if latest low level moveTo command failed.

limitspeed.title: limitSpeed
limitspeed.description: Limit the speed of an AI-driven vehicle or AI person to given value. It has continuous effect and AI will not break through the speed limitation until one is contacted, engaged or regrouped.

args.name: speed
args.desc: in km/h; set to  (or any <= 0 value) to remove the limit

kbadddatabase.title: kbAddDatabase
kbadddatabase.description: Register knowledge base database to given person. See Conversations for more details.
