args.desc: Unit to add this new task

args.name: parentTask
args.desc: (Optional, taskNull) - The new task will be a sub task of the parent task

createtask.title: createTask
createtask.description: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

syntaxes.code: teamMember createTask [[type, parentTask], priority, name1, value1, (...), nameN, valueN]

createteam.title: createTeam
createteam.description: Creates a Team and names it.

ctrladdeventhandler.title: ctrlAddEventHandler
ctrladdeventhandler.description: Add an event handler to the given control.

args.name: handler
args.desc: Handler name, see User Interface Event Handlers

args.name:
function: String, since  also Code - script. Several Magic Variables are available:
* Event Handler parameters are accessible via 
* The Event Handler type is available as 
* The Event Handler index is available as

ctrlautoscrolldelay.title: ctrlAutoScrollDelay
ctrlautoscrolldelay.description:
Returns number of seconds auto-scroll will wait before scroll and/or rewind. -2 if scrollbar not present. 

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlautoscrollrewind.title: ctrlAutoScrollRewind
ctrlautoscrollrewind.description:
Returns true if auto-scroll should move back to start after it reaches the end.

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlautoscrollspeed.title: ctrlAutoScrollSpeed
ctrlautoscrollspeed.description:
Returns number of seconds to auto-scroll one line. -1 if auto-scroll is disabled. -2 if scrollbar not present.
Autoscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlmapcursor.title: ctrlMapCursor
ctrlmapcursor.description:
Changes the default cursor that appears when interacting with a map control to a custom one. Use an empty string to restore the default cursor.

The cursor is the name of a config entry from CfgWrapperUI / Cursors. This command has the following specifics:
* When used on the Main Map ( inlinefindDisplay 12 displayCtrl 51), it is possible to override multiple default cursors. For example, while leaving default "Arrow" intact, it is possible to just override "Scroll" with e.g "Wait" (See )
* When used on a custom map, for example user made Mini Map, there is only one single cursor "" for everything, therefore only this cursor can be overridden (see  on how to override it)
Some possible class names (See ctrlMapCursor/cursors for the whole list):

ctrlmapmouseover.title: ctrlMapMouseOver
ctrlmapmouseover.description: Returns description of map sign mouse cursor is over. Works with in-game map as well as 2D editor map in edit mode.

ctrlremovealleventhandlers.title: ctrlRemoveAllEventHandlers
ctrlremovealleventhandlers.description: Remove all event handlers from the given control.

ctrlremoveeventhandler.title: ctrlRemoveEventHandler
ctrlremoveeventhandler.description: Remove a given event handler from the given control.

ctrlsetautoscrolldelay.title: ctrlSetAutoScrollDelay
ctrlsetautoscrolldelay.description:
Sets number of second before auto-scroll starts/rewinds. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollDelay.

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

args.name: delay
args.desc: seconds to wait before scroll and/or rewind

ctrlsetautoscrollrewind.title: ctrlSetAutoScrollRewind
ctrlsetautoscrollrewind.description:
Defines if scroll should rewind when auto-scroll reach end. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollRewind.

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlsetautoscrollspeed.title: ctrlSetAutoScrollSpeed
ctrlsetautoscrollspeed.description:
Sets number of second required to scroll to next line. If speed < 0, auto-scroll is disabled. Setter for ctrlAutoScrollSpeed.

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

args.name: speed
args.desc: seconds to autoscroll to the next line

currentmagazine.title: currentMagazine
currentmagazine.description: Returns class name of currently loaded vehicle's / unit's magazine.

currenttask.title: currentTask
currenttask.description: Return current task of given person.

currenttasks.title: currentTasks
currenttasks.description:
Returns array with all  uncompleted tasks for the given agent.
getVariable could be used on Task to get the following special local variables from the task:
*  Team Member - the teamMember agent the task is assigned to
*  String - the name of the task (see registeredTasks)
*  Number - 1 or 0
*  Number - 1 or 0
*  Number - total number of tasks
*  Number - total number of running tasks
* Task - often null

currentwaypoint.title: currentWaypoint
currentwaypoint.description:
Returns the index of the current waypoint contrary to misleading name.

To determine the validity of the index, compare it to the waypoints count.

If all waypoints are completed, then the index is 1 greater than the last valid index.

If there are no waypoints, then the index is 0.

By default, a group has 1 waypoint at their starting position, which is considered completed and so the currentWaypoint is 1.

currentweapon.title: currentWeapon
currentweapon.description: Return the name of the currently selected weapon (on the primary turret for vehicles).

cursortarget.title: cursorTarget
cursortarget.description:
Returns the target pointed at by the player (usually with cross-hairs). The target has to be known to the player to some degree (knowsAbout > 0). If target is completely unknown, command returns objNull.
A valid target could belong to an enemy or a friendly side. Buildings are normally known to player and so are valid targets. Try nearTargets to see what else is considered a target. While friendly targets are usually known to the player, enemy targets can be totally unknown, especially if "auto-spotting" (or sometimes called "auto-reporting") is switched off. To check if auto-spotting is enabled:
cursorTarget also returns locked target for the duration of the lock even if there is another target under the cursor. As soon as missile is fired, cursorTarget switches to current known target under cursor or objNull. Targeting (currently "T" in Arma 3) works regardless of the state of "auto-spotting".
Adding a target to the known list could be done with reveal command. When auto-spotting is enabled, zooming on the enemy target with cross-hairs usually reveals the target. As friendly targets are always known, zooming on friendly target could improve knowsAbout value.
Side relations can also influence target knowledge. For example east target is unknown target for civilian, but making them friends with setFriend instantly improves civilian knowledge of the east.

datetonumber.title: dateToNumber
datetonumber.description:
Convert a date to a float number, based on Jan 1st 00:00:00 = 0 and Dec 31st  23:59:59 = 1. The same day and time in leap year will be different after 28th of February and 23:59 on 31st of December will be 1.00274.
This is how this command works. The 365 days of the year are presented in range 0...1. So each day will be:
1 / 365 = 0.00273973
In a leap year there are 366 days, so the range will increase by 1 day:
1 / 365 * 366 = 1.00274
In short, in a normal year the command returns in range 0...1 in a leap year it will return in range 0...1.00274.

deleteeditorobject.title: deleteEditorObject
deleteeditorobject.description: Delete the editor object. Requires all editor object links to be removed prior.

deleteresources.title: deleteResources
deleteresources.description: Delete (unregister) resources of the team member. Resources are deleted in the order they were added. Case insensitive.

detach.title: detach
detach.description: Detaches previously attached with attachTo object.

diarysubjectexists.title: diarySubjectExists
diarysubjectexists.description: Checks whether given subject is present in the Diary of given player.

directsay.title: directSay
directsay.description: Sends given audio message to the direct channel. Command operates just like xxxxRadio commands, but the sound is played over direct channel and is independent of fadeSound. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol or a kbAddTopic. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

disableconversation.title: disableConversation
disableconversation.description: In theory disables the ability to talk to other people. In actuality, if true is given, the command increases unit's kbTell IsSpeaking status by 1, thus stopping unit from having a conversation. If false is given, the command decreases unit's kbTell IsSpeaking status by 1. The unit "is speaking" if IsSpeaking > 0.

disableserialization.title: disableSerialization
disableserialization.description: Disable saving of script containing this command. After this, the script can work with data types which do not support serialization (UI types). See Namespace serialization for more information.

displayaddeventhandler.title: displayAddEventHandler
displayaddeventhandler.description:
Adds an event handler to the given display. See User Interface Event Handlers for the full list of event names.
If applicable, see DIK_KeyCodes for a list of key code constants, which are relevant to key related user interface events like: KeyDown & KeyUp.

args.name: code: String or  Code - the code which gets executed when event is triggered. Returning true in event handler code will override default engine handling for keyboard events.

returns.desc: index of the newly added event handler or  if creation failed

displayremovealleventhandlers.title: displayRemoveAllEventHandlers
displayremovealleventhandlers.description: Remove all event handlers from the given display.

displayremoveeventhandler.title: displayRemoveEventHandler
displayremoveeventhandler.description: Remove a given event handler from the given display.

drawlink.title: drawLink
drawlink.description: The editor will draw a line between the two specified editor objects. Line type can be LINE or ARROW.

editobject.title: editObject
editobject.description: Show the edit object dialog for the given object.

editorseteventhandler.title: editorSetEventHandler
editorseteventhandler.description: Sets given event handler of given editor.

enablesaving.title: enableSaving
enablesaving.description: Enable / disable saving of the game with an optional autosave.

args.name: enable
args.desc: allow saveGame command usage and manual saving

args.name: save
args.desc: create an autosave on command execution

enablesentences.title: enableSentences
enablesentences.description: Enables radio transmissions to be heard and seen on screen. It does not affect KBTell conversations.

enablesimulation.title: enableSimulation
enablesimulation.description:
Enables / disables simulation for the given entity, e.g its animation and physics; it will still be able to take damage and report enemies.
This command will affect entity simulation only locally.
For a global and JIP enabled alternative, see enableSimulationGlobal.

endloadingscreen.title: endLoadingScreen
endloadingscreen.description: Finishes loading screen started by startLoadingScreen.

endmission.title: endMission
endmission.description:
Finish the mission.
Mission saves are deleted. Use failMission if they should not.

args.name: endType
args.desc: can be a custom one, or one of:

estimatedendservertime.title: estimatedEndServerTime
estimatedendservertime.description: Estimated end of MP game in seconds converted to serverTime.

evalobjectargument.title: evalObjectArgument
evalobjectargument.description: Return argument in mission editor of a given object.

execeditorscript.title: execEditorScript
execeditorscript.description: Execute an editor script for the specified object.

execfsm.title: execFSM
execfsm.description:
Execute scripted FSM and return the FSM handle or 0 when failed. The FSM file is first searched in the mission folder, then in the campaign scripts folder and finally in the global scripts folder. Argument (if any) are available in  variable inside FSM. Variables set inside FSMs can be read/modified externally, using setFSMVariable and getFSMVariable commands.

The return value is the FSM handle; it can be used to determine (via completedFSM) when the FSM has finished.


Scripted FSMs are added into the scheduler just like exec scripts, execVM scripts and spawn scripts.
To see what FSMs are currently in the scheduler, use diag_activeMissionFSMs command.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: Arguments accessible as  in the FSM

faction.description:

failmission.title: failMission
failmission.description:
Finish the mission. If the server is set to run persistent mission, failMission will not end the mission when last player gets kicked to the lobby. Use endMission to end the mission.

The end type can be:
* "CONTINUE" - this is default type, basically an alias to do nothing
* "KILLED"
* "LOSER"
* "END1"
* "END2"
* "END3"
* "END4"
* "END5"
* "END6"

Mission saves won't be deleted.

findeditorobject.title: findEditorObject
findeditorobject.description: Return object that matches the provided reference.

findemptyposition.title: findEmptyPosition
findemptyposition.description:
Searches for an empty area around the specified position, starting from the center looking for an empty areaRadius and looks as far away as areaRadius + maxDistance.
This command ignores moving objects present within the search area. The search area can be preloaded with findEmptyPositionReady command.

args.name: center: Array format Position2D or Position3D - search area center position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] in which case z is ignored
maxDistance
args.desc: stop searching no further than  from the center

args.name: vehicleType
args.desc: (Optional) classname of a vehicle to accommodate

returns.desc: a suitable empty position in format Position3D or empty array  inline[] if not found

findemptypositionready.title: findEmptyPositionReady
findemptypositionready.description:
Preloads area to be used with findEmptyPosition command and returns true when area is ready.
The size of the area preloaded is from  to

args.name: center: Array format Position2D or Position3D - search area center position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] in which case z is ignored
maxDistance
args.desc: distance from the end of radius

foreachmember.title: forEachMember
foreachmember.description: Executes the given command recursively for both teams and agents that are members of the given team. For teams only use forEachMemberTeam. For agents only use forEachMemberAgent.

foreachmemberagent.title: forEachMemberAgent
foreachmemberagent.description: Executes the given command recursively for each agent that is a member of the given team. For just teams use forEachMemberTeam. For both teams and agents use forEachMember.

foreachmemberteam.title: forEachMemberTeam
foreachmemberteam.description: Executes the given command recursively for each team that is a member of the given team. For just agents use forEachMemberAgent. For both teams and agents use forEachMember.

fromeditor.title: fromEditor
fromeditor.description: Return if given team was inserted directly from mission editor.

geteditorcamera.title: getEditorCamera
geteditorcamera.description: Fetches a reference to the mission editor camera.

geteditormode.title: getEditorMode
geteditormode.description: Returns the current mode of the editor.

geteditorobjectscope.title: getEditorObjectScope
geteditorobjectscope.description: Returns the editor object scope of the specified editor object.

getfriend.title: getFriend
getfriend.description: Returns if sides are friendly or hostile. For a value smaller than 0.6 it results in being enemy, otherwise it is friendly. See also Side relations.

getfsmvariable.title: getFSMVariable
getfsmvariable.description: Return the value of variable in the variable space of given FSM. The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: value to return if variable is nil

getgroupiconparams.title: getGroupIconParams
getgroupiconparams.description: Returns group icons params used for command bar drawing such as color, text, scale, visibility, waypoint visibility, waypoint color.

getobjectargument.title: getObjectArgument
getobjectargument.description: Return name of object argument in mission editor.

getobjectchildren.title: getObjectChildren
getobjectchildren.description: Return a list of all the children of the specified object.

getobjectproxy.title: getObjectProxy
getobjectproxy.description: Return the proxy object associated with the given editor object.

groupiconselectable.title: groupIconSelectable
groupiconselectable.description: Returns whether or not group icons raise onGroupIconClick, onGroupIconOverEnter and onGroupIconOverLeave events.

groupiconsvisible.title: groupIconsVisible
groupiconsvisible.description: Returns array with group icons visibility. A getter for setGroupIconsVisible

groupselectedunits.title: groupSelectedUnits
groupselectedunits.description: Returns selected units in source group for normal commanding mode (individual units). For the High Command equivalent, see hcSelected.

hcallgroups.title: hcAllGroups
hcallgroups.description: Returns selected groups in high command.

hcgroupparams.description:
Returns parameters describing group in high command bar. Return value is array in format [groupName, teamName] or [] if error. Possible values for team name:
*  (default)
* 
* 
* 
*

hcremoveallgroups.description: Remove all groups from unit's high command bar.

hcremovegroup.title: hcRemoveGroup
hcremovegroup.description: Removes group from unit's high command bar.

hcselected.description: Returns selected groups in high command.

hcselectgroup.title: hcSelectGroup
hcselectgroup.description: Select given group in high command bar.

hcshowbar.description: Shows or hides high command bar. There must be some groups under HC command to show HC bar.

hcshownbar.description: Return whether the High Command bar is shown/active.

returns.desc: true if HC bar is shown, otherwise false

hintsilent.title: hintSilent
hintsilent.description: Same as hint, but without a sound.

importallgroups.title: importAllGroups
importallgroups.description: Imports all groups into the RTE.

inputaction.title: inputAction
inputaction.description:
Return the state of input devices mapped to given input action.

For Arma 3 inputActions and its bindings see: PAGENAME/actions.

For earlier Arma editions  see :Category:Key Actions.

inserteditorobject.title: insertEditorObject
inserteditorobject.description: Insert an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,not called. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject. Subtype class is,optional.

isagent.title: isAgent
isagent.description: Check if team member is an agent.

isdedicated.title: isDedicated
isdedicated.description: Returns true if the machine executing the command is a dedicated multiplayer server. Returns false in single player.

isflatempty.title: isFlatEmpty
isflatempty.description:
Checks given position against given filter params. Filter includes checks for:
* If there are any objects closer than given distance from given position (in 2D)
* If the area around position is flat enough to match given gradient
* If the given position is over water or land
* If the given position is over shore line
The gradient seems to correlate with general hill steepness: 0.1 (10%) ~6°, 0.5 (50%) ~27°, 1.0 (100%) ~45°, etc.

syntaxes.code: position isFlatEmpty [minDistance, mode, maxGradient, maxGradientRadius, overLandOrWater, shoreLine, ignoreObject]

args.name: minDistance
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) minimum (2D) distance from other objects (range 0..50). -1 to ignore proximity check

args.name: mode
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) position check mode (ALWAYS USE DEFAULT VALUE)

args.name: maxGradient
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) maximum terrain steepness allowed. -1 to ignore

args.name: maxGradientRadius
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) how far to extend gradient check

args.name:
overLandOrWater: Number - (Optional, default 0)
* 0: position cannot be over water
* 2: position cannot be over land
* -1 to ignore

shoreLine: Boolean - (Optional, default false)
* true: position is over shoreline (< ~25 m from water)
* false to ignore
ignoreObject
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) object to ignore in proximity checks. objNull to ignore

returns.desc: Empty array [] if check failed or PositionASL if succeded. Resulting position will be original PositionAGL + getTerrainHeightASL

isonroad.title: isOnRoad
isonroad.description: Checks if given position is inside road segment. Same as roadAt, only return is boolean instead of road object.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v2.00) Position2D, in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface

isrealtime.title: isRealTime
isrealtime.description: Returns true if the mission editor is operating in real time mode.

isshowing3dicons.title: isShowing3DIcons
isshowing3dicons.description: Returns true if the editor is set to draw 3D icons.

items.title: items
items.description: Returns an array of names of all unit's stored items, including weapons but excluding magazines (see itemsWithMagazines) and assignedItems.

joinas.title: joinAs
joinas.description: Joins the unit to the given group, if position id is available, this one is used.

joinassilent.title: joinAsSilent
joinassilent.description: Joins the unit to the given group, if position id is available, this one is used. Avoid any radio communication related to joining.

kbreact.title: kbReact
kbreact.description: Pass a non-verbal communication to the receiver. This command does as if the sentence was said and triggers the reaction scripts (AI FSM or player's conversation EH). See Conversations for more details.

syntaxes.code: person kbReact [receiver, topicName, sentenceID(, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, …)]

args.name:
argumentArray1toN: Array - (Optional) in format [argumentName, argumentValue, argumentText, argumentSpeech]:
* argumentName: String
* argumentValue: Code
* argumentText: String
* argumentSpeech: Array of Strings - each string is an already defined word in config.

kbwassaid.title: kbWasSaid
kbwassaid.description: Check if given item was said by person to someone. See Conversations for more details.

args.name: topic
args.desc: name of the topic used in kbAddTopic

args.name: sentenceID
args.desc: id of sentence that we want to check

args.name: maxAge
args.desc: time in seconds. kbWasSaid will check whether the sentence was said in last max. age seconds

landresult.title: landResult
landresult.description: Return the result of helicopter landing position searching (performed, after land command).

leavevehicle.title: leaveVehicle
leavevehicle.description:
Ceases the using of the vehicle by a group and unassigns vehicle from the group.
If the argument is a single unit, the vehicle will be unassigned from unit's group.
After vehicle is unassigned from the group, each individual crew member then unassigned from the vehicle.

In short the command could be hypothetically presented as:
leaveVehicle = un-addVehicle + unassignVehicle forEach crew

However, to make it more reliable, it is best to move unit out of the vehicle manually with moveOut and force unassign the vehicle with unassignVehicle.

args.name: group: Group or Object, in which case, object's Group is used

lifestate.title: lifeState
lifestate.description:
Returns the life state of the given unit.

!

* "INJURED"
!}

listobjects.title: listObjects
listobjects.description: Return the list of all objects of given type.

lnbaddarray.description: Adds list of rows of strings.

args.name: position

args.name: controlOrIdc: Control, Number - Control or the idc of the control
position
args.desc: Position of the new column where 0 means all the way to the left and 1 all the way to the right of the control

lnbclear.title: lnbClear
lnbclear.description: Clears all items in the given listbox or combobox.

lnbcolor.title: lnbColor
lnbcolor.description: Returns the text color of the item with the given position of the 2D listbox. The color is returned in format Color (RGBA).

lnbcurselrow.title: lnbCurSelRow
lnbcurselrow.description: Returns the index of the selected row id 2D listbox.

lnbdata.title: lnbData
lnbdata.description: Returns the additional text (invisible) in an item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

lnbdeletecolumn.title: lnbDeleteColumn
lnbdeletecolumn.description: Removes column with given index from ListNBox control.

lnbdeleterow.title: lnbDeleteRow
lnbdeleterow.description: Removes row with the given index from the given listbox or combobox.

lnbgetcolumnsposition.title: lnbGetColumnsPosition
lnbgetcolumnsposition.description: Returns relative screen X of ListNBox control columns position [0.1,0.3,0.6...]. Use lnbSetColumnsPos to set positions.

lnbpicture.title: lnbPicture
lnbpicture.description: Returns the picture name or path of the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

args.name: row
args.desc: Index of Row in given Control

args.name: column
args.desc: Index of Column in given Control

lnbsetcolor.title: lnbSetColor
lnbsetcolor.description: Sets the color of the item with the given position of the 2D listbox. Color is in format Color (RGBA).

lnbsetcolumnspos.title: lnbSetColumnsPos
lnbsetcolumnspos.description: Sets relative screen X for ListNBox control columns positions. Setter for lnbGetColumnsPosition.

lnbsetcurselrow.title: lnbSetCurSelRow
lnbsetcurselrow.description: Selects the row with the given index of the 2D listbox.

lnbsetpicture.title: lnbSetPicture
lnbsetpicture.description: Sets the picture in the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.The picture is searched in the mission, directory, the dtaExt subdirectory of the campaign directory, and the dtaExt directory and the data bank (or directory).

lnbsize.title: lnbSize
lnbsize.description: Returns size of CT_LISTNBOX. This command supports CT_TOOLBOX control since Arma 3 v2.06. For CT_COMBO or CT_LISTBOX see lbSize.

args.name: controlOrIDC: Control or Number - Control or control's IDC

lnbtext.title: lnbText
lnbtext.description: Returns the shown text in the item with the given position of the given 2D listbox.

lnbvalue.title: lnbValue
lnbvalue.description: Returns the additional integer value in the item with the given position of the 2D listbox.

loadgame.title: loadGame
loadgame.description:
Loads game from the last autosave made with saveGame. If no autosave exists, restarts the mission. When used in campaign it will also deduct 1 life, defined in:
campaignConfigFile >> "Campaign" / <battle> / <mission> / "lives"

loadoverlay.title: loadOverlay
loadoverlay.description: Creates the load overlay dialog for the specified type of overlay.

lockcargo.title: lockCargo
lockcargo.description:
Lock all cargo positions of a vehicle or lock by index.
This command will remove user "get in" action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands (e.g moveInCargo) unlike lock command.

lockdriver.title: lockDriver
lockdriver.description: Lock the driver position of the vehicle. This command must be executed where vehicle is local. This command will remove user get in action (not get out) but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands unlike lock command

lockedcargo.title: lockedCargo
lockedcargo.description: Check whether cargo position of the vehicle is locked.

lockeddriver.title: lockedDriver
lockeddriver.description: Check whether driver position of the vehicle turret is locked.

lockedturret.title: lockedTurret
lockedturret.description: Check whether gunner position of the vehicle turret is locked.

lockturret.title: lockTurret
lockturret.description:
Lock the gunner position of the vehicle turret.
This command will remove user "get in" action (not "get out") but will also stop player getting into vehicle via script commands unlike lock command.

lookatpos.title: lookAtPos
lookatpos.description: Point the camera and center the map on the position.

markeralpha.title: markerAlpha
markeralpha.description: Gets the marker alpha. See setMarkerAlpha.

markerbrush.title: markerBrush
markerbrush.description: Gets the marker brush. See setMarkerBrush.

markershape.title: markerShape
markershape.description: Returns the shape of given marker.

members.title: members
members.description: Return a list of members in given team.

missionnamespace.title: missionNamespace
missionnamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to mission.

morale.title: morale
morale.description: Get the provided unit's current morale level.

moveobjecttoend.title: moveObjectToEnd
moveobjecttoend.description: Shifts an editor object to the end of the objects array. This means,that the object will be drawn last (after all other objects).

moveout.title: moveOut
moveout.description:
Moves the soldier out of the vehicle.

Notes:
* Works for both AI and player entities
* AI unit gets back in - unless is under player command or combined with other sqf commands (orderGetIn false, allowGetIn false or leaveVehicle)
* Respects the vehicle's lock state (same as action "Eject") - unlike doGetOut, commandGetOut. It will work for player entities regardless though
* Still executes when the vehicle is moving/flying (same as action "Eject") - unlike doGetOut, commandGetOut
* Without vehicle's position's get out animation - unlike action eject, doGetOut, commandGetOut
* Immediately - unlike action eject, doGetOut, commandGetOut
* Works also on dead units (same as action "Eject" (but one after another)) - unlike doGetOut, commandGetOut
* Does not work for UAV crew
* Does not work for remoteControlled units
* Works on unconscious (same as action "Eject" (but one after another)) - unlike doGetOut, commandGetOut (unless AI under player command)

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle could be objNull, in this case the command is identical to the main syntax.

movetime.title: moveTime
movetime.description: Returns the current time of the most important RTM animation currently being played on the soldier.

nearentities.title: nearEntities
nearentities.description:
Image:sphere_radius.jpg200
Finds entities inside a sphere with the given radius. If the alternative syntax is used, only entities of given types or subtypes are listed. Entities returned are not sorted by distance. This command doesn't return dead entities or entities inside vehicles. If you need to return those, use entities command.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D - center of the sphere
position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D - center of the sphere
type: String or Array of Strings - type(s) to search for. See isKindOf

nearestlocationwithdubbing.title: nearestLocationWithDubbing
nearestlocationwithdubbing.description: Find the nearest location having a non-empty speech.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D

nearobjectsready.title: nearObjectsReady
nearobjectsready.description: Check whether all data are loaded to nearObjects will return in reasonable time.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D

nearroads.title: nearRoads
nearroads.description: Find the road segments within the circle of given radius.

args.name: pos: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D, center of search radius

newoverlay.title: newOverlay
newoverlay.description: Creates the new overlay dialog for the specified type of overlay.

nextmenuitemindex.title: nextMenuItemIndex
nextmenuitemindex.description: Returns the next available menu item index.

nmenuitems.title: nMenuItems
nmenuitems.description: Returns the total number of user-added menu items belonging to the given menu.

numbertodate.title: numberToDate
numbertodate.description: Convert float number to a date.

args.name: time
args.desc: year time in range 0..1, from beginning to end of the year (e.g  is January 1st and  is December 31st)

oncommandmodechanged.title: onCommandModeChanged
oncommandmodechanged.description: Defines code performed when hc command mode changes either because of (Left Ctrl + Space) shortcut or hcShowBar scripting command. Groups hc mode must contain at least one group for this command to work (see High Command). Attached code receives _isHighCommand boolean.

ondoubleclick.title: onDoubleClick
ondoubleclick.description: Defines an action performed when the user double clicks on the map. Command receives:,_pos array position,_units array selected units,_shift,_alt bool key state

ongroupiconclick.title: onGroupIconClick
ongroupiconclick.description:
Defines an action performed when player clicked on group marker (3D or in a map). The code executed once.
This EH, unlike onGroupIconOverEnter and onGroupIconOverLeave, has one more param which returns 1 if RMB was pressed, 0 otherwise.

ongroupiconoverenter.title: onGroupIconOverEnter
ongroupiconoverenter.description: Defines an action performed when player moves pointer over group marker (3D or in a map). The code will execute continuously while pointer is over icon.

ongroupiconoverleave.title: onGroupIconOverLeave
ongroupiconoverleave.description: Defines an action performed when pointer, previously positioned over icon, is moved away from it (3D or in a map). The code is executed once.

onhcgroupselectionchanged.title: onHCGroupSelectionChanged
onhcgroupselectionchanged.description:
Defines an action performed when high command group selection has been changed.
Command receives 2 variables:
* _group: Group - last selected/deselected group
* _isSelected: Boolean - new selection state of the specific group
The code is executed on every hc group selection change until it is replaced or removed (see ).

onpreloadfinished.title: onPreloadFinished
onpreloadfinished.description: Defines an action performed after the preload screen finished. Preload event occurs after briefing screen on mission start.

onpreloadstarted.title: onPreloadStarted
onpreloadstarted.description: Defines an action performed just before the preload screen started. Preload event occurs after briefing screen on mission start.

onshownewobject.title: onShowNewObject
onshownewobject.description: Defines an action performed when the user right clicks on the map and,selects New Object. Set to empty for default behavior. Command receives:,_pos array position,

onteamswitch.title: onTeamSwitch
onteamswitch.description:
Defines an action performed when the team switch is finished.
Commandset receives the following special variables: _from object previous unit, _to object current unit.
Consecutive use of onTeamSwitch command will overwrite previously set commandset.

owner.title: owner
owner.description: On server machine, returns the  machine network ID of the client to which the object is local. Otherwise returns 0. For use on clients clientOwner command is available. To find out the owner of a Group, use groupOwner.

parsingnamespace.title: parsingNamespace
parsingnamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to config parser.

playableunits.title: playableUnits
playableunits.description:
Returns a list of playable units in a multiplayer game (occupied by both AI or players), created on the following sides east/opfor, west/blufor, resistance/independent and civilian only.
Does not contain units of sideLogic.

playaction.title: playAction
playaction.description:
When used on a person, a smooth transition to the given action will be initiated.

For Arma 3 actions see: playAction/actions.

playactionnow.title: playActionNow
playactionnow.description:
When used on a person, a smooth transition to the given action will be initiated, but all previous playAction are discarded.

For Arma 3 actions see: playAction/actions.

playgesture.title: playGesture
playgesture.description: When used on a person,a smooth transition to the given move will be initiated. Command doesn't seem to be functional

playmovenow.title: playMoveNow
playmovenow.description:
When used on a person,a smooth transition to the given move will be initiated, but all previous playMove are discarded. 
The difference between playMove and playMoveNow is that playMove adds another move to the move queue, while playMoveNow replaces the whole move queue with new move (see ).

playscriptedmission.title: playScriptedMission
playscriptedmission.description:
Load the given world, launch an empty mission, and execute the given expression.
If provided, config can reference to the config entry, replacing Description.ext for this mission.

args.name:
effect: String or Number
* String - effect name
* Number - effect handle

ppeffectcommit.title: ppEffectCommit
ppeffectcommit.description: Commit post process effect in given time.

args.name: handles: Array of Numbers - list of handles

ppeffectcommitted.title: ppEffectCommitted
ppeffectcommitted.description: Check whether given post process effect is committed.

ppeffectcreate.title: ppEffectCreate
ppeffectcreate.description:
Creates Post Process Effects specified by effect name and priority.
Supported effects:

args.name: priority
args.desc: unique priority, defines order of applying effect to the scene. If there is another effect using the same priority, creation will fail

args.name: priorityX
args.desc: unique priority, defines order of applying effect to the scene. If there is another effect using the same priority, creation will fail

ppeffectdestroy.title: ppEffectDestroy
ppeffectdestroy.description: Destroy Post Process Effects given by handle or array of handles.

args.name: effects: Array of Numbers - array of effect handles
effectArray: Array of Numbers - array of effect handles

priority.title: priority
priority.description: Return the priority of the task.

processdiarylink.title: processDiaryLink
processdiarylink.description: Opens the Diary screen on the subject/record specified by link. To get a valid link format, use createDiaryLink.

progressloadingscreen.title: progressLoadingScreen
progressloadingscreen.description: If loading screen is shown, sets progress bar to the given value (interval is from 0 to 1])

progressposition.title: progressPosition
progressposition.description: Returns the current position in the progress bar.

progresssetposition.title: progressSetPosition
progresssetposition.description: Sets progress position of a progress bar.

rankid.title: rankId
rankid.description:
Return the rank of the given unit for comparison.

Value may be:
* 0 - Private
* 1 - Corporal
* 2 - Sergeant
* 3 - Lieutenant
* 4 - Captain
* 5 - Major
* 6 - Colonel

registeredtasks.title: registeredTasks
registeredtasks.description: Returns array with all registered task types for the given agent. The values are the names set in  classes  property. The same names are used for unregisterTask

registertask.title: registerTask
registertask.description: Registers a new task type. Parameters are defined in the given config class (subclass of )

remotecontrol.title: remoteControl
remotecontrol.description:
Switches on remote control of the unit. Command needs to be executed locally to the player.
If driver is remote it will get transferred to players PC.

removeallitems.title: removeAllItems
removeallitems.description: Removes all special items from the unit.

removedrawicon.title: removeDrawIcon
removedrawicon.description: Removes an icon for an editor object.

removedrawlinks.title: removeDrawLinks
removedrawlinks.description: Remove all drawn links for the given editor object for the given editor,object type. Pass an empty string as param type to remove all draw,links for an object.

removegroupicon.title: removeGroupIcon
removegroupicon.description: Remove icon with given ID from group.

removemenuitem.title: removeMenuItem
removemenuitem.description: Removes a previously added menu item.

args.name: index
args.desc: index of menu item to delete

removesimpletask.title: removeSimpleTask
removesimpletask.description: Remove a simple task from the list of simple tasks.

removeteammember.title: removeTeamMember
removeteammember.description: Remove given member from given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

restarteditorcamera.title: restartEditorCamera
restarteditorcamera.description: Restarts the mission editor camera (if it was deleted by a script,for example).

reversedmousey.title: reversedMouseY
reversedmousey.description: Returns true if mouse vertical axe is inverted.

roadsconnectedto.title: roadsConnectedTo
roadsconnectedto.description: Find the road segments connected to the given road segment.

args.name: extended
args.desc: (Optional, default false) When true, performs a more thorough search on top of base behaviour, slower but returns pedestrian and other missing road segments

safezoneh.title: safeZoneH
safezoneh.description:
Image:safezone.jpg600
Returns the height of the screen in screen measurement units. Taken from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen and going in the same direction as the Y axis, the value will be positive but resulting Y will end up beyond the bottom border. Therefore in order to calculate Y of the bottom screen border, the length of safeZoneY must be subtracted from safeZoneH, but because it is negative, it must be added instead. . The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution getResolution. See also SafeZone

returns.desc: Height of the screen in screen measurement units

safezonew.title: safeZoneW
safezonew.description:
Image:safezone.jpg600
Returns the width of the screen in screen measurement units. Taken from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen and going in the same direction as the X axis, the value will be positive but resulting X will end up beyond the right border. Therefore in order to calculate X of the right screen border, the length of safeZoneX must be subtracted from safeZoneW, but because it is negative, it must be added instead. . The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution getResolution. See also SafeZone

returns.desc: Screen width in screen measurement units

safezonex.title: safeZoneX
safezonex.description:
Image:safezone.jpg600 Returns the X of the left border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen to the left border of the screen.
Since it is going in opposite way of the X axis, the value is negative. The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution getResolution. See also SafeZone.

safezoney.title: safeZoneY
safezoney.description:
Image:safezone.jpg600 Returns the Y of the top border of the screen, which is also a distance in screen measurement units from top left corner of the default viewport (0,0) of the screen to the top border of the screen.
Since it is going in opposite way of the Y axis, the value is negative. The measurement units depend on the current screen resolution getResolution. See also SafeZone.

savingenabled.title: savingEnabled
savingenabled.description: Check if saving the game is enabled.

screentoworld.title: screenToWorld
screentoworld.description: Returns the position on landscape (PositionAGL) corresponding to the given point on screen (in UI coordinates).

args.name: screen
args.desc: Screen position [x,y] (see SafeZone for more info)

scriptname.title: scriptName
scriptname.description: Assign a user friendly name to the VM script this command is executed from.

selectbestplaces.title: selectBestPlaces
selectbestplaces.description: Find the places with the maximum value of expression in the given area. Places can be on water. Results are sorted by value. Search pattern is randomised every command execution.

args.name: expression
args.desc: Arithmetic expression. Simple expression var names containing values from 0 to 1 depending on location (see also Ambient Parameters):

args.name: sourcesCount
args.desc: max results to return. The maximum possible is the number of random samples, which is n = 2 * radius / precision

selectdiarysubject.title: selectDiarySubject
selectdiarysubject.description: Selects a subject page in the diary. The subject page is selected but the command does not open the map by default, which could be opened with openMap if necessary.

args.name: subject
args.desc: Subject name, for example "Diary" (see also Diary).

returns.desc: true if subject was successfully selected

selectededitorobjects.title: selectedEditorObjects
selectededitorobjects.description: Returns a list of currently selected editor objects.

selecteditorobject.title: selectEditorObject
selecteditorobject.description: Select an editor object. Does not un-select previously selected objects.

selectnoplayer.title: selectNoPlayer
selectnoplayer.description: Switches player to no unit, makes player return objNull.

sendtask.title: sendTask
sendtask.description: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

sendtaskresult.title: sendTaskResult
sendtaskresult.description: Send a result of the task to the task sender.

servertime.title: serverTime
servertime.description: Returns the time since last server restart, synced to all clients in MP. The syncing is happening every 5 minutes, but you can force the next sync earlier by executing estimatedTimeLeft command. The time returned is also different to the time returned by time and diag_tickTime commands on server. Returns 0 in SP.

setarmorypoints.title: setArmoryPoints
setarmorypoints.description: Stores passed number into [USERNAME].ArmaXProfile file, where it assigns it as a value to armoryPoints entry. If entry doesn't exist, it is created.

setcurrenttask.title: setCurrentTask
setcurrenttask.description: Set the task as a current task of the person.

args.name: task
args.desc: the task you want to select

setdrawicon.title: setDrawIcon
setdrawicon.description: Set the icon to be shown in 2D editor for the specified editor object. If maintain size is false,icon will not scale depending on the scale,of the map. If maintain size is a number,the icon will maintain size,if map scale is below that number. is3D,show line and priority are,optional.

seteditormode.title: setEditorMode
seteditormode.description: Sets map mode to MAP,3D or PREVIEW.

seteditorobjectscope.title: setEditorObjectScope
seteditorobjectscope.description:
This command defines the level of access a user has to editor objects.

"objects" is an array of either Editor Objects (eg ["_unit_0"]) or actual Game Objects (eg [player]). If the array is empty then the command will automatically parse all editor objects.

"editorType" is the editor type to effect (eg "unit", "vehicle", "center") or "" for all types.

"condition" is an executable string that must evaluate to true or false. If true, the scope of the evaluated editor object will be modified. "_x" can be used in the string as reference to the ingame representation of the currently processed array member.

"scope" is one of "HIDE", "VIEW", "SELECT", "LINKTO", "LINKFROM", "ALLNODRAG", "ALLNOTREE", "ALLNOCOPY", "ALLNOSELECT" or "ALL".

"subordinatesAlso" is a boolean value. If true then subordinates in the editor will be assigned the same scope as the parent.

syntaxes.code: map setEditorObjectScope [objects, editorType, condition, scope, subordinatesAlso]

args.name: objects: Array of Objects and/or Editor Objects

setfromeditor.title: setFromEditor
setfromeditor.description: Set if given team member was inserted directly from editor.

setfsmvariable.title: setFSMVariable
setfsmvariable.description:
Set variable to given value in the variable space of given FSM.
The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

args.name: value
args.desc: new value of the FSM variable

args.name: id
args.desc: the icon ID returned by addGroupIcon

args.name: icon
args.desc: class name of desired icon from CfgGroupIcons

args.name: offset
args.desc: (Optional, default [0,0]) X and Y offsets of the icon in form [offsetX, offsetY]

setgroupiconsselectable.title: setGroupIconsSelectable
setgroupiconsselectable.description: Sets if group icons raise onGroupIconClick, onGroupIconOverEnter and onGroupIconOverLeave events.

args.name: selectable
args.desc: Setting to true makes the icon selectable

setgroupiconsvisible.title: setGroupIconsVisible
setgroupiconsvisible.description: Sets if group icons added with addGroupIcon are visible on map and in the HUD.

args.name: showOnMap
args.desc: true to show on map. Default is false

args.name: showOnHUD
args.desc: true to show on HUD. Default is false

sethit.title: setHit
sethit.description:
{! classwikitable float-right align-center-col-2
!+ 
! 
! Triggered
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!}

Set damage on a part of an object.

syntaxes.code: object setHit [part, damage, useEffects, killer, instigator]

args.name: damage
args.desc: Damage value ranging 0..1, 0 being fully functional, 1 being destroyed

args.name: useEffects
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to skip destruction effects

args.name:
killer: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The entity that caused the damage. If the damage leads to the death of the unit, the killer will be used as the object that caused the kill.
* it can be used to show "killed by player" in debriefing statistics and kill messages in the chat (if death messages are enabled).
* it will alter the killer's rating as if the killer directly killed the unit.
* it will be listed as  inline_killer parameter in the Killed event handler.

instigator: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The person that instigated the damage.
* if a tank is a killer, the tank gunner that pulled the trigger is instigator
* it will be listed as  inline_instigator parameter in the Killed event handler.

setleader.title: setLeader
setleader.description: Set the leader of the given Team. Effect is local, unless both leader unit and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

setmarkeralpha.title: setMarkerAlpha
setmarkeralpha.description:
Sets the marker alpha. The marker is modified on all computers in a network session.

When alpha equals , the marker is visible, but if alpha equals , then the marker is invisible.

Alpha can be numbers and fractions.

setobjectarguments.title: setObjectArguments
setobjectarguments.description: Set object arguments in mission editor.

setobjectproxy.title: setObjectProxy
setobjectproxy.description: Set the proxy object associated with the given editor object.

setposasl2.title: setPosASL2
setposasl2.description: Sets the object position. The pos array uses the PositionASL format. The version of the command does not offset based on object center.

setsimpletaskdescription.title: setSimpleTaskDescription
setsimpletaskdescription.description: Attach descriptions to the simple task.

setsimpletaskdestination.title: setSimpleTaskDestination
setsimpletaskdestination.description: Attach a destination to the simple task.Overrides setSimpleTaskTarget

settaskresult.title: setTaskResult
settaskresult.description: Set a result of the task.

settaskstate.title: setTaskState
settaskstate.description: Set the state of a given task.

args.name:
state: String - State value may be one of:
*"None"
*"Created"
*"Assigned"
*"Succeeded"
*"Failed"
*"Canceled"

setunconscious.title: setUnconscious
setunconscious.description:
In  and since  v1.64, this command sets unit into incapacitated state.
lifeState results:
* : "UNCONSCIOUS"
* : "INCAPACITATED"

setvisibleiftreecollapsed.title: setVisibleIfTreeCollapsed
setvisibleiftreecollapsed.description: Sets whether or not the object is visible even if the tree is collapsed.

setwaypointcompletionradius.title: setWaypointCompletionRadius
setwaypointcompletionradius.description: The completion radius allows units to call the waypoint completed once they are inside of the given circle. If the given radius is less than unit’s or vehicle’s configured 'precision' then the latter is used. For example tank precision is 10m, if the given radius is 5m, the final radius will be 10m. For units in player’s group there is an additional multiplier x5 to the configured precision. Units that are fleeing and are not in player's Group will ignore the completion radius and would not be able to complete by proximity until they stop fleeing.

setwind.title: setWind
setwind.description: Set current or permanent wind vector.

args.name: x
args.desc: Easterly component (in m/s, positive = to the east)

args.name: y
args.desc: Northerly component (in m/s, positive = to the north)

args.name: forced
args.desc: (Optional, default false) set to true to lock the wind to constantly blows in set direction

showcommandingmenu.title: showCommandingMenu
showcommandingmenu.description:
Create the commanding menu described by the given config class or menu name. When the name is empty, the current menu is hidden.
If commanding menu has "expression" set up, the expression will receive the following arguments when user activated the menu item:
* Local variable  : Object - Target under the cursor. This works in both 3D and 2D (when cursor is over the unit icon on the map).
* Local variable : Array - Cursor position.
* Local variable : Boolean - false if cursor is over the map, otherwise true.

args.name: name
args.desc: Class name or user menu name (with "#USER:" prefix and "_#" page number suffix, where # is the page number starting with 0).

showhud.title: showHUD
showhud.description: Enable / disable showing of HUD. Defines visibility of weapon crosshair and any informational tags that appear when pointing the weapon at an object as well as availability of the default action menu. Unfortunately, it also hides icons drawn with drawIcon3D.

syntaxes.code: showHUD [scriptedHUD, info, radar, compass, direction, menu, group, cursors, panels, kills, showIcon3D]

args.name: scriptedHUD
args.desc: show scripted HUD such as weapon crosshair, action menu and overlays created with cutRsc and titleRsc. Same as showHUD's first syntax

args.name: info: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show vehicle, soldier and weapon info
radar: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show vehicle radar
compass: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show vehicle compass
direction: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show tank direction indicator. Not present in vanilla
menu: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show commanding menu (HC related menus)
group: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show group info bar (Squad leader info bar)
cursors: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show HUD weapon cursors (connected with scripted HUD)
panels: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show Arma 3: Custom Info
kills: Boolean (Optional, default true) - show "x killed by y" systemChat messages
showIcon3D: Boolean (Optional, default false) - show icons drawn with drawIcon3D even when the HUD is hidden

showneweditorobject.title: showNewEditorObject
showneweditorobject.description: Show the add editor object dialog,type is editor object type,class is,class definition to automatically select,side filters by a certain,side,pos is position to create the object.

showsubtitles.title: showSubtitles
showsubtitles.description: Enables / disables showing of subtitles in a chat. Only scripted/engine chatter is affected, player manual chat is unaffected. Returns the previous state.

sideunknown.title: sideUnknown
sideunknown.description:
The unknown side.
Used when the side of a unit is unknown, e.g. for spotted targets with insufficient information.

simpletasks.title: simpleTasks
simpletasks.description: Return all simple tasks assigned to given unit.

simulationenabled.title: simulationEnabled
simulationenabled.description: Check if the entity has enabled simulation.

startloadingscreen.title: startLoadingScreen
startloadingscreen.description: Shows loading screen with the given text, using the given resource. While loading screen is shown, simulation and scene drawing is disabled, user control is disabled, mouse cursor is hidden, scripts run at full speed (50ms per frame instead of 3ms per frame for Scheduled Scripts).

switchaction.title: switchAction
switchaction.description: When used on a person, the given action is started immediately (there is no transition). Use switchmove "" to switch back to the default movement if there is no transition back, otherwise the person may be stuck.

switchgesture.title: switchGesture
switchgesture.description: When used on a person,the given move is started immediately (without transition).

synchronizedobjects.title: synchronizedObjects
synchronizedobjects.description: Return the list of objects synchronized with the given unit.

synchronizeobjectsadd.title: synchronizeObjectsAdd
synchronizeobjectsadd.description: Add given objects to the unit's list of synchronized objects.

synchronizeobjectsremove.title: synchronizeObjectsRemove
synchronizeobjectsremove.description: Removes given objects from the unit's list of synchronized objects.

targetsquery.title: targetsQuery
targetsquery.description: Returns sorted array of targets, known to the enquirer (including own troops), where the accuracy coefficient reflects how close the result matches the query. This command could be CPU intensive.

syntaxes.code: enquirer targetsQuery [targetIgnore, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetMaxAge]

args.name: enquirer
args.desc: For whom the query will be made

args.name: targetIgnore
args.desc: Target object to exclude from results. objNull - return every target

args.name: targetSide
args.desc: Desired side of the target. sideUnknown - any side

args.name: targetPosition
args.desc: Desired target position in format of Position2D or Position3D (only [x,y] is considered). Position tolerance is 200m from the actual position of the target. [] - any position

args.name: targetMaxAge
args.desc: Desired max age of the target. This will limit returned results to the targets younger than specified age. 0 - any age

taskchildren.title: taskChildren
taskchildren.description: Return the child tasks of the specified task.

taskcompleted.title: taskCompleted
taskcompleted.description: Return if task is completed. (state Succeeded, Failed or Canceled)

returns.desc: true if task has been Succeeded, Failed or Canceled

taskdescription.title: taskDescription
taskdescription.description: Returns the sub-parts of the task description. The returned Array is in format [Task description, Task title, Task waypoint description].

taskdestination.title: taskDestination
taskdestination.description: Returns the position of the task (as specified by destination parameter in config).

taskhint.title: taskHint
taskhint.description: Shows info about new, changed or failed task. The text can contain several lines.  is used to set a line return.

tasknull.title: taskNull
tasknull.description:
A non-existing Task. To compare non-existent tasks use isNull or isEqualTo:
taskNull == taskNull;			// false
isNull taskNull;				// true
taskNull isEqualTo taskNull;	// true

taskparent.title: taskParent
taskparent.description: Returns the parent task of the specified task.

taskresult.title: taskResult
taskresult.description: Send a result of the task to the task sender.

taskstate.title: taskState
taskstate.description: Returns the current state of a task.

args.name: task
args.desc: the task you want to query

teammember.title: teamMember
teammember.description: Return an agent for given person.

teammembernull.title: teamMemberNull
teammembernull.description:
A non-existent Team Member. To compare non-existent team members use isNull or isEqualTo:

teamMemberNull == teamMemberNull;			// false
isNull teamMemberNull;						// true
teamMemberNull isEqualTo teamMemberNull;	// true

triggeractivated.title: triggerActivated
triggeractivated.description: Returns true if the trigger has been activated.

triggeractivation.title: triggerActivation
triggeractivation.description: Returns trigger activation in the form [by, type, repeating].

triggerarea.title: triggerArea
triggerarea.description: Returns currently monitored trigger area. Since Arma 3 v1.60, the command returns 3rd dimension for the monitored area. If height is not set, the value for it would be -1.

triggerattachedvehicle.title: triggerAttachedVehicle
triggerattachedvehicle.description: Returns vehicle attached to the trigger (for example using triggerAttachVehicle).

triggertimeout.title: triggerTimeout
triggertimeout.description: Returns trigger timeout in the form [min, mid, max, interruptable].

uinamespace.title: uiNamespace
uinamespace.description: Returns the global namespace attached to user interface.

unlockachievement.title: unlockAchievement
unlockachievement.description: Unlocks the given achievement. The achievements are listed in CfgAchievements, however none of the currently listed achievements is used in Arma 3, hence the command always returns false.

unregistertask.title: unregisterTask
unregistertask.description: Unregisters a task type from given agent. The task type is the name given in  classes in  property. Also available from registeredTasks array.

updatedrawicon.title: updateDrawIcon
updatedrawicon.description: Updates the icon to be shown in 2D editor for the specified editor,object. If maintain size is false,icon will not scale depending on the,scale of the map. If maintain size is a number,the icon will maintain,size if map scale is below that number.

updatemenuitem.title: updateMenuItem
updatemenuitem.description: Sets the text and command for the menu item. index is index as returned from addMenuItem command. command is optional.

useaudiotimeformoves.title: useAudioTimeForMoves
useaudiotimeformoves.description: Switch between elapsed game time and audio time being used as animation timer. Used for audio/animation synchronization.

visiblemap.title: visibleMap
visiblemap.description: Return true if the main map is shown (active). In  it also returns true if the respawn screen map is visible.

waypointattachedobject.title: waypointAttachedObject
waypointattachedobject.description: Gets the object attached to the waypoint.

waypointattachedvehicle.title: waypointAttachedVehicle
waypointattachedvehicle.description:
Gets the vehicle attached to the waypoint.
A vehicle can be attached to a waypoint by
* creating the waypoint on top of the vehicle in the 2D Editor
* using waypointAttachVehicle

waypointcombatmode.title: waypointCombatMode
waypointcombatmode.description: Gets the waypoint's combat mode setting.

waypointcompletionradius.title: waypointCompletionRadius
waypointcompletionradius.description: Gets the radius around the waypoint where the waypoint is completed.

waypointformation.title: waypointFormation
waypointformation.description:
Gets the waypoint formation.

Possible values are: 
* "NO CHANGE"
* "COLUMN"
* "STAG COLUMN"
* "WEDGE"
* "ECH LEFT"
* "ECH RIGHT"
* "VEE"
* "LINE"
* "FILE"
* "DIAMOND"

waypointhouseposition.title: waypointHousePosition
waypointhouseposition.description: Returns buildingPos index assigned to the waypoint.

waypointspeed.title: waypointSpeed
waypointspeed.description:
Gets the waypoint speed.

Possible values are:
* "UNCHANGED"
* "LIMITED"
* "NORMAL"
* "FULL"

returns.desc: returns  if the waypoint doesn't exist.

worldtoscreen.title: worldToScreen
worldtoscreen.description: Converts position in world space into screen (UI) space. If a specified position is not within the current screen view, an empty array is returned.

returns.desc: Screen position in SafeZone format [x, y]. Returns an empty array  if not on-screen.

turretunit.title: turretUnit
turretunit.description: Returns the unit in the vehicle turret. To find turret path of known unit, see unitTurret.

args.name: turretPath: Array format Turret Path - since  [-1] (driver) is supported.

teamtype.title: teamType
teamtype.description: Returns a type of given team.

teams.title: teams
teams.description: Return a list of teams in the current mission.

teamname.title: teamName
teamname.description: Return a name of given team.

syntaxes.code: [speaker, side, classname, position, timeMax] targetsAggregate candidates

args.name: side
args.desc: if provided, a target with a side matching side will see it replaced by

args.name: classname
args.desc: classname - if provided, a target with a type matching classname will see it replaced by

args.name: position: Array format Position (Z-value is ignored) - centre of a hardcoded 200m radius

candidates: Array -  array of targets in format [[accuracy, target, targetSide, targetType, targetPosition, targetAge], ...] where:
* accuracy: Number - a coefficient, which reflects how close the returned result to the query filter. Range: 0..1, 1 being the best match
* target: Object - the actual target object
* targetSide: Side - side of the target
* targetType: String - target typeOf
* targetPosition: Array format Position2D - [x,y] of the target 
* targetAge: Number - the actual target age in seconds (can be negative)

getplayeruid.title: getPlayerUID
getplayeruid.description: Return a UniqueID of the given unit (player).

groupselectunit.title: groupSelectUnit
groupselectunit.description:
Selects a unit from player's group. If player is the leader, the effect of this command is similar to player pressing , ,  etc to highlight units in his squad, after which the unit command menu is shown.
If leader is AI, player will get usual communication menu to interact with the leader.

setposatl.title: setPosATL
setposatl.description: Sets the position of an object relative to the terrain.

getposatl.title: getPosATL
getposatl.description: Returns the position of an object relative to the terrain.

private.title: private
private.description: Sets a variable to the innermost scope as demonstrated in Example 3. See also param and params.

args.name: variableNameList: Array of Strings - e.g  inline["_target", "_damage"]
_identifier: underscored variable name, for example  inline_myVar
value: Anything: value to assign to the variable

resources.title: resources
resources.description: Returns the resources of a team member. Results are local to the PC on which command was executed.

addresources.title: addResources
addresources.description: Adds resources to a team member.

say3d.title: say3D
say3d.description:
Lets an object say given sound in 3D space.
This allows broadcasting of positional music or sound from a source, without having to script a fade sound or music command.
Compare this with say2D which will always play a sound at the location of the player after he has been in the vicinity of a broadcasting sound.
Sound is defined in "CfgSounds" of the Description.ext or main config.

args.name: sound
args.desc: classname of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including Description.ext

syntaxes.code: from say3D [sound, maxDistance, pitch, isSpeech, offset]

args.name: sound
args.desc: Classname of the sound to be played. Defined in CfgSounds including Description.ext

args.name: maxDistance
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) Maximum distance in meters at which the sound can be heard

args.name:
isSpeech: Boolean or  Number - (Optional, default false)
* 0/false = play as sound (fadeSound applies)
* 1/true = play as speech (fadeSpeech applies), filters are not applied to it (i.e. house or vehicle interior one)
* 2 = play as sound (fadeSound applies) without interior/vehicle muffling
offset
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) Offset in seconds. Same as playMusic.

args.name: sound

This allows simulation of heated up parts of a vehicle without it actually having to utilize them - on a 0..1 range - 0 being cold, 1 being hot.

setvelocitytransformation.title: setVelocityTransformation
setvelocitytransformation.description:
Image:setVelocityTransformation.jpgInterpolates and applies PositionASL, velocity, vectorDir and vectorUp to the given object based on the interval value.
When interval is 0 the "fromXXX" values are used for the beginning of the interpolation. When interval is 1, the "toXXX" values are used for the end of interpolation. When interval value is in between, interpolated values are used (see diagram below). The interpolation is linear and along straight line between "from" and "to" positions. If curve is needed, then it should be constructed from multiple straight sections or by dynamically changing value of position params during the interpolation cycle, similar to  (see Example 3).

The velocity param doesn't do much in SP, but in MP, provided the velocity component is set correctly, it helps the engine to figure out what the next position of the moving object should be on other clients.
The actual approximate interpolation formula for this command is:
_vecCurrent = _vecFrom vectorAdd (_vecTo vectorDiff _vecFrom vectorMultiply _interval);

syntaxes.code: object setVelocityTransformation [fromPosASL, toPosASL, fromVelocity, toVelocity, fromVectorDir, toVectorDir, fromVectorUp, toVectorUp, interval, customCenter]

args.name: fromPosASL: Array format PositionASL - starting getPosASL of the object
toPosASL: Array format PositionASL - ending getPosASL of the object
interval
args.desc: interpolation interval (variable value, normally between 0 and 1)

args.name: customCenter (Optional): Array - custom center [x, y, z] to which transformation would be applied in model coordinates. Default: placing point of the model (see getModelInfo)

callextension.title: callExtension
callextension.description:
Calls custom .dll also known as Extension. The name of the extension is the name of the extension .dll without ".dll" part (or without "_x64.dll" part on 64-bit Arma). For example if the file is 'myExtension.dll' the name of the extension will be "myExtension". For 64-bit extensions, the name of the extension doesn't need to change and is still "myExtension". The game will automatically look for 'myExtension_x64.dll' when you use 64-bit Arma exe.

This command is blocking, meaning that the game will wait for the extension to return before continuing. This may cause FPS drop if extension is not optimised. If extension takes too long, consider making asynchronous extension, where the result of the work of the extension is collected in a separate call.

Currently there is no limit how much data you can send to the extension. However there is a limit on how much data you can return from extension in one call. The limit is known to the extension and is passed in . The limit may or may not change in the future and is currently 10240 bytes. It is up to extension designer to handle multipart results if returned data exceeds output limit.

Since Arma 3 v1.67 it is possible to pass array of arguments to extensions. The array of arguments could be anything and all elements will be converted to strings, however you might want to only send simple types like Booleans, Strings, Numbers and Arrays of all of the above. There is currently a limit on how many arguments can be sent and it is 2048 (since Arma 3 v1.92; previous limit: 1024). However an argument could be an Array itself, in this case extension maker will have to provide additional methods for parsing such arguments.

Possible error codes:
* 101: SYNTAX_ERROR_WRONG_PARAMS_SIZE
* 102: SYNTAX_ERROR_WRONG_PARAMS_TYPE
* 201: PARAMS_ERROR_TOO_MANY_ARGS
* 301: EXECUTION_WARNING_TAKES_TOO_LONG
Each error will have entry in .rpt file with more details.

The extension execution timeout, after which  warning is issued, is hardcoded on clients and is 1000.0 milliseconds (1 second). On the server the default limit is also 1 second, however it is possible to set custom limit with  param (see  Server Options).

If an extension with the given name can't be found (or it is found but doesn't implement the required interface properly / at all) the following error will be written into the RPT (In this example the given dll-name was "MyExtension"):
 styledisplay: block14:27:07 CallExtension 'MyExtension' could not be found

If an extension is not whitelisted with BattlEye (see Extensions for more info) it will be blocked on clients running with enabled BattlEye protection. RPT message outputted however is a little obscure:
 styledisplay: block21:35:04 Call extension 'MyExtension' could not be loaded: Insufficient system resources exist to complete the requested service

Since Arma 3 v1.69,  interface (see source code example below) has been added, which is called by the engine on extension load and expects extension version. This interface is designed to work with both, Linux and Windows. The max buffer size is 32 bytes. The version information will then appear in .rpt file like so:
 styledisplay: block19:06:36 CallExtension loaded: test_extension (.\test_extension.dll) [1.0.0.1]

For more information see Extensions.

Linux specific
While on Windows the extension name is case-insensitive, on Linux the extension name is case-sensitive and should match the name of the .so file exactly (minus ".so" part).




Extension Callback

Since Arma 3 v1.95 it is possible to call the game directly from the extension via function pointer provided when extension is called for the first time (assuming the extension implements at least one of the  or  methods). The function pointer passed over to  method is of the following signature (see Example 4):
 langcppint(*callbackProc)(char const *name, char const *function, char const *data)
Calling this function pointer from extension will trigger  "ExtensionCallback" mission event handler with 3 user supplied params. The params are
*  - make it unique name, for example the extension name, so that other modders can quickly filter out calls from own extensions
*  - make it name of the function the extension sends the result to. (Note: The returned function is just a STRING! So compile is needed, before using call or spawn, to execute it)
*  - make it the actual result. You can also format it as an array so it could be parsed by parseSimpleArray
Calling function pointer returns an . This is the number of available slots in the input buffer left for this frame after your call and can range from 99 to -1. The buffer is processed and cleared every frame and the maximum number of slots that can be filled per frame is 100. If you are planning to call back with more than 100 results per frame, make sure your extension retries if it receives negative , which means the buffer was full and your call did not succeed. Ideally suited for callbacks from different threads, but if callback is initiated from the calling thread, the EH will fire on the next frame of game simulation. Needless to say, the "ExtensionCallback" event handler needs to exist before any callbacks, otherwise the data will just stay in the buffer. Removing all "ExtensionCallback" EHs clears the buffer as well as mission restart.

Extension Context

Since Arma 3 v2.11 the engine will call  method (if exists, see Example 5) and pass the following data:
*  of the client calling extension getPlayerUID or "0"
*  from which the extension was executed or "" if done on the fly
*  missionNameSource
*  serverName

returns.desc: data sent back from extension; If the extensiion was not found an empty String will be returned

args.name: arguments
args.desc: function arguments. Could be array of Anything, each element will be converted to String automatically. Current allowed max length of this array is 2048 (since Arma 3 v1.92; previous limit: 1024)

uisleep.title: uiSleep
uisleep.description:
Suspend execution of script for given uitime.  uiSleep is a sleep method to delay script execution where script time/simulation time is stopped.
uiSleep is basically using the system time (uiTime more specifically) and not simulation time.
So in the cases where sleep would get stuck indefinitely, uiSleep can still be used to effectively delay script execution for example in pause or in a mission briefing or an editor or when simulation is paused in general.

terrainintersect.title: terrainIntersect
terrainintersect.description: Checks for intersection of terrain between two AGL positions. Returns true if intersects with terrain. For ASL variant see terrainIntersectASL.

args.name: start: Array format PositionAGL - start position
end: Array format PositionAGL - end position

lineintersects.title: lineIntersects
lineintersects.description: Checks for object intersection with a virtual line between two positions.

args.name: objIgnore1
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object

args.name: objIgnore2
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported

returns.desc: true if an intersection happens with an object (not with terrain)

lineintersectswith.title: lineIntersectsWith
