* It can compare Arrays, Script Handles and Booleans (alive player isEqualTo true)
* It can compare non-existent game objects (grpNull isEqualTo grpNull)
* It is slightly faster than ==, especially when comparing Strings
*  It can compare Namespaces

switch.title: switch
switch.description:
Checks if the given parameter matches any case. If so, the code block of that case will be executed. After that the switch ends so no further cases will be checked.
If a case has no code block the code of the next case will automatically be executed, making it possible to formulate a logical "or" for cases which would otherwise contain the exact same code (see ).
The default block will be executed only if no case matches, no matter its position inside the code block. It is not a case, and will never be entered by fallthrough.

isautonomous.title: isAutonomous
isautonomous.description: Returns whether the UAV is in autonomous mode or not.

returns.desc: Whether the operation was successful. Returns false when the object is not a uav.

forceweatherchange.title: forceWeatherChange
forceweatherchange.description: Will force-apply previously set settings. This might cause lag.

logentities.title: logEntities
logentities.description:
Creates a log file containing the list of all game entities in scene. 
File is created in the same directory as .rpt file. 
Special: BattlEye's RCON variant of this command is #logEntities (see also Multiplayer_Server_Commands)

moveinany.title: moveInAny
moveinany.description:
Moves unit to the first available seat in the specified vehicle.

The order of priorities is the same order used in squad command when you order subordinates to get in vehicle to any position and is the same order used in Zeus when you drag units to a vehicle.
Seat assignment seems to use the following priority logic:
driver (moveInDriver) → commander (moveInCommander) → gunner (moveInGunner) → turrets (moveInTurret) → cargo (moveInCargo).

returns.desc: true on success, false on failure

getdlcs.title: getDLCs
getdlcs.description: Returns array of app IDs of DLCs.

args.name:
filter: Number - can be:
* 0 - all
* 1 - owned
* 2 - not owned

squadparams.title: squadParams
squadparams.description:
Returns data about squad of given unit loaded from squad.xml as well as about unit itself.
All items in returned array are String.

setstatvalue.title: setStatValue
setstatvalue.description:
Sets a value to a given stat. 
A list of possible StatNames can be found here: Arma 3: Stat Names
Its important to note that most Stats are restricted to scripts and missions in certain paths.
For example "ExpWarlockDown" is restricted to scripts in any subdirectory of

assignascargoindex.title: assignAsCargoIndex
assignascargoindex.description: Assigns the character to a specific cargo / passenger index of the given vehicle.

isuniformallowed.title: isUniformAllowed
isuniformallowed.description: Check whether given uniform can be dressed by target soldier.

forceadduniform.title: forceAddUniform
forceadduniform.description: Create a new uniform and hard link it into slot (without any restrictions).

everycontainer.title: everyContainer
everycontainer.description: Returns array of all containers (uniforms, vests, backpacks) stored in given crate or vehicle. Used for accessing containers content stored in ammo box or ground holder.

visiblegps.title: visibleGPS
visiblegps.description: Checks if the player has GPS receiver (minimap) opened and visible.

visiblewatch.title: visibleWatch
visiblewatch.description: Checks if the player has watch opened and visible. Keep in mind that the GPS minimap in  also shows the time.

visiblecompass.title: visibleCompass
visiblecompass.description: Checks if the player has compass opened and visible. Keep in mind that the GPS minimap in Arma 3 also shows the direction.

args.name: vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector2
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

vectordiff.title: vectorDiff
vectordiff.description: Subtracts one 3D vector from another. (vector1 - vector2)

args.name: vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector2
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

vectorcos.title: vectorCos
vectorcos.description: Cosine of angle between two 3D vectors.

args.name: vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since  v2.00, the z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector2
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since  v2.00, the z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: point1: Position3D or Position2D - (since , z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
point2: Position3D or Position2D - (since , z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

vectorcrossproduct.title: vectorCrossProduct
vectorcrossproduct.description:
Cross product of two 3D vectors. 
In layman's terms, if you have a polygon (surface) defined by 3 points, you can find a normal to it (just like terrain surfaceNormal). To invert direction of the normal, swap arguments around.

args.name: vector1:  Array - in form [x, y, z] or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector2:  Array - in form [x, y, z] or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)
vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector2
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

openyoutubevideo.title: openYoutubeVideo
openyoutubevideo.description: Opens Steam overlay with given YT video. Video URL is the end part of the YT URL, starting with watch?v=.... If the user has Steam overlay disabled, the command will display appropriate message to the user and return false.

enablemimics.title: enableMimics
enablemimics.description: Enables/disables mimics on a given unit.

magazinesammocargo.title: magazinesAmmoCargo
magazinesammocargo.description: Returns an array of subarrays with the type names and ammo left of all the vehicle's cargo or container magazines.

weaponsitemscargo.title: weaponsItemsCargo
weaponsitemscargo.description:
Returns an array with subarrays contains class names and also names of connected items of all the vehicle's cargo weapons in weaponsItems format. If weapon has no magazine, an empty array [] is returned instead of magazine info. If the argument is a vehicle with weapons, vehicles cargo is searched, unlike with weaponsItems command, which will return vehicle's weapons instead. 
* Since Arma 3 v1.96 the returned array always contains secondary muzzle magazine info and consistent with getUnitLoadout format for weapon items.

enemy.title: enemy
enemy.description: Returns Enemy side which is hostile to all units.

friendly.title: friendly
friendly.description: Returns Friendly side which is friendly to all units.

simulsethumidity.title: simulSetHumidity
simulsethumidity.description: Sets simul cloud cover. This command does not affect overcast value.

removeclothing.title: removeClothing
removeclothing.description: Removes specified named clothes selections from unit.

kbremovetopic.title: kbRemoveTopic
kbremovetopic.description: Unregister conversation topic from given person. See Conversations for more details.

enableautostartuprtd.title: enableAutoStartUpRTD
enableautostartuprtd.description: Toggle availability of the automated helicopter start-up and shutdown sequences.

radiochannelremove.title: radioChannelRemove
radiochannelremove.description: Remove the units from the custom radio channel.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

ispipenabled.title: isPiPEnabled
ispipenabled.description: Returns whether Picture-In-Picture video option (Render to Texture) is enabled or not.

radiochanneladd.title: radioChannelAdd
radiochanneladd.description: Add the units to the custom channel.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

debugfsm.title: debugFSM
debugfsm.description: Dump (something about FSM) to debugging output. This command is (assumed to be) non-functional in the retail version.

collectivertd.title: collectiveRTD
collectivertd.description:
Returns the current position of a helicopter's collective pitch control.
* 0: fully lowered
* 1: fully raised

sethitpointdamage.title: setHitPointDamage
sethitpointdamage.description:
{! classwikitable float-right align-center-col-2
!+ 
! 
! Triggered
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!-
! 
! 
!}

Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class). This command has no effect when allowDamage is set to false.

syntaxes.code: vehicle setHitPointDamage [hitPointName, damage, useEffects, killer, instigator]

args.name: vehicle : Object - vehicle to be damaged
hitPointName
args.desc: name of the Hit Point class

args.name: useEffects
args.desc: (Optional, default true) false to skip destruction effects

args.name:
killer: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The entity that caused the damage. If the damage leads to the death of the unit, the killer will be used as the object that caused the kill. 
* It can be used to show "killed by player" in debriefing statistics and kill messages in the chat (if death messages are enabled). 
* It will alter the killer's rating as if the killer directly killed the unit. 
* It will be listed as  inline_killer parameter in the Killed event handler.

instigator: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The person that instigated the damage.
* if a tank is a killer, the tank gunner that pulled the trigger is instigator
* it will be listed as  inline_instigator parameter in the Killed event handler.

setpipeffect.title: setPiPEffect
setpipeffect.description:
Sets Render Target's visual effect (Picture-in-Picture).
{! classwikitable align-center-col-1 stylefont-size: .95em
! Mode
! Description
! Parameters
!-
! 0
! Normal
! [0]
!-
! 1
! Night Vision
! [1]
!-
! 2
! Thermal Imaging
! [2]
!-
! 3
! Color Correction
! [3, enabled, brightness, contrast, offset, blend [r,g,b,a], lerp [r,g,b,a], rgb [r,g,b,a]]
!-

{{!}} 4
{{!}} Mirror - '''non-functional'''
{{!}} [4]
{{!}}-
{{!}} 5
{{!}} [[Post Process Effects#ChromAberration|Chromatic Aberration]] - '''non-functional'''
{{!}} [5, enabled, powerx, powery, (bool) aspectCorrection]
{{!}}-
{{!}} 6
{{!}} [[Post Process Effects#FilmGrain| Film Grain]] - '''non-functional'''
{{!}} <small>[6, enabled, intensity, sharpness, grainsize, intensityx1, intensityx2, (bool) monochromatic]</small>
{{!}}-

! 7
! Alt. Thermal Imaging 1 (Inverted)
! [7]
!-
! 8
! Alt. Thermal Imaging 2 (Green)
! [8]
!-
! 9..70
!  Alt. Thermal Imaging 3..64
! [n]
!}

args.name: name : String - render surface reference from Render To Texture

throttlertd.title: throttleRTD
throttlertd.description: Return the current throttle level for all engines of a helicopter.

args.name:
enable : Number - Can be:
* 0: off
* 1: on

settrafficdistance.title: setTrafficDistance
settrafficdistance.description: Set maximum ambient traffic draw distance (in 2D).

settrafficgap.title: setTrafficGap
settrafficgap.description: Set the average gap between ambient cars in a rectangle (in meters).

args.name: gap
args.desc: average gap between ambient cars (in meters)

args.name: xMin
args.desc: western border of the affected rectangle

args.name: xMax
args.desc: eastern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMin
args.desc: southern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMax
args.desc: northern border of the affected rectangle

radiochannelsetlabel.title: radioChannelSetLabel
radiochannelsetlabel.description: Set the custom radio channel's label.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

synchronizetrigger.title: synchronizeTrigger
synchronizetrigger.description: Synchronizes the trigger with zero or more waypoints.

args.name: waypoints: Array of Waypoints - waypoints to synchronize with trigger. Array can be empty to unset

batterychargertd.title: batteryChargeRTD
batterychargertd.description:
Returns the current charge of a helicopter's batteries.
* 0: empty
* 1: fully charged

setactualcollectivertd.title: setActualCollectiveRTD
setactualcollectivertd.description:
Sets the collective pitch control to a specific position, regardless of input devices (until those are changed).
* 0: collective fully down
* ~0.7: approximate stable hover position
* 1: collective fully up

setapurtd.title: setAPURTD
setapurtd.description: Let the Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) reach a desired state over the given period of time.

args.name: value
args.desc: desired APU state. 0 being completely off, 1 being fully powered up

setthrottlertd.title: setThrottleRTD
setthrottlertd.description:
Set the throttle for the given engine(s) of a helicopter. 
* engine index 0: engine #1
* engine index 1: engine #2
* engine index 2: engine #3
* engine index -1: all engines

* throttle 0: fully closed
* throttle ~0.15: average flight idle
* throttle 1: full

setbrakesrtd.title: setBrakesRTD
setbrakesrtd.description:
Enable landing gear wheel brakes for a helicopter.
* value 0: brakes off
* value 1: brakes on

* index 1: left wheels
* index 2: right wheels
* index 3: both sides

setcustomweightrtd.title: setCustomWeightRTD
setcustomweightrtd.description: Add virtual custom weight to a helicopter's center of gravity. This can be used to simulate added internal payload for specific scenarios, and affects the flight model.

radiochannelsetcallsign.title: radioChannelSetCallSign
radiochannelsetcallsign.description:
Set the custom radio channel's call sign. 

Available special parameters:
* $KEY (reference to a localized text)
* %CHANNEL_LABEL
* %UNIT_SIDE
* %UNIT_NAME
* %UNIT_RANK
* %UNIT_ID
* %UNIT_REF
* %UNIT_GRP_NAME
* %UNIT_GRP_LEADER
* %UNIT_VEH_NAME
* %UNIT_VEH_POSITION

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

settrafficdensity.title: setTrafficDensity
settrafficdensity.description: Set the density of ambient cars in a rectangle (in cars per kilometer).

args.name: xMin
args.desc: western border of the affected rectangle

args.name: xMax
args.desc: eastern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMin
args.desc: southern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMax
args.desc: northern border of the affected rectangle

setwantedrpmrtd.title: setWantedRPMRTD
setwantedrpmrtd.description:
Tell the helicopter engine RPMs to reach the given value within a period of time. The simulation will try to reach the RPMs, but it does not guarantee it will reach the precise value!
* engine index 0: engine #1
* engine index 1: engine #2
* engine index 2: engine #3
* engine index -1: all engines

args.name: time : Number - time to reach desired RPMs (seconds)

ropesetcargomass.title: ropeSetCargoMass
ropesetcargomass.description: Set the simulated mass of an object attached to a rope.

args.name: mass
args.desc: override cargo mass, if mass < 1 then original mass is used

gethitpointdamage.title: getHitPointDamage
gethitpointdamage.description:
Return current level of damage in range 0..1 for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class).
If you need to get damage of a selection instead of hit point, use getHit.

args.name: vehicle : Object - vehicle to be queried
hitPointName
args.desc: name of the Hit Point class

settrafficspeed.title: setTrafficSpeed
settrafficspeed.description: Set ambient traffic speed in a rectangle (in kilometers per hour).

args.name: xMin
args.desc: western border of the affected rectangle

args.name: xMax
args.desc: eastern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMin
args.desc: southern border of the affected rectangle

args.name: zMax
args.desc: northern border of the affected rectangle

setbatteryrtd.title: setBatteryRTD
setbatteryrtd.description: Toggle a helicopter's electrical systems on and off.

ropedestroy.title: ropeDestroy
ropedestroy.description: Destroys the given rope. If the rope is attached to a vehicle, it will be detached and then destroyed.

args.name: rope
args.desc: rope object returned by ropeCreate command

numberofenginesrtd.title: numberOfEnginesRTD
numberofenginesrtd.description: Returns the number of engines a helicopter has.

systemofunits.title: systemOfUnits
systemofunits.description:
Returns the currently selected system of units.
* 0: Metric
* 1: Mixed (ground vehicles use Metric / air vehicles use Imperial)
* 2: Imperial

radiochannelcreate.title: radioChannelCreate
radiochannelcreate.description: Create a custom radio channel with the given color, label, call sign and registered characters. The custom channel ID returned can be used to manipulate the created channel later. There are 10 slots for custom radio channels which would correspond to channels 6-15 (see getPlayerChannel). The command will find an unused index in this range and create it when found.

args.name: units
args.desc: list of units in the channel

args.name:
sentenceType: Boolean - (Optional, default true)
* true - use Protocol message color from 
* false - use Normal message color from

returns.desc: created custom channel ID (used in customChat command), 0 if failed

ropedetach.title: ropeDetach
ropedetach.description: Detaches attached object from rope (i.e. detaches rope end from attached to it entity). See ropeAttachTo for attach operation.

args.name: attachedObject
args.desc: entity attached to the end of rope

args.name: rope
args.desc: rope object to which entity is attached

setbatterychargertd.title: setBatteryChargeRTD
setbatterychargertd.description:
Set the actual battery charge of a helicopter.
* 0: no charge
* 1: fully charged

setstarterrtd.title: setStarterRTD
setstarterrtd.description:
Toggle the starter for the given helicopter engine(s) on or off. 
* engine index 0: engine #1
* engine index 1: engine #2
* engine index 2: engine #3
* engine index -1: all engines

allmines.title: allMines
allmines.description: Returns an array of all mines in the mission

detectedmines.title: detectedMines
detectedmines.description: Returns an array of all mines detected by a given side

minedetectedby.title: mineDetectedBy
minedetectedby.description: Returns true if mine has been detected by a given side

isuavconnectable.title: isUAVConnectable
isuavconnectable.description: Returns true if UAV is connectable by AV terminal(s).

args.name: checkAllItems
args.desc: true to check all terminals in unit's inventory, false to only check assigned terminal.

enableuavconnectability.title: enableUAVConnectability
enableuavconnectability.description: Enables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

args.name: checkAllItems
args.desc: True for enabling of all terminals in unit's inventory, false for enabling of terminal assigned to proper slot only.

disableuavconnectability.title: disableUAVConnectability
disableuavconnectability.description: Disables unit's AV terminal(s) connecting to UAV.

args.name: checkAllItems
args.desc: true to disable all terminals in unit's inventory, false to only disable the currently assigned terminal.

vectorfromto.title: vectorFromTo
vectorfromto.description:
Unit vector, equal to direction from vector1 to vector2. In other words this command produces  normalised vector between given 2 points.
To get a non-normalised vector, use vectorDiff.

args.name: vector1
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since , z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

args.name: vector2
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since , z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

vectornormalized.title: vectorNormalized
vectornormalized.description: Returns normalized vector (unit vector, vectorMagnitude == 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

args.name: vector
args.desc: vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v2.00, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

reverse.title: reverse
reverse.description: Reverses given array by reference (modifies the original array, just like resize). The alternative syntax can be used to reverse a ANSI string. If Unicode support is desired, see forceUnicode.

configclasses.title: configClasses
configclasses.description: Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through all available config sub classes of the given config class. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative count command implementation). Condition has to return true in order for the looked at config to be added to the resulting array. Slightly faster than configProperties, but doesn't account for config properties or inherited entries.

getplayeruidold.title: getPlayerUIDOld
getplayeruidold.description: Returns the old UniqueID of Arma 2 OA of the given unit as string if it is player and empty value if it is AI. The uniqueID may be up to 100 characters long and may contain numbers, uppercase letters and underscores (the value can be used to construct a valid variable name by appending to another valid variable name).

pushback.title: pushBack
pushback.description: Insert an element to the back of the given array. This command modifies the original array. (see also: pushBackUnique)

settimemultiplier.title: setTimeMultiplier
settimemultiplier.description: Sets a time multiplier for in-game time. The command range is capped at 0.1 - 120 to avoid performance problems.

args.name: value
args.desc: has to be in range from 0.1 to 120

timemultiplier.title: timeMultiplier
timemultiplier.description: Returns the value set with setTimeMultiplier.

lockcamerato.title: lockCameraTo
lockcamerato.description: Lock/Unlock stabilized camera to target. Works only on turrets which have optic mode selected with direction stabilization enabled.

args.name: target: Object or Array format PositionASL - use objNull to unlock
turretPath
args.desc: path to the turret with required camera

args.name: target: Object or Array format PositionASL - use objNull to unlock
turretPath
args.desc: path to the turret with required camera

args.name:
temporary: Boolean - If set to true, the engine will automatically remove the lock-on once the turret reaches its target.
If the target is out of turret's reach, the turret will move to the maximum of its capacity towards the target.

getcargoindex.title: getCargoIndex
getcargoindex.description: Returns index of the unit in cargo. -1 if not in cargo.

ctrlcreate.title: ctrlCreate
ctrlcreate.description:
Creates a new control in the given display.
The control class could be an existing class from the  main config or a custom class defined in the  mission config.
The main config is searched first, if the class does not exist there, the mission config is searched.
Some of the common controls defined in the main config that can be used with this command:
<spoiler text="Show list">


{! classwikitable width100%
!-
! Class !! Description !! Available since
!-
! RscText !! simple text box !!
!-
! RscStructuredText !! text box which supports structured text !!
!-
! RscTextMulti !! simple multiline text box !!
!-
! RscPicture !! simple picture box !!
!-
! RscPictureKeepAspect !! picture box that doesn't stretch picture !!
!-
! RscEdit !! input box !!
!-
! RscEditMulti !! multiline input box !!
!-
! RscEditReadOnly !! input box with   !! v1.98
!-
! RscEditMultiReadOnly !! multiline input box with  !! v1.98
!-
! RscTree !! tree view control !!
!-
! RscTreeMulti !! multi-select tree view !! v2.02
!-
! RscTreeSearch !! searchable tree view control (see Example 4) !!
!-
! RscVideo !! picture control with autostart for video texture (see BIS_fnc_playVideo) !!
!-
! RscVideoKeepAspect !! picture control for video to keep original video aspect ratio !!
!-
! RscButtonMenuBIKI !! shortcut button with url pointing to "https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/" !! v1.98
!-
! RscControlsGroup !! default controls group !!
!-
! RscControlsGroupNoScrollbars !! controls group without scrollbars !!
!-
! RscControlsGroupNoHScrollbars !! controls group without horizontal scrollbar !!
!-
! RscControlsGroupNoVScrollbars !! controls group without vertical scrollbar !!
!}
</spoiler>

args.name: display
args.desc: display in which control will be created

args.name: class
args.desc: existing classname (see ctrlCreate/classnames) of the new control. Since  v1.70 it is possible to use classes defined in mission config

args.name: idc
args.desc: IDC of the new control. Use -1 if not needed

args.name: controlsGroup
args.desc: (Optional) creates controls in existing controls group

ctrldelete.title: ctrlDelete
ctrldelete.description: Deletes given control. The control has to be created either by script with ctrlCreate or to have  property in config set to 1. Use ctrlShow false and ctrlEnable false to disable controls that cannot be deleted. Returns Boolean indicating  whether the deletion was successful.

getdirvisual.title: getDirVisual
getdirvisual.description: Returns object's heading in the range from 0 to 360 in render time scope.

args.name: pos1: Object, Position2D or Position3D - from where
pos2: Object, Position2D or Position3D - to where

modeltoworldvisual.title: modelToWorldVisual
modeltoworldvisual.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in render time scope. For ASL version see modelToWorldVisualWorld.

args.name: modelPos
args.desc: in format PositionRelative ([x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre)

vectordirvisual.title: vectorDirVisual
vectordirvisual.description:
Return object's normalized direction vector in world space () in render time scope. 
* A unit facing North would return 
* A unit facing East would return 
* A unit facing South would return 
* A unit facing West would return

vectorupvisual.title: vectorUpVisual
vectorupvisual.description: Return object's up vector in world Position coordinates ( [x, y, z] ) in render time scope.

worldtomodelvisual.title: worldToModelVisual
worldtomodelvisual.description: Converts position from world space to object model space in render time scope.

addtoremainscollector.title: addToRemainsCollector
addtoremainscollector.description: Adds an array of vehicles/units to disposal manager for automatic wreck/body removal. The disposal manager follows wreck/body removal values set in description.ext

args.name: remains: Array of Objects - array of vehicles/units

removefromremainscollector.title: removeFromRemainsCollector
removefromremainscollector.description: Removes vehicles/units from the garbage collector, so they do not get deleted automatically; added earlier with addToRemainsCollector.

isinremainscollector.title: isInRemainsCollector
isinremainscollector.description: Checks if unit or vehicle is queued for disposal after death.

getposworld.title: getPosWorld
getposworld.description: Returns the provided object's model centre position ([0,0,0]) in PositionASL, rather than the transformed boundingCenter or LandContact vertices.

setposworld.title: setPosWorld
setposworld.description: Sets position of an object based on the model's centre position (see getPosWorld).

ctrlsetmodel.title: ctrlSetModel
ctrlsetmodel.description: Sets model for 3D-Dialogs (see Arma 3: createSimpleObject/objects for a p3d models' list).

ctrlclassname.title: ctrlClassName
ctrlclassname.description:
Returns the class name of a Control as it is defined in config. If you need config class of a game created Display, it is stored on display itself:
_className = findDisplay 12 getVariable ["BIS_fnc_initDisplay_configClass", ""]; // "RscDiary"

deletevehiclecrew.title: deleteVehicleCrew
deletevehiclecrew.description: Deletes a member of or the whole crew of a vehicle. Human players cannot be deleted.

addmagazineammocargo.title: addMagazineAmmoCargo
addmagazineammocargo.description: Adds magazines with specified ammo count to the cargo space of a vehicle or a container.

args.name: quantity
args.desc: number of magazines to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove magazines.

addbackpackglobal.title: addBackpackGlobal
addbackpackglobal.description: Adds a backpack to a unit (even non-local).

removebackpackglobal.title: removeBackpackGlobal
removebackpackglobal.description: Removes backpack from a unit. (even non-local)

scriptnull.title: scriptNull
scriptnull.description:
A non-existing or completed Script Handle. To compare non-existent scripts use isNull or isEqualTo:

scriptNull == scriptNull;			// ERROR! == cannot be used with script object
isNull scriptNull;					// true
scriptNull isEqualTo scriptNull;	// true

ctrlmodeldirandup.title: ctrlModelDirAndUp
ctrlmodeldirandup.description: Returns vectorDir and vectorUp of the model used in 3D-Dialogs.

ctrlsetmodeldirandup.title: ctrlSetModelDirAndUp
ctrlsetmodeldirandup.description: Sets orientation of 3D control model. It is similar to setVectorDirAndUp command for an object.

gethit.title: getHit
gethit.description: Returns selection damage. Same as getHitPointDamage, only the argument is selection part instead of hit point.

args.name: vehicle : Object - vehicle to be queried

returns.desc: before , Nothing was returned when an invalid selection was provided

deleteat.title: deleteAt
deleteat.description: Removes array element at the given 0-based index and returns removed element (modifies the original array, just like resize or set).

deleterange.title: deleteRange
deleterange.description: Removes a range of array elements from the given array. Modifies the original array, just like resize or set.

args.name: from
args.desc: Array index to start selection from.

args.name: count
args.desc: Number of array elements to remove. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the end of the array.

enablepersonturret.title: enablePersonTurret
enablepersonturret.description: Enables or disables firing from a vehicle cargo position. To get the turret path use assignedVehicleRole or getCargoIndex command.

getworld.title: getWorld
getworld.description: Returns the name of the current map. Name is actually class as defined in config (eg Intro).

islighton.title: isLightOn
islighton.description: Returns true if vehicle headlights are on otherwise false.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle with search light on a turret

iscollisionlighton.title: isCollisionLightOn
iscollisionlighton.description: Returns true if vehicle collision lights are on otherwise false.

setpilotlight.title: setPilotLight
setpilotlight.description: Switches headlights of a vehicle on/off. Note that the vehicle has to be local, for global variant use Arma 3 Actions "LightOn"/"LightOff"

setcollisionlight.title: setCollisionLight
setcollisionlight.description: Switches collision lights of a vehicle on/off.

turretlocal.title: turretLocal
turretlocal.description: Checks if a turret is local.

addweaponturret.title: addWeaponTurret
addweaponturret.description: Adds a weapon to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

removeweaponturret.title: removeWeaponTurret
removeweaponturret.description: Removes weapon from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

getposaslvisual.title: getPosASLVisual
getposaslvisual.description: Returns an object's rendered ASL position (z value above sea level) in render time scope.

getposatlvisual.title: getPosATLVisual
getposatlvisual.description: Returns an object's rendered ATL position (z value above ground) in render time scope.

getposvisual.title: getPosVisual
getposvisual.description: Returns an object's AGLS position in render time scope. Alias of visiblePosition.

args.name: object: Object: - name of the object

ropes.title: ropes
ropes.description: Returns all ropes attached to a ropes owner transport in an Array, otherwise an empty array  is returned.

args.name: ropesOwner
args.desc: a transport from which the ropes originate

returns.desc: array of the actual rope objects

canslingload.title: canSlingLoad
canslingload.description: Returns true if setSlingLoad is possible.

args.name: typeOfCargo
args.desc: a config type of cargo (the object of type cargo has to exist in the mission)

returns.desc: true if can be sling loaded in principle

enableropeattach.title: enableRopeAttach
enableropeattach.description: Enables or disables the ability to be attached to a rope end for the given entity.

getslingload.title: getSlingLoad
getslingload.description: Return object which is sling loaded by vehicle

returns.desc: the sling loaded vehicle. objNull if nothing is sling loaded.

ropeattachedobjects.title: ropeAttachedObjects
ropeattachedobjects.description:
Returns an array of all entities that are attached to the transport with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedTo.
Image:ropeAttachedObjects.jpg400

args.name: ropesOwner
args.desc: transport from which a single or multiple ropes are originating

returns.desc: array of attached entities on ropes

ropeattachto.title: ropeAttachTo
ropeattachto.description: Attaches entity to the rope end with optional offset. For detach operation use ropeDetach.

args.name: entity
args.desc: entity to be attached to the end of rope

args.name: toPoint: String or Array - (Optional) position for the rope end, either a memory point String or relative offset Array
ropeEndDownVector: String or Array - (Optional, default [0,0,-1]) either a memory point String or relative vector Array. If String is given, then  is calculated from  towards  memory point
rope
args.desc: the rope to which entity will be attached to

args.name: entity
args.desc: entity to be attached to the end of rope

args.name: rope
args.desc: the rope to which entity will be attached to

ropelength.title: ropeLength
ropelength.description: Return rope length in meters (set by ropeCreate, ropeCut, ropeUnwind).

ropeunwound.title: ropeUnwound
ropeunwound.description: Returns false if rope length changing animation is in progress. Returns true if animation is done.

ropeattachedto.title: ropeAttachedTo
ropeattachedto.description:
Returns the owner of the first rope - the transport to which other entities are attached with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedObjects. To return all owners see ropesAttachedTo.
Image:ropeAttachedTo.jpg400

args.name: cargo
args.desc: entity attached to the end of the first rope

returns.desc: a transport from which the first rope originates, the rope owner

ropeattachenabled.title: ropeAttachEnabled
ropeattachenabled.description: Returns true if entity can be attached to a rope end.

ropecut.title: ropeCut
ropecut.description: Cuts the given rope to the specified length. If some entity was attached to the end of the rope, it will be detached. The rope remains attached to its parent transport and if the length is set to 0 or even negative does not get destroyed. Use ropeDestroy to remove it completely.

args.name: length
args.desc: length of the rope in meters after the cut

ropeendposition.title: ropeEndPosition
ropeendposition.description: Returns start and end positions for the given  rope. If command fails, empty array  is returned.

ropeunwind.title: ropeUnwind
ropeunwind.description: Increases or decreases the rope length by the given amount. Use relative parameter for changing rope length +/- from current length.

args.name: speed
args.desc: animation speed in m/s with which to lengthen or shorten the rope, in range 0.01..20

args.name: length
args.desc: the amount of length change in meters, in range: 0.1..100

args.name: relative
args.desc: (Optional) true will add or subtract given length from current rope length, false will resize the rope to the given length

setslingload.title: setSlingLoad
setslingload.description: Creates a sling loading from a helicopter to an entity if possible. To unload cargo, pass objNull as second param.

slingloadassistantshown.title: slingLoadAssistantShown
slingloadassistantshown.description: Returns true if Sling Load Assistant is open.

returns.desc: true if sling load assistant is shown, false otherwise

fullcrew.title: fullCrew
fullcrew.description: Returns an array with all crew inside given vehicle, with or without empty seats.

args.name:
type: String - role filter (case-insensitive). An invalid value (e.g "") will return all positions. Available values:
* "driver"
* "commander"
* "gunner"
* "turret"
* "cargo"
includeEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default false) include empty crew seats

servercommandexecutable.title: serverCommandExecutable
servercommandexecutable.description: Returns true if the serverCommand can be performed on the machine and in this exact environment, otherwise false. serverCommand can be executed only from User Interface Event Handlers, and this command also checks if that's the case.

args.name: command
args.desc: see Multiplayer Server Commands for all available commands

gearslotammocount.title: gearSlotAmmoCount
gearslotammocount.description: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

isdlcavailable.title: isDLCAvailable
isdlcavailable.description:
Returns true if the DLC (CDLC included) is marked as available on Steam.
Official and Creator DLC appIds can be found on Arma 3: DLCs & Expansions and Arma 3: CDLCs pages.

isautotest.title: isAutotest
isautotest.description: Returns true if game was started with autotest parameter

isobjectrtd.title: isObjectRTD
isobjectrtd.description: Returns true if RTD model is loaded.

enginestorquertd.title: enginesTorqueRTD
enginestorquertd.description: Torque produced by engines in N·m (Newton × meter).

allturrets.title: allTurrets
allturrets.description: Returns array of available turret paths from vehicle object.

args.name: includeFFV
args.desc: true to include FFV (Firing From Vehicle) positions, false to exclude them

returns.desc: [fuselage weight, crew weight, fuel weight, custom weight, weapons weight] (kilograms)

difficultyenabledrtd.title: difficultyEnabledRTD
difficultyenabledrtd.description:
Returns true if Advanced Flight Model is enabled.
Forcing of rotorlib simulation could be done with mission param forceRotorLibSimulation.

airdensityrtd.title: airDensityRTD
airdensityrtd.description: Returns air density in given altitude.

enginesisonrtd.title: enginesIsOnRTD
enginesisonrtd.description: Returns which engines are producing some work.

getpersonuseddlcs.title: getPersonUsedDLCs
getpersonuseddlcs.description: Returns a list of all DLCs objects the unit is currently using. For example if a unit is inside a vehicle from DLC, it will return the code of that DLC.

shownchat.title: shownChat
shownchat.description: Returns true if chat window is enabled. Chat window can be disabled with showChat command.

getobjectdlc.title: getObjectDLC
getobjectdlc.description: Returns appID of the DLC the object belongs to or nil if object is vanilla.

configproperties.title: configProperties
configproperties.description:
Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through available classes and config properties for given config entry.
If 3rd param is true the search also includes inherited properties. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative count command implementation).
Condition has to return true in order for the looked at property to be added to the resulting array. A bit slower than configClasses but allows to access inherited entries.

args.name: condition
args.desc: (Optional, default "true") expression, which if returns true, adds current property to result

removesecondaryweaponitem.title: removeSecondaryWeaponItem
removesecondaryweaponitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the secondaryWeapon.

allvariables.title: allVariables
allvariables.description:
Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace. Namespaces supported:
*Control - Since  v2.01
*Display - Since  v2.01
*Team Member
*Namespace
*Object
*Group
*Task
*Location

args.name: namespace: Control (Since  v2.01), Display (Since  v2.01)  Team Member, Namespace, Object, Group, Task, Location

alldisplays.title: allDisplays
alldisplays.description: Returns a list of all opened GUI displays.

allcontrols.title: allControls
allcontrols.description: Returns a list of all controls for desired existing display. Returned controls also include controls from CT_CONTROLS_GROUPs.

turretowner.title: turretOwner
turretowner.description: Returns id of the turret's owner. Returns 0 on non-server and SP.

args.name: turretPath: Array format Turret Path - since  [-1] (driver) is supported

getobjecttextures.title: getObjectTextures
getobjecttextures.description: Gets all custom textures (hiddenSelectionsTextures) associated with the object.

getobjectmaterials.title: getObjectMaterials
getobjectmaterials.description: Gets all custom materials associated with the object.

magazineturretammo.title: magazineTurretAmmo
magazineturretammo.description: Returns ammo count of given type from given turret

setmagazineturretammo.title: setMagazineTurretAmmo
setmagazineturretammo.description: Sets ammo count to given amount for given turret.

append.title: append
append.description: Appends array2 to the back of array1 modifying array1. See insert for an "appendUnique" equivalent.

configsourcemodlist.title: configSourceModList
configsourcemodlist.description: Returns an array of mods (CfgMods) in which the given config class is defined.

waypointsenableduav.title: waypointsEnabledUAV
waypointsenableduav.description: Checks if the UAV has waypoints enabled.

enableuavwaypoints.title: enableUAVWaypoints
enableuavwaypoints.description: Enables/disables the option for player to set waypoints for UAV in AV terminal.

setgroupowner.title: setGroupOwner
setgroupowner.description: Changes the ownership of a group (and all its units) to a given client. The group leader must not be a player. This command only works when called from the server. Returns true if locality was changed. For agents use setOwner command.

args.name: clientID
args.desc: the  machine network ID of the new owner.

groupowner.title: groupOwner
groupowner.description: Returns the  machine network ID of the client to which the group is local. This command only works when called from the server. When called from a client, it always returns 0.

isweaponrested.title: isWeaponRested
isweaponrested.description: Returns true if weapon is currently rested.

isweapondeployed.title: isWeaponDeployed
isweapondeployed.description: Returns true if weapon is currently deployed.

args.name: onGround
args.desc: (Optional) true to check if deployed on ground, false to check if deployed on object. Omitted - same as main syntax.

configsourcemod.title: configSourceMod
configsourcemod.description: Returns modDir of the mod that given config class was loaded from.

controlsgroupctrl.title: controlsGroupCtrl
controlsgroupctrl.description: Returns a child control with specified idc from a controls group

leaderboardinit.title: leaderboardInit
leaderboardinit.description: Initialize the leaderboard structure for board with given name. Returns true if board is already initialized.

leaderboarddeinit.title: leaderboardDeInit
leaderboarddeinit.description: Deletes internal class for the leaderboard with given name. Returns true if the board has been found and deinitialized.

leaderboardgetrows.title: leaderboardGetRows
leaderboardgetrows.description: Returns values for the given leaderboard; this can be called after the one of the row request function has been called and successfully finished!

setsuppression.title: setSuppression
setsuppression.description: Sets the given suppression value for the given unit.

getsuppression.title: getSuppression
getsuppression.description: Gets the suppression value for the given unit. Returns varying Number between 0 and 1, or -1 if suppression is disabled () or the suppression value is not available. Suppression is not calculated for player entities and is always 0, unless it is set with setSuppression. In this case the return value is the set value. Before Arma 3 v1.92 this command could return nil.

returns.desc: from 0 to 1, or -1 if suppression is not available.

sort.title: sort
sort.description: Attempts to sort given array either in ascending (true) or descending (false) order.

args.name:
array: Array - Array to be sorted, can also be a nested array.
All array elements should be one of the following types:
* String - Array of strings 
* Number - Array of numbers 
* Array - Array of subarrays . Subarrays should be of the same structure. Subarray elements other than String or Number will be ignored during sorting.
Mixed arrays  are not supported and results are undefined.

order: Boolean - Sorting order. 
* true: ascending
* false: descending

groupid.title: groupId
groupid.description: Returns a group's name or a unit's group ID number.

returns.desc: the unit's group ID (e.g "2, taking command")

remoteexec.title: remoteExec
remoteexec.description:
Asks the server to execute the given function or script command on the given target machine(s).
* Functions are executed in the scheduled environment; suspension is allowed.
* Script commands are executed in the unscheduled environment; suspension is not allowed (see ).

Read Arma 3: Remote Execution for more information about remote execution, security features and JIP techniques.

args.name: params: Anything but Structured Text - order's parameter
order
args.desc: Function or command name; while any function or command can be used here, only those allowed by CfgRemoteExec will actually be executed

args.name:
targets (Optional, default: 0):
* Number (See also Machine network ID):
** 0: the order will be executed globally, i.e. on the server and every connected client, including the machine where remoteExec originated
** 2: the order will only be executed on the server
** Other number: the order will be executed on the machine where clientOwner matches the given number
** Negative number: the effect is inverted: -2 means every client but not the server, -12 means the server and every client, except for the client where clientOwner returns 12
* Object - The order will be executed where the given object is local
* String - Interpreted as an Identifier (variable name). The function / command will be executed where the object or group identified by the variable with the provided name is local
* Side - The order will be executed on machines where the player is on the specified side
* Group - The order will be executed on machines where the player is in the specified group
* Array - Array of any combination of the types listed above

JIP (Optional, default: false):
* Boolean - If true, a unique JIP ID is generated and the remoteExec statement is added to the JIP queue from which it will be executed for every JIP
* String:
** If the string is empty, it is interpreted as false
** If the string is in format "Number:Number" (e.g. "0:0"), it is interpreted as a netId (see below)
** Else the string is treated as a custom JIP ID and the remoteExec statement is added to the JIP queue, replacing statements that have the same JIP ID
* Object, Group or netId - The persistent execution of the remoteExec statement is attached to the given object or group.When the object / group is deleted, the remoteExec statement is automatically removed from the JIP queue

The JIP parameter can only be used if the targets parameter is 0 or a negative number.See also Example 3 on how to remove statements from the JIP queue.
functionName
args.desc: See the main syntax above for more details.

args.name: targets (Optional, default: 0): Number, Object, String, Side, Group or Array - See the main syntax above for more details.
JIP (Optional, default: false): Boolean, String, Object, Group or netId - See the main syntax above for more details.

remoteexeccall.title: remoteExecCall
remoteexeccall.description: Unscheduled version of remoteExec. The only difference between remoteExec and remoteExecCall is that remoteExecCall will run functions in unscheduled environment.

profilenamesteam.title: profileNameSteam
profilenamesteam.description: Returns name of the current Steam profile. For currently chosen user profile name see profileName

params.title: params
params.description:
Parses input argument into array of private variables. When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable _this, which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument.
In addition to simple parsing directly into variables, input can be tested in case it is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array) and substituted if necessary with default values. Since Arma 3 v1.54, onscreen errors are displayed for when the input is of the wrong type or size.

args.name:
elementN: String or Array
* String:name of the private variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
* Array format [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]:
** variableName: String - name of a private variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
** defaultValue: Anything - default value to return if input element is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array).
** expectedDataTypes: Array of direct Data Types - (Optional) checks if passed value is one of listed Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
** expectedArrayCount: Number or Array - (Optional) a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.

returns.desc: false if error occurred or default value has been used, otherwise true

args.name: argument
args.desc: A usual array of params is expected. If a non-array argument is passed, it will be converted to 1 element array

args.name:
elementN: String or Array
* String:name of the private variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
* Array format [variableName, defaultValue, expectedDataTypes, expectedArrayCount]:
** variableName: String - name of a private variable (must begin with underscore _, e.g. "_myVar")
** defaultValue: Anything - default value to return if input element is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong size (if array).
** expectedDataTypes: Array of direct Data Types - (Optional) checks if passed value is one of listed Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.
** expectedArrayCount: Number or Array - (Optional) a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.

returns.desc: false if error occurred or default value has been used, otherwise true

param.title: param
param.description:
Extracts a single value with given index from input argument, similar to BIS_fnc_param.  When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable _this, which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument. If input argument is not an array, it will be converted to 1 element array.

If extracted item of input with given index is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array), default value is used instead. Since Arma 3 v1.54, onscreen errors are displayed for when the input is of the wrong type or size.

args.name: index
args.desc: index of required item in the input array.

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: (Optional) a default value to return if input is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array).

args.name: expectedDataTypes: Array of direct  Data Types - (Optional) checks if passed value is one of listed  Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.

expectedArrayCount: Number or Array - (Optional) a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.

returns.desc: extracted value on success or default value otherwise. Nothing if syntax error occurred.

args.name: argument
args.desc: A usual array of params is expected. If a non-array value is passed, it will be converted to 1 element array

args.name: index
args.desc: index of required item in the input array.

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: (Optional) a default value to return if input is undefined, of the wrong type or of the wrong length (if the item is an array).

args.name: expectedDataTypes: Array of direct  Data Types - (Optional) checks if passed value is one of listed  Data Types. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means every data type is accepted.

expectedArrayCount: Number or Array - (Optional) a single size or array of sizes. If passed input value is an array, checks that it has a certain number of elements. If not, default value is used instead. Empty array [] means any size is accepted.

returns.desc: extracted value on success or default value otherwise. Nothing if syntax error occurred.

getplayerchannel.title: getPlayerChannel
getplayerchannel.description:
Returns channel number for given player, provided that player is speaking, otherwise -1. Having mic on is not enough, player has to make a sound. There are several limitations to this command:
* It does not work on dedicated server, the return is always -1, only client can detect other client talking.
* Prior to Arma 3 v2.01.146856 did not detect when someone talked on direct chat at all anywhere. 
* The client on which command is executed has to able to receive transmission before the transmission channel can be detected. For example if a player is not in the same group as a speaker and the speaker speaks on Group Channel, the player cannot hear the speaker and therefore cannot detect what channel the speaker is on.
In short, this command mimics the speaking icon from the UI. Correspondence between channel and number:

arrayintersect.title: arrayIntersect
arrayintersect.description: Intersects array1 with array2 returning array of unique common elements. Additionally, using the same array for array1 and array2 will simply return array of unique elements. Intersects only 1st dimension of an array.

servername.title: serverName
servername.description: Returns name of the hosting server in MP, "" in SP.

allplayers.title: allPlayers
allplayers.description:
Returns a list of all units controlled by connected clients - human players including dead players, but also Headless Clients.
Use BIS_fnc_listPlayers or see  to only get human players.

currentthrowable.title: currentThrowable
currentthrowable.description: Returns currently selected throwable, which will be launched if the user presses .

roledescription.title: roleDescription
roledescription.description: Returns unit description set in the editor and visible on role selection screen in multiplayer.

currentnamespace.title: currentNamespace
currentnamespace.description:
Returns current global namespace the script runs in. Could be one of the following:
* missionNamespace
* uiNamespace
* parsingNamespace
* profileNamespace
* localNamespace (since Arma 3 v2.00)

isobjecthidden.title: isObjectHidden
isobjecthidden.description: Checks visibility of a given object on the local machine.

returns.desc: true if hidden, false if visible

getobjectviewdistance.title: getObjectViewDistance
getobjectviewdistance.description: Gets the values of rendering distances of objects and shadows.

lbsetselectcolor.title: lbSetSelectColor
lbsetselectcolor.description: Sets the select color of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

lbsetselectcolorright.title: lbSetSelectColorRight
lbsetselectcolorright.description: Sets the select color of the of the secondary text (right aligned) of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

leaderboardrequestrowsfriends.title: leaderboardRequestRowsFriends
leaderboardrequestrowsfriends.description: Requests given leaderboard to download friends rows from the given leaderboard

isturnedout.title: isTurnedOut
isturnedout.description: Returns true if given unit is turned out, otherwise false. The output changes to true after unit finished turning out, however will change to false almost immediately after unit is ordered to turn in.

worldsize.title: worldSize
worldsize.description: Returns the engine calculated size (terrain side length) of the current world (BIS_fnc_mapSize may return the same value, but is just a simple look up in  config).

didjipowner.title: didJIPOwner
didjipowner.description: Checks if the current owner of supplied Object Joined In Progress. Returns false on clients.

didjip.title: didJIP
didjip.description: Checks if the current client Joined In Progress.

splitstring.title: splitString
splitstring.description: Splits the provided ANSI string into an array of tokens according to given delimiters.

args.name: delimiters
args.desc: one or more characters, each used as a separate delimiter; if empty, str is split by each character

joinstring.title: joinString
joinstring.description: Joins array into String with provided separator. Array can be of mixed types, all elements will be converted to String prior to joining, but the fastest operation is on the array of Strings.

args.name: separator
args.desc: separator used to join array elements.

tvsetpicturecolor.title: tvSetPictureColor
tvsetpicturecolor.description: Sets the colour of the picture (set via tvSetPicture) under the specified tree view path.

args.name: idc
args.desc: IDC of the tree view control

objectparent.title: objectParent
objectparent.description:
Returns parent of an object if the object is proxy, otherwise objNull. In case of backpack, the parent is a weaponholder or a cargo space of a vehicle or the unit carrying it. Unit in a vehicle will return the vehicle as parent. Since Arma 3 2.12 it will return rope parent from known rope segment.
Another good use of objectParent is when a static weapon is known and one needs to check if it is assembled or not.  will return objNull if weapon is unpacked, or backpack object if packed.
Image:objectParent.jpg600

getobjecttype.title: getObjectType
getobjecttype.description:
Returns object type as a number:
* 1 - Primary - Normal object placed in Visitor, part of landscape
* 2 - Network - Road placed in Visitor, part of landscape
* 4 - Temporary - Temporary object (like tracks)
* 8 - TypeVehicle - Some entity added by game
* 16 - TypeTempVehicle - Temporary entity
* 32 - LandDecal - Land decal

getmodelinfo.title: getModelInfo
getmodelinfo.description: Returns object's model info. Model path is suitable for use with createSimpleObject command. Since Arma 3 v2.08.148608 the command also returns placing point of the model in model coordinates. Placing point is always in format [0,0,z].

returns.desc: Array in format [modelName, modelPath, hasSkeleton, placingPoint]

sethitindex.title: setHitIndex
sethitindex.description: Sets the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point. All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.

syntaxes.code: vehicle setHitIndex [hitPartIndex, damage, useEffects, killer, instigator]

args.name: vehicle : Object - Vehicle to be damaged
hitPartIndex
args.desc: Hit part index of the Hit Point

args.name:
damage: Number - Level of damage
* 0: no damage
* 1: full damage
useEffects
args.desc: (Optional, default true) False to skip destruction effects

args.name:
killer: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The entity that caused the damage. If the damage leads to the death of the unit, the killer will be used as the object that caused the kill. 
* It can be used to show "killed by player" in debriefing statistics and kill messages in the chat (if death messages are enabled). 
* It will alter the killer's rating as if the killer directly killed the unit. 
* It will be listed as  inline_killer parameter in the Killed event handler.

instigator: Object - (Optional, default objNull) The person that instigated the damage.
* if a tank is a killer, the tank gunner that pulled the trigger is instigator
* it will be listed as  inline_instigator parameter in the Killed event handler.

gethitindex.title: getHitIndex
gethitindex.description:
Return current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.
* 0: no damage
* 1: full damage

args.name: vehicle : Object - vehicle to be queried
hitPartIndex
args.desc: hit part index of the Hit Point

getallhitpointsdamage.title: getAllHitPointsDamage
getallhitpointsdamage.description:
Returns 3 arrays for easy cross reference: 1st - array of hit point names, 2nd - array of hit selection names, 3rd - array of damage values. All values in all arrays are ordered accordingly to hit part index for convenience and for use in setHitIndex and getHitIndex. Levels of damage are:
* 0: no damage
* 1: full damage

returns.desc: [] if entity is null or has no shape, otherwise [hitpointsNamesArray, selectionsNamesArray, damageValuesArray]

lineintersectssurfaces.title: lineIntersectsSurfaces
lineintersectssurfaces.description: Returns a list of intersections with surfaces and ground from begPosASL to endPosASL. Doesn't return intersection with sea surface. Works underwater, unlike lineIntersects. Hardcoded max distance: 5000m.

syntaxes.code: lineIntersectsSurfaces [begPosASL, endPosASL, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2, returnUnique]

args.name: begPosASL: Array format PositionASL - virtual line start
endPosASL: Array format PositionASL - virtual line end
ignoreObj1
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) first object to ignore

args.name: ignoreObj2
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) second object to ignore

args.name: sortMode
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true: closest to furthest, false: furthest to closest

args.name: maxResults
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) max results to return. -1 to return every result

args.name:
LOD1: String - (Optional, default "VIEW") primary LOD to look for intersection. Can be one of:
* "FIRE"
* "VIEW"
* "GEOM"
* "IFIRE" - ("I" stands for Indirect, almost identical to "FIRE")
* "NONE"
*  "PHYSX" - PhysX geometry LOD
*  "ROADWAY" - only works from the top
LOD2
args.desc: (Optional, default "FIRE") secondary LOD to look for intersection. See LOD1 for possible values

args.name: returnUnique
args.desc: (Optional, default true) when false, all intersections in the same object are included, otherwise only the first one

agltoasl.title: AGLToASL
agltoasl.description: Converts position from PositionAGL to PositionASL.

args.name: posAGL: Array format PositionAGL - position to convert

asltoagl.title: ASLToAGL
asltoagl.description: Converts position from PositionASL to PositionAGL

args.name: posASL: Array format PositionASL - position to convert

magazinesallturrets.title: magazinesAllTurrets
magazinesallturrets.description: Returns all magazines (including empty) from all vehicle turrets (including driver turret [-1]) and their ammo counts. Since Arma 3 v2.08.148327 it is possible to exclude person turrets from returned results.

args.name: excludePersonTurrets
args.desc: when true only vehicle's turrets are queried

shownhud.title: shownHUD
shownhud.description: Returns array of Booleans corresponding to the visibility of various HUD elements (see extended showHUD).

setobjectmaterialglobal.title: setObjectMaterialGlobal
setobjectmaterialglobal.description: Set the material of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

getremotesensorsdisabled.title: getRemoteSensorsDisabled
getremotesensorsdisabled.description: Get status of disabled raycasts for remote entities. See disableRemoteSensors for detailed description.

disableremotesensors.title: disableRemoteSensors
disableremotesensors.description:
This command will halt raycasting calculations (on the local machine only) for all groups which don't contain any local entities. Units, that are not in a group with at least one local member, will not check visibility of other units. This will cause, that remote units will not have updated knowsAbout and it will save some CPU time. If a group contains a single local entity then calculations will still be performed for the entire group.

These raycasts are used to determine what other entities an entity can see, and they take a lot of CPU time. This is of course a bit of a trick, because rather than a true optimization, it disables part of the simulation. However, there are certainly types of scenarios where these raycasts are not needed. An example is a fully Player-versus-Player scenario, where the visibility between every combination of player entity is not needed. So why not disable this by default? There are cases where you do require these raycasts, for example in stealth scenarios. Without them, commands like knowsAbout, nearTargets and targetKnowledge will only function for local units! The commands themselves are local, can be used on servers and clients, and the state is reset when the scenario ends. So, carefully consider whether your scenario can benefit from this method.

disablenvgequipment.title: disableNVGEquipment
disablenvgequipment.description: Enables or disables transport NV (Night Vision). To disable TI (Thermal Imaging) use disableTIEquipment.

get3denactionstate.title: get3DENActionState
get3denactionstate.description: Returns state of given Eden Editor action.

get3denmouseover.title: get3DENMouseOver
get3denmouseover.description: Returns the Eden Entity the mouse is hovering over in Eden Editor.

add3deneventhandler.title: add3DENEventHandler
add3deneventhandler.description: Adds an Eden Editor Event Handler.

all3denentities.title: all3DENEntities
all3denentities.description: Returns an array of all currently placed Eden Editor entities.

delete3denentities.title: delete3DENEntities
delete3denentities.description: Delete given entities in Eden Editor.

args.name: entities: Array of Eden Entity or Eden ID

get3denattribute.title: get3DENAttribute
get3denattribute.description:
Returns the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.
An attribute is identified by its  ( when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see Setting Attributes.

args.name: entity: Eden Entity or Eden ID

get3dencamera.title: get3DENCamera
get3dencamera.description: Returns the camera Object used by the Eden Editor.

is3den.title: is3DEN
is3den.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently being used.

returns.desc: true when inside editor environment, false when outside of editor environment

is3denmultiplayer.title: is3DENMultiplayer
is3denmultiplayer.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is in multiplayer mode.

get3dengrid.title: get3DENGrid
get3dengrid.description: Returns the grid increment for the given transformation type.

args.name:
type: String - Name of transformation type. Can be:
*  - Rotation
*  - Translation
*  - Scale

remove3deneventhandler.title: remove3DENEventHandler
remove3deneventhandler.description:
Removes Eden Editor event handler of given type and ID.

See the list of all Eden Editor Event Handlers.

args.name: id
args.desc: ID of event handler, returned by add3DENEventHandler

set3dengrid.title: set3DENGrid
set3dengrid.description: Sets the grid increment for the given transformation type.

args.name:
type: String - Name of transformation type. Can be:
*  - Rotation
*  - Translation
*  - Scale

set3denobjecttype.title: set3DENObjectType
set3denobjecttype.description: Sets the classname of one or more given Eden Editor objects. For Logic objects use set3DENLogicType.

get3denselected.title: get3DENSelected
get3denselected.description:
Returns an array of all selected Eden Editor Entities of the given type.
If a wrong type is provided,  is returned and an error message is shown.

args.name: type
args.desc: Entity type, can be one of:

args.name:
useOffset: Boolean
* If true the camera will move to the 'position, add the offset defined in  and look at the position.  Default camera offset: 
* If false, the camera will be moved to the exact position

isequaltype.title: isEqualType
isequaltype.description: Compares two values' types. A much faster alternative to  inlinetypeName a == typeName b.

isequaltypearray.title: isEqualTypeArray
isequaltypearray.description: Compares types of all elements of one array to types of all elements of another array. Since Arma 3 v2.09.149634 no additional check is needed to make sure the first argument is an Array.

isequaltypeall.title: isEqualTypeAll
isequaltypeall.description: Compares types of all elements of an array to the type of a single value. Since Arma 3 v2.09.149634 no additional check is needed to make sure the first argument is an Array.

isequaltypeparams.title: isEqualTypeParams
isequaltypeparams.description:
Compares types of all elements of input array to types of all elements of template array. Similar to isEqualTypeArray however this command is designed for fast validation of functions params, so there are differences:
* Input can be anything but will be expected to be an Array, otherwise false is returned
* Input array can be longer but not shorter than template array, will return false if shorter
* nil could be used in template type array as a wild card to allow any type match

args.name: input
args.desc: could be value of any type, but only type Array will be validated

addweaponitem.title: addWeaponItem
addweaponitem.description: Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon. The item can be weapon magazine, in which case the amount of ammo and target muzzle could also be specified.

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: name of the weapon to add magazine to

args.name: itemName
args.desc: class name of the item to add (if magazine, muzzle will be autodetected)

args.name: instant
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to skip animation

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: name of the weapon to add magazine to

args.name: itemName
args.desc: class name of the item to add (if magazine, muzzle will be autodetected unless specified)

args.name: ammoCount
args.desc: (Optional) optional amount of ammo in magazine

args.name: muzzleName
args.desc: (Optional) optional target muzzle to add magazine to

args.name: instant
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to skip animation

isequaltypeany.title: isEqualTypeAny
isequaltypeany.description: Compares type of given value to every type in the given array and if match is found, true is returned.

create3denentity.title: create3DENEntity
create3denentity.description:
Create new Eden Entity. Used for creating individual entities; to create a composition (e.g., infantry squad), use create3DENComposition.
This is the only way to add new editable entities to an Eden Editor scenario. Other 'create' commands like createVehicle or createUnit will still work, but the resulting entity will not be editable.

args.name:
class: String - entity class, defined in one of the following classes:
*  - objects and logic entities
*  - triggers
*  - waypoints
*  - markers
isEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to create vehicle without crew

args.name:
group: Group - group in which an AI character or waypoint is created.
* When missing for AI characters, new group is created for them
* When missing for waypoints, an error is logged and nothing is created
* When used on any other mode, group is ignored and entity is created as usual
isEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to create vehicle without crew

get3denentityid.title: get3DENEntityID
get3denentityid.description: Returns unique index of an Eden Entity. This number remains the same even after saving and loading the scenario.

args.name: entity: Eden Entity or Eden ID

returns.desc: Eden ID If ID is not available, -1 is returned

get3denentity.title: get3DENEntity
get3denentity.description: Returns Eden Entity based on its Eden ID.

create3dencomposition.title: create3DENComposition
create3dencomposition.description: Create new Composition. To create individual entities, use create3DENEntity.

args.name: configPath
args.desc: path to  class of a composition

args.name: from: Array of Eden Entities - Entities which are being connected
to: Eden Entity - Entity to which entities will be connected to

returns.desc: true If the connection was made

args.name: from: Array of Eden Entities - Entities which has a connection

returns.desc: true If the connection was removed

get3denconnections.title: get3DENConnections
get3denconnections.description: Returns all connections currently present on an entity.

args.name: entity: Eden Entity or Eden ID

current3denoperation.title: current3DENOperation
current3denoperation.description: Returns the currently performed editing operation in Eden Editor.

removeall3deneventhandlers.title: removeAll3DENEventHandlers
removeall3deneventhandlers.description:
Removes all Eden Editor event handlers of given type. 

See the list of all Eden Editor Event Handlers.

set3denattributes.title: set3DENAttributes
set3denattributes.description:
Set entity attributes.
An attribute is identified by its  ( when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config.
For the list of all attributes with their properties, see Setting Attributes.

args.name: entitiesN: Array of Eden Entity or Eden ID

returns.desc: true if the value was set

collect3denhistory.title: collect3DENHistory
collect3denhistory.description:
Execute a block of code in which all Eden Editor operations will be recorded as one history step. For example creating an entity, setting its attributes and then connections would normally be recorded as three different steps. Calling them all within single collect3DENHistory block will group them together and the user will need to undo only once to revert the changes.


Some useful icons are:
