</spoiler>

args.name: code
args.desc: Code that is executed in Unscheduled Environment

args.name: text
args.desc: text of the entry that is added to the history list

args.name: tooltip
args.desc: (Optional, default "Batch Change" (localized)) - tooltip of the entry

args.name: icon
args.desc: (Optional, default "a3\3den\data\cfg3den\history\multipleoperations_ca.paa") - path to the icon that is displayed left of the text. Must not start with a !

args.name: code
args.desc: Code that is executed in Unscheduled Environment

set3deniconsvisible.title: set3DENIconsVisible
set3deniconsvisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor icons.

args.name: showMap : Boolean - visibility in the map

set3denlinesvisible.title: set3DENLinesVisible
set3denlinesvisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor lines.

args.name: showMap : Boolean - visibility in the map

get3deniconsvisible.title: get3DENIconsVisible
get3deniconsvisible.description: Gets visibility state of Eden Editor icons.

get3denlinesvisible.title: get3DENLinesVisible
get3denlinesvisible.description: Get visibility state of Eden Editor lines.

add3denlayer.title: add3DENLayer
add3denlayer.description: Adds an editing layer in Eden Editor.

args.name: parentLayerID : Number - ID of the parent layer. No layer will be created when the ID does not point to a layer. Use  to create the layer to root.
layerID : Number - layer ID as returned by add3DENLayer command

returns.desc: true if the layer was removed successfully (i.e., correct layer ID was used)

args.name: layerID
args.desc: layer ID as returned by add3DENLayer command

returns.desc: true if the entity was moved succesfully

get3denlayerentities.title: get3DENLayerEntities
get3denlayerentities.description: Return all entities and sub-layer in Eden Entity layer. In order to get all layer entities during a scenario use getMissionLayerEntities.

args.name: layerID
args.desc: layer ID as returned by add3DENLayer command

getmissionconfigvalue.title: getMissionConfigValue
getmissionconfigvalue.description:
Returns value of the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. Since only config properties have values, the attribute should be config property. If it is not found or config class is given, the return is nil. If the attribute defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:
# External Description.ext file
# Eden Editor scenario attribute
So if attribute exists in both places, attribute from description.ext is used. Previously, scenario attributes were extracted from Description.ext using missionConfigFile. That still works, but it ignores attributes set directly in the editor and it should not be used anymore.

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: value used when the attribute is undefined

getmissionconfig.title: getMissionConfig
getmissionconfig.description:
Returns Config entry for the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. The attribute can be config class or config property. If it is defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:
# External Description.ext file
# Eden Editor scenario attribute
So if attribute exists in both places, attribute from description.ext is used. Previously, scenario attributes were extracted from Description.ext using missionConfigFile. That still works, but it ignores attributes set directly in the editor and it should not be used anymore.

set3denmissionattributes.title: set3DENMissionAttributes
set3denmissionattributes.description:
Set scenario attributes.
An attribute is identified by its  ( when it is an engine-driven attribute) value in config.
For the list of all attributes with their properties, see Mission Attributes.

returns.desc: true if the value was set

get3denmissionattribute.title: get3DENMissionAttribute
get3denmissionattribute.description: Return value of scenario attribute. For a list of all available mission attributes see Mission Attributes.

edit3denmissionattributes.title: edit3DENMissionAttributes
edit3denmissionattributes.description: Open a window with scenario attribute in given section.

set3denattribute.title: set3DENAttribute
set3denattribute.description: Sets one of entity attributes. For the list of all attributes with their properties see Setting Attributes.

args.name: entity: Eden Entity or Eden ID

returns.desc: true If the value was set

getreldir.title: getRelDir
getreldir.description:
Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the equivalent of BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo.
Taking the current direction of the object into account.

getrelpos.title: getRelPos
getrelpos.description: Returns position that is given distance and relative direction away from original object.

args.name: direction
args.desc: Direction relative to object's current direction

selectrandom.title: selectRandom
selectrandom.description: Returns a random element from the given array. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_selectRandom

returns.desc: random selected value or Nothing if array is empty

ppeffectenabled.title: ppEffectEnabled
ppeffectenabled.description: Checks whether given post process effect is enabled

setstaminascheme.title: setStaminaScheme
setstaminascheme.description: Sets the scheme used for the Stamina system.

args.name:
scheme: String - can be one of:
* "Normal"
* "FastDrain"
* "Exhausted"
* "Default"

issprintallowed.title: isSprintAllowed
issprintallowed.description: Returns true if player is allowed to sprint

allowsprint.title: allowSprint
allowsprint.description: Force player to run/jog if set to false.

isstaminaenabled.title: isStaminaEnabled
isstaminaenabled.description: Check if stamina depletion is enabled.

getstamina.title: getStamina
getstamina.description: Get current stamina (~ seconds until depletion)

setanimspeedcoef.title: setAnimSpeedCoef
setanimspeedcoef.description:
Sets a coefficient for animation speed (0.5 will play animations half the speed, 2 twice the speed).
Doesn't affect upper body animations (reloading, etc.)

getanimaimprecision.title: getAnimAimPrecision
getanimaimprecision.description: Returns aim precision for current animation

setcustomaimcoef.title: setCustomAimCoef
setcustomaimcoef.description: Set custom aim precision coefficient for weapon sway

enablechannel.title: enableChannel
enablechannel.description:
Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel.

args.name: enable

cursorobject.title: cursorObject
cursorobject.description: Returns the object under cursor. This command is quite different from cursorTarget as it is more precise in determining the boundaries of the pointed at object and can detect a larger variety of objects including map objects and trees.

apply.title: apply
apply.description: Applies the given code to each element of the given data structure and collects the results in an array.

args.name: code
args.desc: code to be executed on each element of the array. The current element value is stored in the magic variable _x.

args.name: code
args.desc: Code to be executed on each key-value pair of the hashmap. The current key is stored in the magic variable _x, the corresponding value is stored in _y.

getclientstatenumber.title: getClientStateNumber
getclientstatenumber.description:
Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:

{! classwikitable
! getClientStateNumber
! getClientState
! Description
!-
! 0 !! "NONE" !! No client (or singleplayer)
!-
! 1 !! "CREATED" !! Client is created
!-
! 2 !! "CONNECTED" !! Client is connected to server, message formats are registered
!-
! 3 !! "LOGGED IN" !! Identity is created
!-
! 4 !! "MISSION SELECTED" !!Mission is selected
!-
! 5 !! "MISSION ASKED" !! Server was asked to send / not send mission
!-
! 6 !! "ROLE ASSIGNED" !! Role was assigned (and confirmed)
!-
! 7 !! "MISSION RECEIVED" !! Mission received
!-
! 8 !! "GAME LOADED" !! Island loaded, vehicles received
!-
! 9 !! "BRIEFING SHOWN" !! Briefing was displayed
!-
! 10 !! "BRIEFING READ" !! Ready to play mission
!-
! 11 !! "GAME FINISHED" !! Game was finished
!-
! 12 !! "DEBRIEFING READ" !! Debriefing read, ready to continue with next mission
!}

pushbackunique.title: pushBackUnique
pushbackunique.description: Adds element to the back of the given array but only if it is unique to the array. The index of the added element is returned upon success, otherwise -1. This command modifies the original array.

isfilepatchingenabled.title: isFilePatchingEnabled
isfilepatchingenabled.description: Returns true if file patching is enabled otherwise false

inpolygon.title: inPolygon
inpolygon.description: Checks whether position is inside given polygon

args.name: polygon
args.desc: array of Position3D positions in format: [position1, position2...., positionN]

getmouseposition.title: getMousePosition
getmouseposition.description: Returns mouse position in UI coordinates.

returns.desc: position in format [x, y], where x and y are UI coordinates

roadat.title: roadAt
roadat.description: Returns a road segment containing given position, objNull otherwise. Same as isOnRoad only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

args.name: position: Object or Array - Array in format PositionAGL (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v2.00) Position2D, in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface

lognetworkterminate.title: logNetworkTerminate
lognetworkterminate.description: Terminates a network log file started with logNetwork with the given handle

args.name: handle:  Number - handle to terminate (created with logNetwork)

lognetwork.title: logNetwork
lognetwork.description: Registers new log file recording a network traffic and returns handle of the log. The log file is saved inside the  root folder.

clientowner.title: clientOwner
clientowner.description: Returns the  machine network ID of the client executing the command.

missionversion.title: missionVersion
missionversion.description:
Returns the version of the current mission.
* Mission from the 2D Editor: 12
* Mission from the Eden Editor: 15 and higher (for example current version for Eden Editor mission in Arma 3 v1.57 is 51)

exportjipmessages.title: exportJIPMessages
exportjipmessages.description: Export list of JIP to a file. Special: BattlEye's RCON variant of this command is #exportJIPqueue (see also Multiplayer_Server_Commands)

args.name: fileName
args.desc: File where to store the list

getplayerscores.title: getPlayerScores
getplayerscores.description:
* In MP: Returns the unit's table of scores (infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score).
* In SP: Empty array []

returns.desc: the score of the given player in format [infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score]

lockidentity.title: lockIdentity
lockidentity.description: Locks the identity of a person. This will disable default identity.

displayparent.title: displayParent
displayparent.description: Returns parent display of the given display.

allcutlayers.title: allCutLayers

returns.desc: Array of Strings: The index of the layer name in the array corresponds to the layer number the cut effect will be displayed on. If no layers were defined, the return is  inline[""], because layer 0 is reserved for usage in cut commands without layer param or when the provided layer name is empty .

drawpolygon.title: drawPolygon
drawpolygon.description: Draws given polygon on the given map control with given color. The polygon must consist of at least 3 points. Unlike with other  commands and due to complexity, this command does not support filling of the polygon with color. Use drawTriangle command to construct and fill polygon shape as a workaround.

sideempty.title: sideEmpty
sideempty.description: Returns empty side, for example static buildings in Eden Editor.

sideambientlife.title: sideAmbientLife
sideambientlife.description: Returns side of ambient life, for example ambient life placed in Eden Editor.

getcameraviewdirection.title: getCameraViewDirection
getcameraviewdirection.description: Returns the direction unit is looking in render time scope. While for AI the origin for the view direction vector can be taken from , for human player the origin should be taken from player camera position

checkvisibility.title: checkVisibility
checkvisibility.description:
Checks if one position is visible from another position and how much.
The results can be affected by getTerrainGrid value, especially if position is near the ground.
Particle effects such as smoke can also affect the results.

args.name: LOD
args.desc: level of details to use. Possible values are: , , , , and

args.name: ignore2
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) second object to exclude from calculations

returns.desc: how much end position is visible to start position in range 0..1, where 1 is fully visible.

ctrlangle.title: ctrlAngle
ctrlangle.description:
Gets rotation info of a control set as . Supported control types:
* CT_STATIC
* CT_ACTIVETEXT (Since Arma 3 v2.09.149642)

moonphase.title: moonPhase
moonphase.description: Returns the phase of the in-game Moon on the given date in range 0...1, where 0 - new Moon, 1 - full Moon. According to this command the fullest Moon in Arma 3 at midnight is on  Use Moon Phase Utility to find out date for a mission with desired moon.

animatesource.title: animateSource
animatesource.description: Process an animation of the object. If animate uses class name from CfgModels Animations, animateSource uses name defined by the source property. AnimationSources can animate multiple animate Animations. AnimationSource is defined in CfgVehicles' AnimationSources (see Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles).

args.name:
speed: Boolean or Number - (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - when set to true, animation is instant
*  Number > 0 is treated as config speed value multiplier. Since  values <= 0 will instantly reset animation to initPhase.

animationsourcephase.title: animationSourcePhase
animationsourcephase.description: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationPhase or doorPhase but designed to complement animateSource. This command could be used to obtain relative turret direction and gun elevation on a vehicle (see ).

animationnames.title: animationNames
animationnames.description: Returns Array of Strings where elements are the names of model animations, which should theoretically be available for use with animate command. However in practice this depends on whether animation is also made available for use in scripts via config.

cansuspend.title: canSuspend
cansuspend.description: Returns true if sleep, uiSleep or waitUntil commands can be used in current scope. Usually when suspension is not allowed but used, for example when code is executed in unscheduled environment, the script engine would ignore any suspension command and throw error: "Suspending not allowed in this context". Using canSuspend command allows to detect the correct environment for the code.

difficultyoption.title: difficultyOption
difficultyoption.description:
Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user.
Difficulty flag names can be found in the  config class or in ArmA profile file under class  (xxx being Recruit, Regular or Veteran).
This command replaces difficultyEnabled as many options have multiple values and former command only provided Boolean return.

setsimpletaskcustomdata.title: setSimpleTaskCustomData
setsimpletaskcustomdata.description: Set custom data for the task. Tooltip will be drawn in task list on the right side. Description will be drawn in task description panel on the bottom.

args.name: task
args.desc: task the custom data are being added to

args.name: tooltip
args.desc: text displayed next to the icon; max. 3 charactersc

args.name: description
args.desc: text displayed on the task description panel; html format

taskalwaysvisible.title: taskAlwaysVisible
taskalwaysvisible.description: Returns true if the task is flagged to be always visible or false if not.

tasktype.title: taskType
tasktype.description: Returns the type of the given task. A new task returns "Default" for the type.

setsimpletasktype.title: setSimpleTaskType
setsimpletasktype.description: Attach type to the simple task. See Default Task Types.

taskcustomdata.title: taskCustomData
taskcustomdata.description: Returns custom data attached to the local task or an empty array if there are no custom data attached.

getterraingrid.title: getTerrainGrid
getterraingrid.description: A getter for setTerrainGrid, returns the current terrain grid.

userinputdisabled.title: userInputDisabled
userinputdisabled.description: Returns true if user input is disabled

createsimpleobject.title: createSimpleObject
createsimpleobject.description:
Create object with given shape defined as path to .p3d model. Supported LODs include Geometry, Fire Geometry, Roadway, View Geometry and ShadowVolume. Supported features include collision, texturing, animation, penetration, AI spotting occlusion, and surface specific sounds (like footsteps). Unsupported features include PhysX, damage, AI pathfinding (causes walking through walls), and built-in lights.

Given the simulation limitations, global decorative objects can be created with very little network traffic. Objects that could be exclusively created with this command are: trees, bushes, rocks, bridges, roads, vehicle wrecks, custom models in mission, and other objects without a class in config. The height of the placement position might need to be adjusted experimentally.


See Arma 3: Simple Objects to learn more about simple objects.

args.name: shapeName
args.desc: path to the 3d model (can be obtained with getModelInfo command)

args.name: positionWorld: Array format PositionASL - placement position by the model centre's position (see getPosWorld)
local
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to create a local instance only

args.name: positionASL: Array format PositionASL - placement position
local
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to create a local instance only

hideselection.title: hideSelection
hideselection.description: Hides or shows the  simple object's provided selection.

args.name: hidden
args.desc: true to hide, false to show

selectionnames.title: selectionNames
selectionnames.description: Returns the list of model selections. When using default syntax, the named selections are returned from the first LOD only (LOD index 0). Alternative syntax allows to select LOD by name or by LOD resolution.

args.name:
LOD: String - name or Number - resolution. String could be one of: 
* "Memory"
* "Geometry"
* "FireGeometry"
* "LandContact"
* "HitPoints" 
* "ViewGeometry" (since  v2.06)
When Number is used, command searches for a LOD with the similar resolution

setunittrait.title: setUnitTrait
setunittrait.description:
Enables or disables a trait or alters a trait of the given unit. Custom trait can only be a bool.
Default traits are:
* Number audibleCoef - A lower value means the unit is harder to hear
* Number camouflageCoef - A lower value means the unit is harder to spot
* Number loadCoef - Equipment weight multiplier affecting fatigue and stamina
* Boolean engineer - Ability to partially repair vehicles with toolkit, equivalent to  in CfgVehicles
* Boolean explosiveSpecialist - Ability to defuse mines with toolkit, equivalent to  in CfgVehicles
* Boolean medic - Ability to treat self and others with medikit, equivalent to  in CfgVehicles
* Boolean UAVHacker - Ability to hack drones, equivalent to  in CfgVehicles

args.name: unit
args.desc: The unit whose trait should be set

args.name: value: Boolean or Number - Value (see above)
isCustom (optional): Boolean - Must be set to true in case of custom

getunittrait.title: getUnitTrait
getunittrait.description: Gets the current value of a trait of the given unit.

pixelgrid.title: pixelGrid
pixelgrid.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution, UI size and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids.

returns.desc: Grid size, see Arma 3: Pixel Grid System

pixelh.title: pixelH
pixelh.description: Returns the height of one pixel for current resolution.

pixelw.title: pixelW
pixelw.description: Returns width of one pixel for current resolution.

getunitloadout.title: getUnitLoadout
getunitloadout.description: Returns a Unit Loadout Array with all assigned items, weapons, containers and their stored items. When String for class name is supplied, the command will search  for the given class in order to extract the loadout from config. If Config is given, it will search given config (including  mission config) for the loadout information.

args.name: fullMagazines
args.desc: true to top up used magazines

setunitloadout.title: setUnitLoadout

args.name: fullMagazines
args.desc: Partially emptied magazines will be refilled when the loadout is applied

screenshot.title: screenshot
screenshot.description:
Captures a screenshot and stores it to given filename. PNG is the only available format and the file must have .png extension.
The file is saved into Screenshots folder in the Profile directory. The folder is by default limited to 250 MB to prevent abuse.
To increase the limit, add the following line at the end of the profile file:
 langcppmaxScreenShotFolderSizeMB = 2000; // 2 GB

args.name:
filename: String - desired path and name relative to  (see Profile).
If empty string "" used, the filename will be autogenerated in format:

ctrlparentcontrolsgroup.title: ctrlParentControlsGroup
ctrlparentcontrolsgroup.description: Returns the parent control of a given child control. If the control is not part of a CT_CONTROLS_GROUP control then controlNull is returned. To return parent Display of the control use ctrlParent.

tvsetpicturecolorselected.title: tvSetPictureColorSelected
tvsetpicturecolorselected.description: Sets the color of the left picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

tvsetpicturerightcolorselected.title: tvSetPictureRightColorSelected
tvsetpicturerightcolorselected.description: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is selected

tvsetpicturerightcolordisabled.title: tvSetPictureRightColorDisabled
tvsetpicturerightcolordisabled.description: Sets the color of the right picture of a tree item defined by path when item is disabled

tvsetpicturecolordisabled.title: tvSetPictureColorDisabled
tvsetpicturecolordisabled.description: Sets the color of left picture of a tree item defined by path when that item is disabled.

tvsetpicturerightcolor.title: tvSetPictureRightColor
tvsetpicturerightcolor.description: Sets color of the right picture on the tree view item defined by path

commandsuppressivefire.title: commandSuppressiveFire
commandsuppressivefire.description:
Orders the given unit or a group of units to suppress the given position or target (with radio messages, see doSuppressiveFire if you don't want messages). 
* When an Array of units is passed as param, only units from the same Group as the first unit in array are considered. 
* The unit (units) starts firing at the given target or position random amount of shots (exact formula unknown, but seems to depend on amount of ammo unit has) after which it stops. 
* currentCommand shows  and there is no way of stopping unit before it completes random amount of rounds. 
* If position is passed as target param, it stays fixed. 
* If object is passed as target param, it depends on what kind of object. If it is considered a proper target by the unit, it is tracked by the unit dynamically. If it is not, the position gets obtained via getPosWorld, which could be different from PositionASL of the object, and it is fixed even if the target is able to change position later.

args.name: unit: Object or Array - a single unit or array of units
target: Object or Array - actual target or position of the target in format PositionASL

dosuppressivefire.title: doSuppressiveFire
dosuppressivefire.description:
Orders the given unit or a group of units to suppress the given position or target (without radio messages, see commandSuppressiveFire is you need messages). 
* When an Array of units is passed as param, only units from the same Group as the first unit in array are considered. 
* The unit (units) starts firing at the given target or position random amount of shots (exact formula unknown, but seems to depend on amount of ammo unit has) after which it stops. 
* currentCommand shows  and there is no way of stopping unit before it completes random amount of rounds. 
* If position is passed as target param, it stays fixed. 
* If object is passed as target param, it depends on what kind of object. If it is considered a proper target by the unit, it is tracked by the unit dynamically. If it is not, the position gets obtained via getPosWorld, which could be different from PositionASL of the object, and it is fixed even if the target is able to change position later.

args.name: unit: Object or Array - A single unit or array of units
target: Object or Array - Actual target or position of the target in format PositionASL

returns.desc: vehicles loaded in storingVehicle, in order of their loading

isvehiclecargo.title: isVehicleCargo

vehiclecargoenabled.description: Check if the vehicle has enabled transporting other vehicles or not.

useaisteeringcomponent.title: useAISteeringComponent

configsourceaddonlist.title: configSourceAddonList

ctrlsetangle.title: ctrlSetAngle
ctrlsetangle.description:
Sets the rotation of a control set as . Rotation will be done within the control boundaries, so if the X and Y are given off center, the picture may get clipped by the control boundaries. Only requires ctrlCommit when fourth parameter is set to false. Procedural textures filled controls do not rotate. Supported control types:
* CT_STATIC
* CT_ACTIVETEXT (Since Arma 3 v2.09.149642)

args.name: centerX
args.desc: Rotation center X in range 0 to 1. Control center is 0.5

args.name: centerY
args.desc: Rotation center Y in range 0 to 1. Control center is 0.5

args.name: now
args.desc: (Optional, default true) If false, control will wait for ctrlCommit input for result to apply

ctrlsetfontheightsecondary.title: ctrlSetFontHeightSecondary
ctrlsetfontheightsecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

ctrlsetfontsecondary.title: ctrlSetFontSecondary
ctrlsetfontsecondary.description: Sets the font size of the secondary text of given control.

enableaimprecision.title: enableAimPrecision
enableaimprecision.description: Set whether animation's aim precision affects weapon sway.

enableaudiofeature.title: enableAudioFeature
enableaudiofeature.description: Enable/disable an audio feature, features are: "lowpass", "building_interior". Since v2.14 it is possible to enable "building_interior" on an object placed in a building. When used on object in multiplayer, remoteExec the command globally with JIP queue enabled, for example [_obj, ["building_interior", true]] remoteExec ["enableAudioFeature", 0, _obj]; Since Arma 2.14 if 'enable' argument is omitted, the command returns the current state of the feature.

args.name: enable (Optional): Boolean - true enable, false, disabled
enable (Optional): Boolean - true enable, false, disabled

state

Returns whether or not the given transport object is a drone (UAV, UGV), regardless of if it has a crew or if it is empty,
corresponding to the  langcpp inlineisUAV transport parameter.
 The command can be used to check if the provided unit is a UAV unit or if that unit is remote-controlling a UAV unit.

menusetcheck.title: menuSetCheck
menusetcheck.description:
Sets item on given path to be checked or not. By default menu strip entries are not checkable.
Once this command was executed, an entry can become checked and unchecked.
If an entry is checked is indicated by a tick to the left of the entry's text.
Setting an entry to be checkable will overwrite set picture with menuSetPicture.

menusetdata.title: menuSetData
menusetdata.description: Sets data into menu entry on given path.

menusetaction.title: menuSetAction
menusetaction.description: Sets new action into menu entry on given path.

args.name: action
args.desc: Expression that should be executed when entry is clicked

menuhover.title: menuHover

menuurl.title: menuURL

Returns value of the given stat.
A list of possible StatNames can be found here: Arma 3: Stat Names

Create a MP campaign display. The class name must be a mission collection declared in the configs; for example,  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgMissions" >> "MPMissions" >> "Apex"
If the class does not exist or is not a mission collection, the display will be created empty.

visiblescoretable.title: visibleScoretable
visiblescoretable.description: Checks whether the score table is visible.

actionids.title: actionIDs
actionids.description: Returns Array of Numbers, where numbers are IDs of all user actions added to given entity with addAction command.

actionparams.title: actionParams
actionparams.description: Returns Array with params for given user action id (similar to addAction param array).

args.name: id
args.desc: id of existing user action (returned by addAction or actionIDs)

haspilotcamera.title: hasPilotCamera
haspilotcamera.description: Returns true if the object airplane or helicopter has a pilotCamera.

getpilotcameraposition.title: getPilotCameraPosition
getpilotcameraposition.description: Returns model space coordinates of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera.

returns.desc: [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre, format PositionRelative. Returns [0,0,0] if object has no pilotCamera.

getpilotcameradirection.title: getPilotCameraDirection
getpilotcameradirection.description: Returns model space vector of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

returns.desc: [x,y,z] - format Vector3D relative to the model centre (In a similar fashion to PositionRelative). Returns [0,0,0] if object has no pilotCamera.

getpilotcamerarotation.title: getPilotCameraRotation
getpilotcamerarotation.description: Returns rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

returns.desc: [x,y] - format [yaw (turn), pitch (elevation)]. Positive values are left yaw and down pitch from the center. Returns [0,0] when camera is centered but also if object has no pilotCamera.

getpilotcameratarget.title: getPilotCameraTarget
getpilotcameratarget.description: Returns the target of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera tracking.

setpilotcameradirection.title: setPilotCameraDirection
setpilotcameradirection.description: Sets the direction of object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera (vector in model space).

args.name: Vector3D
args.desc: [x,y,z] - format Vector3D relative to the model centre (In a similar fashion to PositionRelative)

setpilotcamerarotation.title: setPilotCameraRotation
setpilotcamerarotation.description: Sets rotation (relative to the centered camera position) of the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera .

args.name: rotation
args.desc: [x,y] - format [yaw (turn), pitch (elevation)]. Values are in radians, positive values are left yaw and down pitch from the center.

setpilotcameratarget.title: setPilotCameraTarget
setpilotcameratarget.description:
Sets an area or target to be tracked by the object airplane or helicopter pilotCamera. 
To track an object the vehicle has to have appropriate sensors (scanners) that can detect the given target type.
Using objNull will unlock the camera

args.name: target: Object or Array - format PositionASL

setshotparents.title: setShotParents
setshotparents.description: Sets vehicle and instigator pair for the given projectile.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: Vehicle shooting projectile (appears as the 'killer' in "Killed" EH)

args.name: instigator
args.desc: Person pulling the trigger (appears as the 'instigator' in "Killed" EH)

isremoteexecuted.title: isRemoteExecuted
isremoteexecuted.description: Returns true if the code context is being remote executed by remoteExec or remoteExecCall. In SP always returns false. See also isRemoteExecutedJIP

tofixed.title: toFixed
tofixed.description:
Converts a number into a string, keeping the specified number of decimals. If the desired number of decimals is higher than the actual number, nulls are added to create the desired decimal length. This command is almost identical in behaviour to JavaScript https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/toFixedtoFixed()
The alternative syntax acts as keyword and switches engine's Number to String global conversion into desired format, from the moment it is applied until the end of script.
To reset output back to default at any time, use  - see .

args.name: decimals
args.desc: number of decimals to display (range 0-20). -1 to reset to default number of decimals

getmissionlayerentities.title: getMissionLayerEntities
getmissionlayerentities.description:
Returns all entities within the specific Eden Editor layer and its sub-layers.
To be used when the scenario is running, not in the editor workspace.
Useful to disable/enable whole parts of the scenario if layers are used during mission design.

args.name:
layerName: can be one of:
* String - case-insensitive; layer name in the editor. If multiple layers with the same name are present in the scenario, the first found one is used
* Number - layer ID in the editor

selectmin.title: selectMin
selectmin.description: Returns the array element with minimum numerical value. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_lowestNum and BIS_fnc_findExtreme. Therefore it is expected that supplied array consists of Numbers only.  Booleans however are also supported and will be evaluated as Numbers: true - 1, false - 0. nil value treated as 0.

selectmax.title: selectMax
selectmax.description: Returns the array element with maximum numerical value. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_greatestNum and BIS_fnc_findExtreme. Therefore it is expected that supplied array consists of Numbers only. Booleans however are also supported and will be evaluated as Numbers: true - 1, false - 0.  nil value treated as 0.

weaponaccessoriescargo.title: weaponAccessoriesCargo
weaponaccessoriescargo.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the given weapon in given cargo container.

isremoteexecutedjip.title: isRemoteExecutedJIP
isremoteexecutedjip.description:
Returns true if the code context is being remote executed from the JIP queue by remoteExec or remoteExecCall (when JIP param was set). It is a subset of isRemoteExecuted:
* Normal remote execution: 
** isRemoteExecuted - true
** isRemoteExecutedJIP - false
* Remote execution from JIP queue:
** isRemoteExecuted - true
** isRemoteExecutedJIP - true
In SP always returns false.

gearidcammocount.title: gearIDCAmmoCount
gearidcammocount.description: Returns ammo count of assigned magazine.

getcontainermaxload.title: getContainerMaxLoad
getcontainermaxload.description: Returns max load value of given uniform, vest or backpack container. For other types of containers, use maxLoad command

setvelocitymodelspace.title: setVelocityModelSpace
setvelocitymodelspace.description: Sets the velocity (speed vector) of the given vehicle relative to its model.

args.name: velocity: Array format Vector3D - relative velocity vector

setflaganimationphase.title: setFlagAnimationPhase
setflaganimationphase.description: Sets flag position on the flag pole. To animate flag use BIS_fnc_animateFlag.

args.name: phase
args.desc: Flag position on the flag pole according to the given animation phase, where 0 is the bottom of the flag pole, 1 is the top of the flag pole.

enableweapondisassembly.title: enableWeaponDisassembly
enableweapondisassembly.description: Enables or disables disassembly of static weapons. Could be applied to local player, to another unit or to static weapon directly.

args.name: enable
args.desc: false to prevent local player from being able to disassemble static weapons

args.name: enable: Boolean  - false to prevent a unit from being able to disassemble static weapons, or to prevent a static weapon from being disassembled by anyone

terrainintersectatasl.title: terrainIntersectAtASL
terrainintersectatasl.description: Checks for intersection of terrain between two ASL positions. Same as terrainIntersectASL but returns the intersection ASL position.

args.name: start: Array format PositionASL - start position
end: Array format PositionASL - end position

issimpleobject.title: isSimpleObject
issimpleobject.description: Returns true if given object is simple object

flaganimationphase.title: flagAnimationPhase
flaganimationphase.description: Returns flag position on the flag pole.

returns.desc: Flag position in range from 0 to 1, where 0 is bottom of the flag pole, 1 is the top of the flag pole

allsimpleobjects.title: allSimpleObjects
allsimpleobjects.description: Returns array of all simple objects that belong to the listed class names. If the array of types is empty [], all simple objects are returned including those without class name.

args.name: classes: Array of Strings - classnames array. Use  to return all simple objects

for.title: for
for.description: This operator creates a For Type which is used in the for-constructs.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: declares the index variable name like "_myVar". from and to are required, step is optional.

args.name: condition
args.desc: called code returns false, leave the for-loop

args.name: codeToExecute
args.desc: code to be run on each loop

deletegroupwhenempty.title: deleteGroupWhenEmpty
deletegroupwhenempty.description:
Marks given group for auto-deletion when group is empty.
true will mark the group for auto-deletion once empty, false will simply unmark the group that was marked previously.

args.desc: true to mark for auto-deletion on empty group, false to not use this auto-deletion system

isgroupdeletedwhenempty.title: isGroupDeletedWhenEmpty
isgroupdeletedwhenempty.description: Checks if the given group marked for auto-deletion when empty. See deleteGroupWhenEmpty.

returns.desc: true the group is marked for auto-deletion when empty

tvcollapseall.title: tvCollapseAll
tvcollapseall.description: Collapses all tree items for the given Tree View.

tvexpandall.title: tvExpandAll
tvexpandall.description: Expands all tree items for the given Tree View.

tvsetcolor.title: tvSetColor
tvsetcolor.description: Sets text color on given Tree View Item

args.name: path
