args.name: path
args.desc: Tree View Path of the item

parsesimplearray.title: parseSimpleArray
parsesimplearray.description:
Converts given, formatted as simple array, String into a valid Array. Simple array is array consisting of Numbers, Strings, Booleans and Arrays of all of the above.
This command is almost 4× faster than similar uncached call compile method. And because call compile is not required, it is also more secure and primarily intended for use with callExtension to parse the String output into Array.

Since  v1.96 the command will tolerate extra spaces and supports single quotes. The only recognised keywords (case insensitive) are:
*  - translates into true
*  - translates into false
*  - translates into nil
*  - translates into nil
*  - translates into nil
*  - translates into nil

lnbsortbyvalue.title: lnbSortByValue
lnbsortbyvalue.description: Sorts given multicolumn listbox by lnbValue in given column in ascending or descending order.

args.name: reversed
args.desc: (Optional, default false) false: descending / true: ascending

args.name: reversed
args.desc: (Optional, default false) false: descending / true: ascending

setvehicleradar.title: setVehicleRadar
setvehicleradar.description: Sets the AI rule of Radar usage (Emission Control). Automatic means Radar switched on only when in Combat. The command doesn't affect player-controlled vehicles.

args.name:
rule: Number - Can be one of the following:
* 0 - automatic
* 1 - forced on
* 2 - forced off

vehiclereportownposition.title: vehicleReportOwnPosition
vehiclereportownposition.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares its own position via datalink with the Side center.

vehiclereceiveremotetargets.title: vehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
vehiclereceiveremotetargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle can acquire targets via datalink from the Side center.

vehiclereportremotetargets.title: vehicleReportRemoteTargets
vehiclereportremotetargets.description: Gets whether the vehicle shares acquired targets via datalink with the Side center.

setvehiclereportownposition.title: setVehicleReportOwnPosition
setvehiclereportownposition.description: Sets that the vehicle will share its own position via datalink to the Side center.

setvehiclereceiveremotetargets.title: setVehicleReceiveRemoteTargets
setvehiclereceiveremotetargets.description: Sets that the vehicle will be able to receive targets acquired by someone else via datalink from the Side center.

setvehiclereportremotetargets.title: setVehicleReportRemoteTargets
setvehiclereportremotetargets.description: Sets that the vehicle will share targets that were acquired by its own sensors via datalink to the Side center.

targets.title: targets
targets.description: Retrieves list of given unit targets matching specified filter. If the filter is not specified, all targets are returned.

syntaxes.code: unitOrGroup targets [enemyOnly, maxDistance, sides, maxAge, alternateCenter]

args.name: unitOrGroup: Object or  Group - unit or group which target knowledge is retrieved
enemyOnly
args.desc: (Optional) true to include only enemy targets, false to include all targets

args.name: maxDistance
args.desc: (Optional) max. distance based on target's expected position (distance is measured in 2D); use 0 to ignore the maxDistance filter

args.name: sides
args.desc: (Optional) array of accepted sides; use [] to ignore the side filter

args.name: maxAge
args.desc: (Optional) max. target age, targets that are known to unit for longer then maxAge are ignored; use 0 to ignore the maxAge filter

args.name: alternateCenter
args.desc: (Optional) alternate (2D or 3D) position used for distance check (distance is measured in 2D); if not specified unit position is being used

enabledynamicsimulationsystem.title: enableDynamicSimulationSystem
enabledynamicsimulationsystem.description: Enables or disables the whole Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation system

enabledynamicsimulation.title: enableDynamicSimulation
enabledynamicsimulation.description: Enables or disables Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation for given non AI object.

setdynamicsimulationdistance.title: setDynamicSimulationDistance
setdynamicsimulationdistance.description: Sets activation distance of Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation for given category.

args.name:
category: String - Can be:
*  - Infantry units. Set to a reasonable distance, player should not see disabled infantry units. Default: 500m
*  - Vehicles with crew. Set to a reasonable distance, player should not see disabled vehicles. Default: 350m
*  - All vehicles without crew. Separated from Props as Empty Vehicles have often more complex damage states and selective destruction. Their activation distance should be larger than the one used for Props. Default: 250m
*  - Static objects. Anything from a small tin can to a building. Default: 50m

category: String - Can be:
*  - Infantry units and groups
*  - Vehicles with crew
*  - All vehicles without crew
*  - Static objects

setdynamicsimulationdistancecoef.title: setDynamicSimulationDistanceCoef
setdynamicsimulationdistancecoef.description: Sets activation distance multiplier of Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation for the given class

args.name:
class: String - Multiplier class, currently only:
*  - Multiplies the entity activation distance by set value if the entity is moving. Default: 2

triggerdynamicsimulation.title: triggerDynamicSimulation
triggerdynamicsimulation.description: Controls the ability of given unit to activate entities with disabled Arma 3: Dynamic Simulation. If false dynamically disabled entities will not be activated by this unit's presence. This command has the same effect as the Eden Editor attribute Wake-Up Dynamic Simulation.

reportremotetarget.title: reportRemoteTarget
reportremotetarget.description: Shares the target vehicle via datalink to the Side center for a given time.

getcursorobjectparams.title: getCursorObjectParams
getcursorobjectparams.description: Returns object and named selections under cursor and distance to object's surface (to the point cursor points at). If object surface is further away than 50 meters, selections are always an empty array and distance is 1e10 (10^10).

setdriveonpath.title: setDriveOnPath
setdriveonpath.description:
Sets the path to follow for AI driver. Note that unitReady will return true even if AI is still driving through the points.
Using any other move command (e.g  inline_vehicle move getPosATL _vehicle) or doStop will stop the effect of this command.

args.name: points
args.desc: list of Positions to format [x,y,z] OR to format [x,y,z, speed], speed being in m/s.

forceflagtexture.title: forceFlagTexture
forceflagtexture.description:
Forces a flag texture onto a flag carrier (unit, vehicle or flag pole).
No flag holder is required. If  is used as texture, the texture is removed.
This will override regularly owned flags.
This type of flag texture cannot be retrieved using flagTexture, but getForcedFlagTexture.

getforcedflagtexture.title: getForcedFlagTexture
getforcedflagtexture.description: A getter for forceFlagTexture. Forced texture is different from your normal flag texture, which can be retrieved with flagTexture

set3denlogictype.title: set3DENLogicType
set3denlogictype.description: Sets the new type of Logic object(s). For other objects use set3DENObjectType.

confirmsensortarget.title: confirmSensorTarget
confirmsensortarget.description: Sets for which Side the entity becomes a "confirmed hostile" target - a target that becomes highlighted red on the sensors display.

admin.title: admin
admin.description: This is dedicated server command, which queries the admin state of any client on the network by their client (owner) id.

forgettarget.title: forgetTarget
forgettarget.description: Resets the info a group has about a target, forcing knowsAbout value to 0.

args.name: group: Group or Object - group itself or unit in a group

remoteexecutedowner.title: remoteExecutedOwner
remoteexecutedowner.description: Returns the  machine network ID of the client that initiated Remote Execution.

returns.desc: returns zero in the specific cases listed in the

animatebay.title: animateBay
animatebay.description: Forces animation of bay to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released when bay state == 1.

args.name: bay
args.desc: bay index (index starts from 1 and different from pylon index)

args.name: instant: Boolean  (Optional, default false) - Animate immediately

animatepylon.title: animatePylon
animatepylon.description: Force animation of pylon to given state, -1 for reset to engine handling, can cause weapon inoperative, because weapon is released  when pylon state == 1.

args.name: pylon: Number or  String - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see )

ammoonpylon.title: ammoOnPylon
ammoonpylon.description: Returns ammo count on given pylon (or false on failure).

args.name: pylon: String or Number - pylon's name or index

setammoonpylon.title: setAmmoOnPylon
setammoonpylon.description: Set count of ammo in magazine on pylon (supports pylon name since Arma 3 v1.94)

args.name: pylon: Number or String - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see getCompatiblePylonMagazines Example 4)

getpylonmagazines.title: getPylonMagazines
getpylonmagazines.description: Return array of magazines on pylons.

getcustomaimcoef.title: getCustomAimCoef
getcustomaimcoef.description: Returns aimPrecision from animation state with custom value that will directly affects weapon sway size and speed.

modeltoworldworld.title: modelToWorldWorld
modeltoworldworld.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in PositionASL format from the object's centre position.

modeltoworldvisualworld.title: modelToWorldVisualWorld
modeltoworldvisualworld.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in render time scope. For the PositionAGL version see modelToWorldVisual.

airplanethrottle.title: airplaneThrottle
airplanethrottle.description: Returns throttle position. Works only on player's vehicle.

setairplanethrottle.title: setAirplaneThrottle
setairplanethrottle.description: Sets a wanted throttle position - works only on player's vehicle.

ctaddheader.title: ctAddHeader
ctaddheader.description:
Adds a header line of controls according to the HeaderTemplate class. It returns an array containing header index and array of created controls in  format:
.

Note that rows and headers are indexed separately.

ctclear.title: ctClear
ctclear.description: Removes all the lines from the RscControlsTable. Returns Nothing.

ctcursel.title: ctCurSel
ctcursel.description: Returns index of the selected row. Will take only rows, but not headers into account.

ctdata.title: ctData
ctdata.description: Returns metadata associated with a particular row of a CT_CONTROLS_TABLE control.

ctfindrowheader.title: ctFindRowHeader
ctfindrowheader.description: Gets index of the closest header above this row.

ctheadercontrols.title: ctHeaderControls
ctheadercontrols.description: Returns array of controls on the header with the given index.

ctheadercount.title: ctHeaderCount
ctheadercount.description: Returns number of headers (rows not included) in the RscControlsTable.

ctremoveheaders.title: ctRemoveHeaders
ctremoveheaders.description: Takes array of header indices as a parameter and removes headers with those indices. Indices of remaining headers will be recomputed.

ctremoverows.title: ctRemoveRows
ctremoverows.description: Takes array of row indices as a parameter and removes rows with those indices. Indices of remaining rows will be recomputed.

ctrowcontrols.title: ctRowControls
ctrowcontrols.description: Returns array of controls on the row with the given index.

ctrowcount.title: ctRowCount
ctrowcount.description: Returns number of rows (headers not included) in the RscControlsTable.

ctsetcursel.title: ctSetCurSel
ctsetcursel.description: Selects the line with the given index. Will take only rows, but not headers into account. -1 deselects all. Returns Nothing.

ctsetdata.title: ctSetData
ctsetdata.description: Associates metadata (string) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

ctsetheadertemplate.title: ctSetHeaderTemplate
ctsetheadertemplate.description: Takes config path to the new header template. Clears the whole RscControlsTable and sets the new header template.

ctsetrowtemplate.title: ctSetRowTemplate
ctsetrowtemplate.description: Takes config path to the new row template. Clears the whole RscControlsTable and sets the new row template (Deleting all rows and headers is easier to implement than replacing the rows and filling them with new data. IDCs could overflow etc.).

ctsetvalue.title: ctSetValue
ctsetvalue.description: Associates metadata (number) with the row determined by the index. Returns Nothing.

ctvalue.title: ctValue
ctvalue.description: Returns metadata (number) associated with a particular row of RscControlsTable.

removeweaponattachmentcargo.title: removeWeaponAttachmentCargo
removeweaponattachmentcargo.description: Remove attachment linked to a weapon from the vehicle cargo space.

removeweaponcargo.title: removeWeaponCargo
removeweaponcargo.description: Remove weapon from the vehicle cargo space.

set3denmissionattribute.title: set3DENMissionAttribute
set3denmissionattribute.description:
Set scenario attribute.
An attribute is identified by its  ( when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see Setting Attributes.

returns.desc: true if the value was set

setconvoyseparation.title: setConvoySeparation
setconvoyseparation.description:
Sets the distance to keep to the vehicle which is in front.
*This command has to be applied to all vehicles in a convoy in order to have a separation of, for example, 50 m. 
*Vehicles in a convoy can also have different distances.
*It's recommended that small values (<10m) should only be used for slowly moving convoys, otherwise AI driven vehicles will leave the road frequently to avoid collisions

addtorque.title: addTorque
addtorque.description:
Image:addTorque_correct.jpg400
Applies torque (rotation momentum) to the  center of mass of the given object. Torque force is defined as vector [x, y, z] applied in world space. If you need to define torque in model space, convert the torque vector first by vectorModelToWorld or vectorModelToWorldVisual command. The torque applied as impulse. Diagram below explain which way the object would rotate.  For more information see http://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/classPxRigidBody.html#acb04ffc816d45afff2d04e93d7446e79NVIDIA docs

addforce.title: addForce
addforce.description: Applies impulse force to given PhysX object at given position.

args.name: force
args.desc: in format [x,y,z], force vector in world space. Force is in https://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/structPxForceMode.htmlNewton

args.name: position
args.desc: in format [x,y,z], in object's relative position

vectormodeltoworld.title: vectorModelToWorld
vectormodeltoworld.description: Converts vector direction from model to world space.

args.name: modelDir
args.desc: vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]

returns.desc: vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]

vectormodeltoworldvisual.title: vectorModelToWorldVisual
vectormodeltoworldvisual.description: Converts vector from model to world space in render time scope.

args.name: modelDir
args.desc: vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]

returns.desc: vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]

vectorworldtomodel.title: vectorWorldToModel
vectorworldtomodel.description: Converts vector direction from world to model space.

args.name: worldDir
args.desc: vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]

returns.desc: vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]

vectorworldtomodelvisual.title: vectorWorldToModelVisual
vectorworldtomodelvisual.description: Converts vector direction from world to model space in render time scope.

args.name: worldDir
args.desc: vector direction in world space in format [x,y,z]

returns.desc: vector direction in model space in format [x,y,z]

listvehiclesensors.title: listVehicleSensors
listvehiclesensors.description: Returns an array of the sensors in the given vehicle's config (configFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> vehicle >> "Components" >> "SensorsManagerComponent" >> "Components").

getcompatiblepylonmagazines.title: getCompatiblePylonMagazines
getcompatiblepylonmagazines.description: Get array of compatible pylon magazines

args.name: vehicle: Object or String - aircraft object or config class

pylon: Number or String
* If String - pylon class name from  class 
* If Number - pylon ID
* If an invalid pylon ID or class name is provided, such as 0 or "", all compatible magazines from all pylons are returned.

allairports.title: allAirports
allairports.description: Returns all map airports, both static and dynamic.

isvehicleradaron.title: isVehicleRadarOn
isvehicleradaron.description: Returns true if vehicle has active sensors on.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle on which check is performed

isvehiclesensorenabled.title: isVehicleSensorEnabled
isvehiclesensorenabled.description: Returns class name (to identify list based on component name) and info if given sensor is enabled.

args.name: componentName : String - The component's name (can either be it is "real name" or it is className)
componentName : String - The component's name (can either be its "real name" or its className)

listremotetargets.title: listRemoteTargets
listremotetargets.description: Return list of datalink targets and time for which they will be/were known.

selectrandomweighted.title: selectRandomWeighted
selectrandomweighted.description:
Returns a random element from the given array according to assigned weights. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted. A few notes:
* Negative weights are not supported
* If an item's weight is 0, the item is ignored
* The weights don't have to total to 1 
* If numbers of items and weights do not match, the shortest array is used
* A single array Syntax is slightly faster than Alt Syntax

args.name:
valuesAndWeights: Array - array in format [value1, weight1, value2, weight2, ...], where:
* value: Anything - weighted value
* weight: Number - values relative weight

returns.desc: random weighted value or Nothing if array is empty or all weights are 0
random weighted value or Nothing if any of arrays is empty or all weights are 0

isuicontext.title: isUIContext
isuicontext.description: Returns true if the script originated from some UI control event, for example from "onButtonDown" EH. Exists within parent scope and immediate child scopes.

leaderboardsrequestuploadscore.title: leaderboardsRequestUploadScore
leaderboardsrequestuploadscore.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value always overwrite the current value in the board. The board has to be initialized before the call.

leaderboardsrequestuploadscorekeepbest.title: leaderboardsRequestUploadScoreKeepBest
leaderboardsrequestuploadscorekeepbest.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value is only stored to board if it is better than one already in the board. The board has to be initialised before the call.

leaderboardstate.title: leaderboardState
leaderboardstate.description: Returns the state of the board with the given name.

forcefollowroad.title: forceFollowRoad
forcefollowroad.description: Forces the vehicle to stay on road.

args.name: state
args.desc: true: Force on road, false: default behaviour

islaseron.title: isLaserOn
islaseron.description: Returns true if the vehicle has its laser turned on. Not to be confused with isIRLaserOn which is for units. Main syntax is for primary gunner turret.

returns.desc: true when laser is on, false otherwise
true when laser is on, false otherwise

ctrltextwidth.title: ctrlTextWidth
ctrltextwidth.description: Returns the width of the control text including left and right margins (0.008 each). Supported control types are:

setplatenumber.title: setPlateNumber
setplatenumber.description: Change the license plates on any vehicle which has plates configured. Max 15 characters are allowed!

getplatenumber.title: getPlateNumber
getplatenumber.description: Get the license plates from any vehicle which has plates configured.

disablemapindicators.title: disableMapIndicators
disablemapindicators.description: Command allows suppressing visualization of FRIENDLY, ENEMY, MINES and/or PING map indicators from difficulty setting EXTENDED MAP CONTENT.

args.name: disableFriendly
args.desc: true to disable visualization of friendly units

args.name: disableEnemy
args.desc: true to disable visualization of enemy units

args.name: disableMines
args.desc: true to disable visualization of mines

args.name: disablePing
args.desc: true to disable visualization of all tactical pings

lbsetcolorright.title: lbSetColorRight
lbsetcolorright.description: Sets the color of the item (right) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

lbcolorright.title: lbColorRight
lbcolorright.description: Returns the text color of the item (right) with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog.

gettotaldlcusagetime.title: getTotalDLCUsageTime
gettotaldlcusagetime.description: Returns total DLC usage time in this game session

settaskmarkeroffset.title: setTaskMarkerOffset
settaskmarkeroffset.description: Sets the task marker position in model space.

getdlcassetsusage.title: getDLCAssetsUsage
getdlcassetsusage.description: Returns an array of the DLC usage times.

getdlcassetsusagebyname.title: getDLCAssetsUsageByName
getdlcassetsusagebyname.description: Returns an array with the session and global time the asset has been used.

a_hash_b.title: a_hash_b
a_hash_b.description: Selects an element from an  array, same as select command for arrays, but has  higher precedence

ctrlsetpixelprecision.title: ctrlSetPixelPrecision
ctrlsetpixelprecision.description: Switches mode of pixel precision (rounding) in a given control interface.

args.name:
mode: Number or String - can be one of the following:
* 0 / "AUTO" - control position (x, y, w, h) is always rounded to whole pixels (game default)
* 1 / "ON" - control position (x, y, w, h) is rounded to whole pixels only when not animating
* 2 / "OFF" - control position (x, y, w, h) is always precise, no pixel rounding applies here

setusermfdtext.title: setUserMFDText
setusermfdtext.description: Stored user text value in MFD, limit is 50, user0...user49

getusermfdtext.title: getUserMFDText
getusermfdtext.description: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

opensteamapp.title: openSteamApp
opensteamapp.description: Opens a Steam application, returns false if it was not possible to run the application.

getmusicplayedtime.title: getMusicPlayedTime
getmusicplayedtime.description: Returns elapsed time in seconds for currently playing music track.

infopanel.title: infoPanel
infopanel.description:
Returns information about what is currently displayed on given player's info panel.
Returns ["EmptyDisplay","EmptyDisplayComponent"] when no panel is open.

enableinfopanelcomponent.title: enableInfoPanelComponent
enableinfopanelcomponent.description: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

returns.desc: true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

returns.desc: true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

infopanelcomponentenabled.title: infoPanelComponentEnabled
infopanelcomponentenabled.description: Controls availability of component to given object info panel.

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

returns.desc: true if component was successfully enabled on the panel, false otherwise (e.g. component is not available for the object)

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

infopanelcomponents.title: infoPanelComponents
infopanelcomponents.description: Returns array of all components available to given object info panel.

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

args.name: panelID
args.desc: "left" or "right" can be used as panel names

infopanels.title: infoPanels
infopanels.description: Returns array all info panels configured for given object or object and turret path.

setinfopanel.title: setInfoPanel
setinfopanel.description: Opens given component or first component of given component type on specified info panel.

returns.desc: true if panel was successfully opened, false otherwise (e.g. opening GPS on player without GPS item or setting panel to vehicle that doesn't have such capability configured)

isstressdamageenabled.title: isStressDamageEnabled
isstressdamageenabled.description: Returns true if stress damage is enabled in the game settings. A getter for enableStressDamage.

enablestressdamage.title: enableStressDamage
enablestressdamage.description: Toggles stress damage in  Advanced Flight Model, which otherwise could be manually toggles in game setting: .

args.name: state
args.desc: true to enable stress damage, false to disable it

enginespowerrtd.title: enginesPowerRTD
enginespowerrtd.description: Returns power produced by engines in Watts.

args.name: RTD_helicopter
args.desc: Helicopter with advanced flight model enabled

returns.desc: Watts produced by the engines, to format [engine1, engine2]. Returns an empty array if Advanced Flight Model is disabled.

clear3deninventory.title: clear3DENInventory
clear3deninventory.description: Deletes inventory from mission.sqm of given units. Effect is not immediately visible, only when previewing the inventory resets to default.

args.name: entities: Array of Eden Entity or Eden ID

isaimprecisionenabled.title: isAimPrecisionEnabled
isaimprecisionenabled.description: Returns true if procedural aiming precision affects weapon sway.

returns.desc: True if affected, false if not

useaiopermapobstructiontest.title: useAIOperMapObstructionTest
useaiopermapobstructiontest.description: Toggle secondary obstruction test on road paths.

args.name: state
args.desc: true to enable, false to disable

args.name: RTD_helicopter
args.desc: Helicopter with advanced flight model enabled

airdensitycurvertd.title: airDensityCurveRTD
airdensitycurvertd.description: Returns array with air density data.

ctrlanimatemodel.title: ctrlAnimateModel
ctrlanimatemodel.description: Process an animation of 3D Arma: GUI Configuration. Command uses name defined by source property and works similar like animateSource command.

args.name:
speed: Boolean or Number - (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - when set to true, animation is instant
*  Number - > 0 is treated as config speed value multiplier

ctrlanimationphasemodel.title: ctrlAnimationPhaseModel
ctrlanimationphasemodel.description: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationSourcePhase.

clear3denattribute.title: clear3DENAttribute
clear3denattribute.description: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor. An attribute is identified by its  ( when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see Setting Attributes.

args.name: entity: Eden Entity or Eden ID

ctaddrow.title: ctAddRow
ctaddrow.description:
Adds one row of controls according to the RowTemplate class. It returns an array containing row index and array of created controls in a format [<rowIndex>, [<control0>, <control1>...<control n>]].

Note that rows and headers are indexed separately.

ctfindheaderrows.title: ctFindHeaderRows
ctfindheaderrows.description: Gets array of indices of rows under this header.

findif.title: findIf
findif.description:
Searches for an element within array for which the code evaluates to true. Returns the zero-based index on success or -1 if not found.
Code on the right side of the command is evaluated for each element of the array, processed element can be referenced in code as _x.

args.name: code
args.desc: code defining an element to find, processed element can be referenced within the code as _x

returns.desc: Zero-based position of the first array element for which the code evaluate to true, -1 if not found

+.description: Add two Numbers, concatenate two Arrays or two Strings, or create a copy of an Array or HashMap.

returns.desc: The sum of numberA and numberB
The value of the parameter number
A new array filled with arrayA and arrayB elements, in that order
a string concatenating stringA and stringB
A new instance of the provided array filled with same elements ()
A new instance of the provided HashMap filled with the same key-value pairs ()

-.description: Subtracts numbers or arrays from each another, negates a number. For arrays also see deleteAt and deleteRange.

getusermfdvalue.title: getUserMFDValue
getusermfdvalue.description: Returns array of user text variables used in MFD.

setusermfdvalue.title: setUserMFDValue

args.name: index
args.desc: index of custom MFD user actions

args.name: value
args.desc: value which should custom source return in MFD

lnbsettooltip.title: lnbSetTooltip
lnbsettooltip.description: Sets tooltip on the item with the given row and column of CT_LISTNBOX.

args.name: row
args.desc: row where the tooltip should be shown

args.name: column
args.desc: column where tooltip should be shown. By default it is set for every column, see description

args.name: row
args.desc: Row where the tooltip should be shown

args.name: column
args.desc: Column where tooltip should be shown. By default it is set for every column, see description

setpylonloadout.title: setPylonLoadout
setpylonloadout.description: Adds/overrides loadout to a vehicle pylon.  in vehicle config and  in the magazine config are required to run.

args.name: pylon: Number or String - pylon index (index starts from 1) or pylon name (see getCompatiblePylonMagazines Example 4)
forced
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to force incompatible magazine

addweaponwithattachmentscargo.title: addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargo
addweaponwithattachmentscargo.description: Adds a weapon into the cargo space of a vehicle / box with given attachments / magazines. Ignores available cargo space. If the weapon class has any pre-attached items (LinkedItems), they are removed and new items, supplied via command arguments, are added.

args.name: container
args.desc: Container to add the weapon to. Might be a backpack, ammobox or vehicle.

args.name:
weaponConfiguration: Array in format [weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, primaryMuzzle, secondaryMuzzle, bipod]
* weapon: String - Weapon class name from CfgWeapons
* muzzle: String - Muzzle attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* flashlight: String - Side rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* optics: String - Top rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* primaryMuzzle: Array in format [primaryMuzzleMagazine, primaryAmmoCount] - Use [] if not needed
** primaryMuzzleMagazine: String - Magazine class name
** primaryAmmoCount: Number - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped to values between 0 and the maximum capacity of the magazine class)
* secondaryMuzzle: Array in format [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, secondaryAmmoCount] - Use [] if not needed
** secondaryMuzzleMagazine: String - Magazine class name
** secondaryAmmoCount: Number - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped to values between 0 and the maximum capacity of the magazine class)
* bipod: String - Underbarrel rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
This array has the same format as the array returned by the weaponsItems command.

addweaponwithattachmentscargoglobal.title: addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal
addweaponwithattachmentscargoglobal.description: Adds a weapon into the cargo space of a vehicle / box with given attachments / magazines. Ignores available cargo space. If the weapon class has any pre-attached items (LinkedItems), they are removed and new items, supplied via command arguments, are added.

args.name: container
args.desc: Container to add the weapon to. Might be a backpack, ammobox or vehicle.

args.name:
weaponConfiguration: Array in format [weapon, muzzle, flashlight, optics, primaryMuzzle, secondaryMuzzle, bipod]
* weapon: String - Weapon class name from CfgWeapons
* muzzle: String - Muzzle attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* flashlight: String - Side rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* optics: String - Top rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
* primaryMuzzle: Array in format [primaryMuzzleMagazine, primaryAmmoCount] - Use [] if not needed
** primaryMuzzleMagazine: String - Magazine class name
** primaryAmmoCount: Number - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped to values between 0 and the maximum capacity of the magazine class)
* secondaryMuzzle: Array in format [secondaryMuzzleMagazine, secondaryAmmoCount] - Use [] if not needed
** secondaryMuzzleMagazine: String - Magazine class name
** secondaryAmmoCount: Number - Ammo count in magazine (will be clipped to values between 0 and the maximum capacity of the magazine class)
* bipod: String - Underbarrel rail attachment class name. Use "" if not needed.
This array has the same format as the array returned by the weaponsItems command.

calculatepath.title: calculatePath
calculatepath.description:
Spawns an agent that will execute an AI path calculation and fire the   event handler. The vehicle type to simulate could be one of the following presets:

If the given vehicle type is not one of the above presets, the exact given type is used.

returns.desc: The agent to add the  Event Handler to.

triggerammo.title: triggerAmmo
triggerammo.description:
Triggers a munition such as shells, bullets, missiles, rockets, mines and bombs (shotSubmunition/shotShell/shotBullet/shotMissile/shotRocket) as if it did hit.
If ammo uses submunition, then creation of submunition will be triggered.

setmissiletargetpos.title: setMissileTargetPos
setmissiletargetpos.description:
Sets a guided munition target position.
The munition must have  config entry to use this command.
The target position has to be inside the missile's configured targeting cone for the command to work.

setmissiletarget.title: setMissileTarget
setmissiletarget.description: Sets a guided missile target. Does not work for all types of missiles. If the target is dead, it is ignored. The target has to be inside the missile's configured targeting cone for the command to work.

missiletargetpos.title: missileTargetPos
missiletargetpos.description: Returns a guided missile's target position.

ctrlsetpositionx.title: ctrlSetPositionX
ctrlsetpositionx.description: Sets horizontal position (x) of the 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

ctrlsetpositiony.title: ctrlSetPositionY
ctrlsetpositiony.description: Sets vertical position (y) of a 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

ctrlsetpositionw.title: ctrlSetPositionW
ctrlsetpositionw.description: Sets the width of a 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

ctrlsetpositionh.title: ctrlSetPositionH
ctrlsetpositionh.description: Sets the height of a 2D control. ctrlCommit is required to complete the operation.

vectorlinearconversion.title: vectorLinearConversion
vectorlinearconversion.description: Interpolates vector between the given vectorFrom and vectorTo value according to the given range value.

syntaxes.code: vectorLinearConversion [rangeFrom, rangeTo, rangeValue, vectorFrom, vectorTo, clip]

args.name: clip
args.desc: (Optional, default false if true, range value will be clipped to stay within "from" - "to" range

matrixmultiply.title: matrixMultiply
matrixmultiply.description:
Image:matrixMultiply.jpg600
Returns resulting matrix from the  of two matrices. First matrix must be of the size n × k, while the second must be of the size k × m, i.e  matrix1 ==  matrix2. The resulting matrix will be of the size n × m. If the shapes do not match, empty array [] will be returned.

matrixtranspose.title: matrixTranspose
matrixtranspose.description:
File:matrixTranspose.jpgMatrix transposition
Returns  version of the given matrix.
The matrix is an Array of rows.
Each row is an Array of corresponding column values for the row. The minimum number of rows is 1.

bezierinterpolation.title: bezierInterpolation
bezierinterpolation.description:
Gets interpolated value based on  with given control points (progress value is 0...1 for a curve that starts at pos0 and finishes at posN) 
Image:bezierInterpolation2.jpg400

args.name: positions: Array of Arrays in format Position3D

returns.desc: a single point position in format Position3D based on progress value

decaygraphvalues.title: decayGraphValues
decaygraphvalues.description: Multiplies graph values by the given coefficient. The corresponding lower bound value is used instead if the product is smaller than the bound.

args.name: lowerBoundValues: Array of Numbers - lower bound for the new graph
graphValues: Array of Numbers - graph values

getgraphvalues.title: getGraphValues
getgraphvalues.description: Generate graph y - coordinates of all input values within specific x and y range.

syntaxes.code: getGraphValues [[graphMinX, graphMaxX, graphMinY, graphMaxY, valueCount, randomOffset], x1, y1, x2, y2, ... xn, yn]

args.name: valueCount
args.desc: number of values the returned array should have

args.name: randomOffset
args.desc: random range for returned y value

calculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.title: calculatePlayerVisibilityByFriendly
calculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.description: Sets if friendly units will calculate player's visibility or not. Default value is false.

getcalculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.title: getCalculatePlayerVisibilityByFriendly
getcalculateplayervisibilitybyfriendly.description: Returns true if visibility of player by friendly units is calculated.

returns.desc: true if visibility is calculated, false if not

removediarysubject.title: removeDiarySubject
removediarysubject.description: Removes a page and all its subjects from the Diary.

setdiaryrecordtext.title: setDiaryRecordText
setdiaryrecordtext.description: Set text of a log record.

args.name: icon
args.desc: (Optional) icon to show next to the title. "" to remove.

toloweransi.title: toLowerANSI
toloweransi.description:
File:ISO-8859-1.jpgISO-8859-1
Converts the supplied string to all lower case characters fast (could be 3× faster than toLower).
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/701882/what-is-ansi-format/701920ANSI in this case refers to  code page.
The command is primary designed to convert characters with  codes 0...127 however it will also convert other characters in 128...255 range as long as they are present in ISO-8859-1 codepage.
For Unicode alternative see toLower.

toupperansi.title: toUpperANSI
toupperansi.description:
File:ISO-8859-1.jpgISO-8859-1Converts the supplied string to all upper case characters fast (could be 3x faster than toUpper).
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/701882/what-is-ansi-format/701920ANSI in this case refers to  code page.
The command is primary designed to convert characters with  codes 0...127 however will also convert other characters in 128...255 range as long as they are present in ISO-8859-1 codepage.
For Unicode alternative see toUpper.

getobjectfov.title: getObjectFOV
getobjectfov.description:
Returns Field of View of the given object in radians. Static objects return default value, which is 1.
FOV of objNull is 0.
Object FOV is indirectly connected with optics magnification or player view zoom, the narrower the angle the greater the zoom.

args.name: object
args.desc: for units it queries unit weapon optics/zoom, for vehicles - vehicle optics/zoom

getposworldvisual.title: getPosWorldVisual
getposworldvisual.description: Returns the provided object's, model centre position in render version in format PositionASL, rather than transformed boundingCenter or LandContact vertices.

returns.desc: format PositionASL  the model centre's position (see getPosWorld) in render scope

isgamefocused.title: isGameFocused
isgamefocused.description: Returns the state of game focus changed by pressing  or similar action.

returns.desc: true if game window is focused, false if not

isgamepaused.title: isGamePaused
isgamepaused.description:
Returns the state of game simulation. Simulation can get paused by pressing  or a system dialog opening (e.g.  menu).
Simulation will not get paused if  startup parameter is used.

returns.desc: Returns true if game simulation is paused, false if not

isactionmenuvisible.title: isActionMenuVisible
isactionmenuvisible.description: Returns true if scroll menu is visible.

getmissionpath.title: getMissionPath
getmissionpath.description:
Returns mission root plus the filename in a form of filepath to be used with commands requiring absolute path such as playSound3D, drawIcon3D, createSimpleObject, etc.
Any leading "\" in the filename will be stripped as the mission root includes one already.

currentpilot.title: currentPilot
currentpilot.description: Returns the person piloting the vehicle. If co-pilot is piloting, co-pilot is returned. If you need current pilot of a UAV or UGV, see UAVControl command.

getdiverstate.title: getDiverState
getdiverstate.description: Returns true when object is in diver state - e.g when the unit would put diving goggles on.

returns.desc: true when diving goggles are visible

clearforcesrtd.title: clearForcesRTD
clearforcesrtd.description: Removes all force generators from world.

args.name: position
args.desc: Position where to force generator is created.

seteffectivecommander.title: setEffectiveCommander
seteffectivecommander.description:
Sets effectiveCommander of the given vehicle. Effective commander is the person who commands the vehicle, i.e. gives commands to the driver.
Every time a person gets in or out of a vehicle, effective commander eligibility is recalculated by the engine based on the current crew.
Use this command to force desired effective commander.

playmusic.title: playMusic
playmusic.description:
Plays music defined in Description.ext's CfgMusic or config.cpp. If the musicName could not be found a message is logged into the .rpt file: .
* Arma 3 CfgMusic
* Arma 2: CfgMusic
* ArmA: Armed Assault: CfgMusic
* Operation Flashpoint: CfgMusic

args.name: start
args.desc: start, in seconds. Can be negative.

settriggerinterval.title: setTriggerInterval
settriggerinterval.description: Sets the interval in seconds for trigger condition check.

args.name: interval
args.desc: Interval in seconds with which trigger condition is checked

triggerinterval.title: triggerInterval
triggerinterval.description: Returns trigger condition check frequency in seconds.

gettextwidth.title: getTextWidth
gettextwidth.description: Returns estimated width of the text based on font type and size. Similar to ctrlTextWidth but does not require a control and can be used to estimate text width for any control including buttons. Result does not include left and right margins (hardcoded at 0.008 each).

vehiclemoveinfo.title: vehicleMoveInfo
vehiclemoveinfo.description:
Returns current vehicle move/turn info (a getter for sendSimpleCommand) in format [moveInfo, turnInfo]. Possible values:

{! classwikitable
! moveInfo
! turnInfo
!- stylevertical-align: top
! width50% 
*  - vehicle is stationary
*   - vehicle is moving forward
*  - vehicle is fast moving forward
*  - vehicle is slow moving forward
*  - vehicle is stationary
*  - vehicle is reversing
*  - keyboard pilot is used, i.e. player is in the vehicle and is the effectiveCommander pressing any driving key (WASD or arrows). 
! width50% 
*  - vehicle is turning left (use  "STOPTURNING" to cancel)
*  - vehicle is turning right (use  "STOPTURNING" to cancel)
*  - vehicle is not turning (when script command is used)
*  - vehicle is not turning (when keyboard pilot is used)
!}

allactivetitleeffects.title: allActiveTitleEffects
allactivetitleeffects.description: Returns a list of all layers that have currently active title effect. Numbers equal to or greater than 0 represent cut layers, where as -1 represents title layer (see Title Effect Type). Named layers are represented by their respective index.

addmagazinecargoglobal.title: addMagazineCargoGlobal
addmagazinecargoglobal.description:
Add magazines to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

MP Synchronized

args.name: vehicleName
args.desc: vehicle to add the magazines to

args.name: magazineName
args.desc: magazine name. See :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

args.name: count
args.desc: number of magazines to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove magazines.

addweaponcargoglobal.title: addWeaponCargoGlobal
addweaponcargoglobal.description: Add weapons to the cargo space of vehicles, which can be taken out by infantry units.

args.name: vehicleName
args.desc: vehicle to which add the weapons

args.name: weaponName
args.desc: weapon name. See the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values

args.name: count
args.desc: number of weapons to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove weapons.

isdamageallowed.title: isDamageAllowed
isdamageallowed.description:
A getter for allowDamage command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current locality, hence local effect of the command.
For complete solution for being able to tell whether or not an object can be damaged at current locality see .

getassetdlcinfo.title: getAssetDLCInfo
getassetdlcinfo.description: Returns DLC information about given object or model.

args.name: asset: Object or String - object reference or path to the model
config
args.desc: (Optional, default:  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles") config in which to search

ctrltextselection.title: ctrlTextSelection
ctrltextselection.description: Returns edit control text selection in format [start, length, selectedText].

ctrlsettextselection.title: ctrlSetTextSelection
ctrlsettextselection.description: Selects  characters of edit control from the  position and places cursor at the end of selection.

args.name: length
args.desc: length of characters to select (0 to only move the cursor). Negative length will select text from right to left (see example 3)

setwaypointloiteraltitude.title: setWaypointLoiterAltitude
setwaypointloiteraltitude.description: Assigns loiter altitude to the provided waypoint.

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

lnbsetpicturecolorselected.title: lnbSetPictureColorSelected
lnbsetpicturecolorselected.description: Sets the cell picture's colour on cell selection.

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

lnbsetpictureright.title: lnbSetPictureRight
lnbsetpictureright.description: Sets the cell's right-picture. The picture is set to the end of the row, the column parameter does not matter.

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

getfieldmanualstartpage.title: getFieldManualStartPage
getfieldmanualstartpage.description: Returns array of the starting topic and hint the given field manual should display.

getdlcusagetime.title: getDLCUsageTime
getdlcusagetime.description: Returns total time the assets of the given DLC have been used. See Arma 3 DLCs & Expansions for a list of DLCs and ids.

returns.desc: DLC assets usage time in seconds

addonfiles.title: addonFiles
addonfiles.description: Returns a list of files present in the addon.

args.name: fileExtension
args.desc: (Optional) file extension to filter results, for example

alladdonsinfo.title: allAddonsInfo
alladdonsinfo.description: Returns the list of all loaded addons.

getallunittraits.title: getAllUnitTraits
getallunittraits.description: Returns unit traits, native or set by setUnitTrait.

surfacetexture.title: surfaceTexture
surfacetexture.description: Same as surfaceType, but returns texture path to ground texture as string.

args.name: position
args.desc: in format Position2D or Position3D in which case Z is ignored

getvehicletipars.title: getVehicleTIPars
getvehicletipars.description: Returns TI parameters of a vehicle.

connecttoserver.title: connectToServer
connecttoserver.description: Connects the client to the provided server.

getloadedmodsinfo.title: getLoadedModsInfo
getloadedmodsinfo.description: Returns information about all loaded modifications.

getattacktarget.title: getAttackTarget
getattacktarget.description: Returns the target given unit is engaging.

is3denpreview.title: is3DENPreview
is3denpreview.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently in mission preview mode, single player or multiplayer. (see also is3DEN, is3DENMultiplayer)

namedproperties.title: namedProperties
namedproperties.description: Returns a list of named properties on Geometry LOD.

unitturret.title: unitTurret
unitturret.description:
Returns the turret path the given vehicle's gunner is in.
To get the turret's unit see turretUnit.

ctrlscrollvalues.title: ctrlScrollValues
ctrlscrollvalues.description: Returns scroll values for current scrollbars in range 0...1 (-1 if not applicable) for the following controls:

ctrlsetscrollvalues.title: ctrlSetScrollValues
ctrlsetscrollvalues.description: Sets scroll values for current scrollbars in range 0...1 for the following controls:

args.name: vScrollValue
args.desc: vertical scroll value in 0..1 range. -1 to skip

args.name: hScrollValue
args.desc: horizontal scroll value in 0..1 range. -1 to skip

diaryrecordnull.title: diaryRecordNull
diaryrecordnull.description:
A non-existent Diary Record. To compare non-existent objects use isNull or isEqualTo:
* 
* 
*

localnamespace.title: localNamespace
localnamespace.description:
Returns local Namespace attached to the mission.
Has the same lifetime as missionNamespace but variables cannot be broadcasted out of or into this namespace in multiplayer and will not be serialized when game is saved. UI variables can be safely stored in this namespace.
Use allVariables command to save the variables elsewhere if required.

isnull.title: isNull
isnull.description:
Checks whether the tested item is null.
Which null type the item has to be equal to depends on the type of game entity tested:

{! classwikitable styletext-align: center
! Type
! Object
! Group
! Control
! Display
! Location
! Task
! Script
! Config
! Diary Record
! Team Member
!-
! Null value
! objNull
! grpNull
! controlNull
! displayNull
! locationNull
! taskNull
! scriptNull
! configNull
! diaryRecordNull
! teamMemberNull
!- stylefont-size: .85em
! Since
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
! 
!}

args.name: entity: Object, Control, Display, Group, Location, Task, Script Handle, Config or Diary Record

systemtimeutc.title: systemTimeUTC
systemtimeutc.description: Returns systemTime according to Universal Time Coordinated time scale.

isfinal.title: isFinal
isfinal.description: Checks if code or a variable was compiled final with compileFinal.

args.name: varName
args.desc: A String pointing to a variable

returns.desc: true if final, false if not
true if final, false if not

getsteamfriendsservers.title: getSteamFriendsServers
getsteamfriendsservers.description: Returns servers information of Steam friends currently playing the game.

configof.title: configOf
configof.description: Returns config path of the provided object.

getplayervonvolume.title: getPlayerVoNVolume
getplayervonvolume.description: Gets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

setplayervonvolume.title: setPlayerVoNVolume
setplayervonvolume.description: Sets provided player's Voice over Network (VoN) volume.

forcecadetdifficulty.title: forceCadetDifficulty
forcecadetdifficulty.description: Forces  and  global Cadet  difficulty, returns previous settings.

ctrlstyle.title: ctrlStyle
ctrlstyle.description: Returns the provided control's style. See .

radiochannelinfo.title: radioChannelInfo
radiochannelinfo.description: Obtains custom radio channel's details, set by radioChannelCreate.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate

gettextraw.title: getTextRaw
gettextraw.description: Returns raw text from config entry. If entry is subject to  localization, the translation key is returned. To obtain the  localized text, see getText.

setunitcombatmode.title: setUnitCombatMode
setunitcombatmode.description:
Sets unit's combat mode (engagement rules). For AI group combat mode see setCombatMode. Mode may be one of the following: 
*  : Never fire, keep formation
*  : Hold fire, keep formation
*  : Hold fire, engage at will/loose formation
*  : Fire at will, keep formation
*  : Fire at will, engage at will/loose formation
See Combat Modes for more information on combat modes.

unitcombatmode.title: unitCombatMode
unitcombatmode.description: Gets individual unit's combat mode. For more information see setUnitCombatMode.

isnotequalto.title: isNotEqualTo
isnotequalto.description: Performs strict comparison between var1 and var2 and returns false if equal, otherwise true.

ctrlmouseposition.title: ctrlMousePosition
ctrlmouseposition.description: Returns position of the mouse on the screen relative to UI Control in UI coordinates. Also works within CT_CONTROLS_GROUPs. In that case, returned position is relative to the position of the group.

tvselection.title: tvSelection
tvselection.description: Returns array of paths to selected items.

tvsetselected.title: tvSetSelected
tvsetselected.description: Sets the selection state of given treeview item in multi-select control.

tvisselected.title: tvIsSelected
tvisselected.description: Returns true if given treeview item is selected.

ctrlfontheight.title: ctrlFontHeight
ctrlfontheight.description: Returns control's font size, usually  value (see ctrlSetFontHeight).

ctrlseturl.title: ctrlSetURL
ctrlseturl.description:
Sets URL property of the given control subject to  whitelisting in CfgCommands config. Supported controls are:
* 
*  
*

ctrlsetmouseposition.title: ctrlSetMousePosition
ctrlsetmouseposition.description: Similar to setMousePosition but relative to the given control.

lockinventory.title: lockInventory
lockinventory.description:
Lock or unlock a vehicle's inventory access.
This command can also lock backpack a unit is wearing to prevent access by a third party.
If set to true (locked), the inventory cannot be accessed via hotkey or action menu.

lockedinventory.title: lockedInventory
lockedinventory.description: Get a vehicle's inventory lock state. Can also be used on a unit's backback (see lockInventory).

ctrltextcolor.title: ctrlTextColor
ctrltextcolor.description: Returns control's text color in Color (RGBA) format (see ctrlSetTextColor).

binocularmagazine.title: binocularMagazine
binocularmagazine.description: Collects all loaded magazines from all binocular muzzles and returns them in Array, otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

binocularitems.title: binocularItems
binocularitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the binocular weapon except magazines. Use binocularMagazine command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

addbinocularitem.title: addBinocularItem
addbinocularitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the binocular weapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

removebinocularitem.title: removeBinocularItem
removebinocularitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the binocular weapon.

removeallbinocularitems.title: removeAllBinocularItems
removeallbinocularitems.description: Removes all items from binocular weapon, except magazine.

removeallsecondaryweaponitems.title: removeAllSecondaryWeaponItems
removeallsecondaryweaponitems.description: Removes all items from secondaryWeapon, except magazine.

elevateperiscope.title: elevatePeriscope
elevateperiscope.description:
Elevates periscope of a vehicle. Vehicles in Arma 3 which are compatible with this tech are Strider, remote laser designators, the robot arm on Eddie, etc.
Please note that SDV submarine has a different periscope, which is just an animated selection and could be raised and lowered with animate command.

args.name: turret
args.desc: turret on which periscope is located

args.name: speed: Number or Boolean - (Optional, default -1) config anim speed multiplier, 2 - twice as fast, 0.5 - twice as slow, etc. -1 - default config speed. If true is used as param, the change in elevation is almost instant
blockUserInput
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to disable user ability to control periscope with keyboard. The change is persistent unless set to false again

periscopeelevation.title: periscopeElevation
periscopeelevation.description: Returns current periscope elevation value, see also elevatePeriscope.

getrotorbrakertd.title: getRotorBrakeRTD
getrotorbrakertd.description: Returns if rotor break is on.

issensortargetconfirmed.title: isSensorTargetConfirmed
issensortargetconfirmed.description: Returns if given unit is confirmed target for given side.

returns.desc: true if confirmed target, otherwise false

getsoundcontroller.title: getSoundController
getsoundcontroller.description: Returns value of the given sound controller.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: must be a vehicle (does not work on soldiers)

args.name: controller
args.desc: name of sound controller, for example "rpm" or "thrust".

hidebody.title: hideBody
hidebody.description: Hides dead body of the given unit. After a short delay, the body slowly sinks into the ground. After awhile, when group of the unit becomes grpNull, the body gets deleted and becomes objNull. If applied to alive unit, nothing happens until unit dies, then the unit's body gets hidden. If a dead unit is human player, the body is hidden but not deleted until player respawns.

setmarkerpolylinelocal.title: setMarkerPolylineLocal
setmarkerpolylinelocal.description: Sets a polyline marker's path. Works only on the computer that executes this command.

markerpolyline.title: markerPolyline
markerpolyline.description: Returns a polyline marker's path data.

markerchannel.title: markerChannel
markerchannel.description: Returns the channel that a marker belongs to.

getplayerid.title: getPlayerID
getplayerid.description: Returns user DirectPlay ID, which can be used with getUserInfo, and is found in allMapMarkers results and in some mission event handlers such as PlayerConnected.

returns.desc: "-1" if object is not a player

ctrltooltip.title: ctrlTooltip
ctrltooltip.description: Returns the tooltip property of a button control. Getter for ctrlSetTooltip.

ctrlurl.title: ctrlURL
ctrlurl.description: Returns the URL property of a button control. Getter for ctrlSetURL.

missionnamesource.title: missionNameSource
missionnamesource.description: Return workshop-compatible currently loaded mission file (path to mission.pbo, relative to game exe).

continue.title: continue
continue.description: Skips current loop iteration and continues with the next one.

continuewith.title: continueWith
continuewith.description: Skips the current loop iteration, continues with the next one and returns the given value.

args.name: return
args.desc: value to be returned when iteration is skipped

breakwith.title: breakWith
breakwith.description: Skips all loop iterations and immediately returns the given value.

args.name: return
args.desc: Value to be returned when iterations are skipped

forceunicode.title: forceUnicode
forceunicode.description:
stylefloat: right
List of the commands that work with forceUnicode:


Sets the Unicode flag which forces some of the string manipulation commands to switch to .
The Unicode flag is always set right after forceUnicode command execution, but is reset depending on the command mode: 
* 1 - the Unicode flag is reset right after any of the supported commands executed or the end of script, whichever comes earlier.
* 0 - the Unicode flag is reset at the end of the script.
When the flag is set it will also affect all scopes within the script including child scopes (see diag_scope).
There are many other string manipulation commands like ctrlSetText, getTextWidth, etc. that support Unicode by design so no additional forcing is needed.

args.name:
mode: Number - Mode of operation, can be:
* -1 - resets previously set Unicode flag
*  0 - sets Unicode flag until the end of script
*  1 - sets Unicode flag until after next supported command or until the end of script, whichever comes earlier

menuseturl.title: menuSetURL
menuseturl.description: Sets weblink (URL) of given menu strip entry, subject to  whitelisting in CfgCommands config.

menusetshortcut.title: menuSetShortcut
menusetshortcut.description: Sets shortcut of given menu strip entry.

menusettext.title: menuSetText
menusettext.description: Sets text of given menu strip entry.

getallpylonsinfo.title: getAllPylonsInfo
getallpylonsinfo.description: Return an array with the vehicle's all pylons info.

fileexists.title: fileExists
fileexists.description: Checks if file on given path exists. Uses same path resolve code as loadFile.

returns.desc: true if it exists, otherwise false

args.name: stringValue
args.desc: string to be trimmed. spaces, tabs and line returns are removed from both ends of stringValue.

args.name: chars
args.desc: list of characters to be trimmed

args.name:
where: Number - can be:
* 0 - trim at the beginning (left) and the end (right)
* 1 - trim at the beginning (left)
* 2 - trim at the end (right)

tvsortall.title: tvSortAll
tvsortall.description: Sorts all children, including trees deriving from given path. Text of Tree View entries is used for sorting.

tvsortbyvalueall.title: tvSortByValueAll
tvsortbyvalueall.description: Sorts all children, including trees deriving from given path.  Value of Tree View entries is used for sorting.

setobjectscale.title: setObjectScale
setobjectscale.description: Scales an attached object or a Simple Object's model.

args.name: object
args.desc: must be either an attached object or Simple Object

args.name: scale
args.desc: limited to 0.0001 to 65504, relative to the object model's normal scale

getobjectscale.title: getObjectScale
getobjectscale.description: Returns the render scale of the object relative to the original model.

args.name: object
args.desc: Object to return scale of. Can also be a terrain object

returns.desc: Scale relative to the original model

lnbpictureright.title: lnbPictureRight
lnbpictureright.description: Returns the right picture of given row. The column parameter does not matter.

lnbcolorright.title: lnbColorRight
lnbcolorright.description: Returns the right color of given row.

getmissionlayers.title: getMissionLayers
getmissionlayers.description: Returns a list of all layers created in Eden Editor. Designed to be used during a scenario. Default layers (BLUFOR, OPFOR...) are not returned.

returns.desc: Array of strings with names of layers

setcustommissiondata.title: setCustomMissionData
setcustommissiondata.description: Defines custom mission text that is sent to Arma 3 Analytics.

args.name: data
args.desc: Array of strings. A maximum of five strings is allowed, each string with a maximum length of 16 characters

tvpictureright.title: tvPictureRight
tvpictureright.description: Returns the right picture of a CT_TREE on given path.

ctrlsetdisabledcolor.title: ctrlSetDisabledColor
ctrlsetdisabledcolor.description: Sets the colorDisabled attribute of a control.

isautostartupenabledrtd.title: isAutoStartUpEnabledRTD
isautostartupenabledrtd.description: Returns state of automatic start up action.

returns.desc: Returns true if automatic start up action is enabled.

isautotrimonrtd.title: isAutoTrimOnRTD
isautotrimonrtd.description: Returns state of auto trim functionality.

returns.desc: Returns true if auto trim is enabled

leaderboardrequestrowsglobal.title: leaderboardRequestRowsGlobal
leaderboardrequestrowsglobal.description: Requests given leaderboard to download values from global table.

args.name: offset
args.desc: Defines how many rows are skipped

args.name: rows
args.desc: Defines how many rows are requested

returns.desc: Returns true if request has been started

leaderboardrequestrowsglobalarounduser.title: leaderboardRequestRowsGlobalAroundUser
leaderboardrequestrowsglobalarounduser.description: Requests given leaderboard to download values around the user position in the table.

args.name: rows
args.desc: Defines how many rows are requested

returns.desc: Returns true if request has been started

lnbtextright.title: lnbTextRight
lnbtextright.description: Returns CT_LISTNBOX's right aligned cell text.

lnbsetpicturecolorright.title: lnbSetPictureColorRight
lnbsetpicturecolorright.description: Sets color of the right picture in a CT_LISTNBOX.

lnbsetpicturecolorselectedright.title: lnbSetPictureColorSelectedRight
lnbsetpicturecolorselectedright.description: Sets the color of the right picture when it is selected.

tvsetselectcolor.title: tvSetSelectColor
tvsetselectcolor.description: Sets the select color of given path.

setenginerpmrtd.title: setEngineRpmRTD
setenginerpmrtd.description: Sets the RPM of given engines.

args.name:
engineIndex: Number - Index of the engine
* engine index 0: engine #1
* engine index 1: engine #2
* engine index 2: engine #3
* engine index -1: all engines

createhashmapfromarray.title: createHashMapFromArray
createhashmapfromarray.description: Creates a new HashMap and initializes it from a key-value pair array

get.title: get
get.description: Retrieves a value out of a HashMap after looking it up by its key.

getordefault.title: getOrDefault
getordefault.description: Retrieves a value out of a HashMap after looking it up by its key. When the HashMap doesn't contain the key, the default value is returned

args.name: setDefault
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if set to true and value does not exist in provided hash map, defaultValue will be added to the hash map

keys.title: keys
keys.description: Retrieves a list of all keys in a HashMap.

returns.desc: Array of all keys in the HashMap

insert.title: insert
insert.description:
Inserts multiple values into Array/String/HashMap.
The String variant also supports forceUnicode.

args.name: index
args.desc: index at which the values will be inserted, -1 for append.

args.name: valuesToInsert: Array of Anything - values to insert at the specified index
onlyIfUnique
args.desc: only insert if the value is unique in the array, like pushBackUnique

args.name: index
args.desc: index at which the values will be inserted, -1 for append.

args.name:
keysAndValues: Array - in format depending on splitArray's value:
* true - 
* false -  (same as )

compilescript.title: compileScript
compilescript.description:
This command is an alias for . See description of preprocessFileLineNumbers for more details.
In addition, this command can also compile SQF Bytecode files, which can reduce compilation time.

args.name: final
args.desc: (Optional, default false) compile final, see compileFinal

args.name: prefixHeader
args.desc: (Optional, default "") value added at the beginning of the file

markershadow.title: markerShadow
markershadow.description: Returns if the marker is drawn with shadow enabled.

setmarkershadow.title: setMarkerShadow
setmarkershadow.description: Sets the shadow property of given marker.

args.name: shadowState
args.desc: true to enable the shadow, false to disable it

setmarkershadowlocal.title: setMarkerShadowLocal
setmarkershadowlocal.description: Sets the shadow property of given marker.

args.name: shadowState
args.desc: true to enable the shadow, false to disable it

diag_allmissioneventhandlers.title: diag_allMissionEventHandlers
diag_allmissioneventhandlers.description: Returns an array with all mission event handlers.

diag_dynamicsimulationend.title: diag_dynamicSimulationEnd
diag_dynamicsimulationend.description:
Ends dynamic simulation data gathering and writes collected data into given file. The file is saved in the Arma 3 installation folder.
 styledisplay: block// Example output.
Enabled time (in % of collection time)       Subject name
  1.$                                          O Bravo 1-5
