bis_fnc_orbatconfigpreview.description: Opens config viewer and shows CfgORBAT. Used to retrieve CfgOrbat data

bis_fnc_strategicmapopen.title: BIS_fnc_strategicMapOpen
bis_fnc_strategicmapopen.description:
Creates a strategic map.
File:A3 strategicMap.jpg600

syntaxes.code: [display, pos, missions, ORBATs, markers, images, weather, night, scale, simulation, label, missionName, missionIcon] call BIS_fnc_strategicMapOpen

args.name: display
args.desc: parent display. When empty, mission display is used.

args.name: pos: Array format Position - default view position in format [x,y,y] or [x,y]

missions: Array - list of missions, each Array in format:
* 0: Position - 2D or 3D position of mission
* 1: Code - Expression executed when user clicks on mission icon
* 2: String - Mission name
* 3: String - Short description
* 4: String - Name of mission's player
* 5: String - Path to overview image
* 6: Number - size multiplier for overview image
* 7: Array - parameters for on-click action. Can be accessed in code with  inline_this # 9

ORBATs: Array - list of ORBAT, each Array in format:
* 0: Array format Position - 2D or 3D position
* 1: Config - preview CfgORBAT group
* 2: Config - topmost displayed CfgORBAT group
* 3: Array of Strings - list of allowed tags
* 4: String - name of mission's player
* 5: Number - maximum number of displayed tiers
markers: Array of strings - list of markers revealed in strategic map (will be hidden when map is closed)

images: Array - list of custom images, each Array in format:
* 0: String - texture path
* 1: Array format Color (RGBA)
* 2: Array format Position - image position
* 3: Number - image width in meters
* 4: Number - image height in meters
* 5: Number - image angle in degrees
* 6: String - text displayed next to the image
* 7: Boolean - true to show shadow
weather
args.desc: overcast, from 0 - 1, where 1 means cloudy weather

args.name: night
args.desc: true for night version of strategic map (darker with blue tone)

args.name: scale
args.desc: default map scale coeficient (1 is automatic scale)

args.name: simulation: Boolean] - (Optional, default false true to enable simulation while the map is opened
label
args.desc: (Optional, default "Select a mission") bottom bar action label text

args.name: missionName
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show icon label as a mission name

args.name:
missionIcon: String - (Optional, default "\A3\Ui_f\data\Map\GroupIcons\badge_rotate_%1_gs.paa") Path to mission icon texture 
* %1 - Animation frame from 0-6 (optional)
* %2 - Index from 1-9 (optional)
target: Config or Position - Either config path to target group, or absolute position in format [x,y,z] or [x,y]

bis_fnc_setunitinsignia.title: BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia

bis_fnc_bleedtickets.title: BIS_fnc_bleedTickets
bis_fnc_bleedtickets.description: Function that handles bleeding ticket system. Tickets are set beforehand using BIS_fnc_respawnTickets.

args.name: sides
args.desc: (Optional, default All sides) Array of effected sides

args.name: dominanceRatio
args.desc: (Optional, default 0.5) Dominance ratio, values from 0 to 1. Determines how much of a sector a side must hold for bleeding tickets to start

args.name: bleedingAmount
args.desc: (Optional, default 3) Amount of tickets bled every step. Optional parameter

args.name: bleedingDelay
args.desc: (Optional, default 5) Delay in seconds between every bleeding step

returns.desc: Returns "@test" for a task with the variable name "test".

args.name:
owner: String - Owner of the task.(Optional) Can be:
* Boolean - true to useall playable units
* Object- specific object
* Group - all objects in the group
* Side - all objects of the given side
* Array - collection of above types
removeFromJIP
args.desc: true to also remove task from JIP queue, default false

args.name: taskID
args.desc: ID or name of the task

returns.desc: Returns true if task state is either "SUCCEEDED", "FAILED" or "CANCELED". Returns false for all other states and if task does not exist

syntaxes.code: [owner, taskID, description, destination, state, priority, showNotification, type, visibleIn3D] call BIS_fnc_taskCreate

args.name:
owner: Task owner(s)
* Boolean - true to set task of all playable units
* Object - set task of a specific object
* Group - set tasks of all objects in the group
* Side - set tasks of all objects of the given side
* Array - collection of above types

taskID:
* String - Task ID
* Array - In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]

description:
* Array - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"] - "marker" is depreciated, functionally does nothing
* String - CfgTaskDescriptions class name, if empty string is used then CfgTaskDescriptions is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID

destination (Optional): Task destination
* Object - Use objNull to set no position
* Array - can be one of:
** format Position
** [target, precision] (as used by setSimpleTaskTarget)
*** target: Object
*** precision: Boolean - false to use owner's knowledge of target, true to force display even if target is unknown to owner

state: (Optional, default "CREATED") Task state. Can be:
* String - can be one of following:
** "CREATED"
** "ASSIGNED"
** "AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
** "SUCCEEDED"
** "FAILED"
** "CANCELED"
* Boolean - true to set the task as current
* Number
** 0 or less for false
** > 0 as true
priority
args.desc: (Optional) priority. When the current task is completed, the system selects the one with the largest priority >= 0. To avoid auto assignment of that task, give it a priority of -1.

args.name: showNotification
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to show notification, false to disable it

args.name: type
args.desc: (Optional, default "") task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used

args.name: visibleIn3D
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to make task always visible in 3D

returns.desc: Either position in format [x,y,z], or [object,precision] as used by setSimpleTaskTarget command

bis_fnc_prepareao.title: BIS_fnc_prepareAO
bis_fnc_prepareao.description:
Spawns random patrols and/or vehicles in trigger areas with proper names. Side selected in the triggers "Activation" listbox will determine the side of the spawned asset(s).

Trigger names (a.k.a "Trigger text", not "Variable Name") defines the kind of spawn. Supported trigger names are:
* GEN_infantry: spawns random infantry patrol with sentry waypoints (NOTE: only circular triggers are supported, min. axis should be 500m)
* GEN_patrolVeh: spawns a random vehicle. If a civilian unit is synchronized with the trigger, its waypoint will be used by the spawned vehicle
You can specify the vehicle type by typing one of the following into the trigger's "On Act." field:
** car
** apc
** tank
* GEN_ammo: spawns a random number of ammoboxes. You can get and idea of the shape this composition will have by making this trigger rectangular with dimensions 5m x 1m. You can also specify the amount of crates spawned by using min. and max. Timeout values (supported range is 1 to 6 crates).
* GEN_civilCar: spawns a random empty civil car

args.name: density
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) enemy presence density index used for random footpatrols

bis_fnc_arsenal.title: BIS_fnc_arsenal
bis_fnc_arsenal.description: Function used for the Virtual Arsenal. The function features four different modes, each mode comes with its own parameters.

args.name:
mode: String - mode, can be one of:
* "Open" - opens the Arsenal
* "Preload" - preloads item configs, without preloading the configs are parsed the first time it is opened
* "AmmoboxInit" - adds a virtual ammobox. Action to access the Arsenal will be added automatically to all clients
* "AmmoboxExit" - remove virtual ammobox

params: Anything - mode parameters:
* "Open": [full, cargo, center]
** full: Boolean - (Optional, default false) true to open full Arsenal with all items available
** cargo: Object to use as the cargo carrier (cargo is added with the BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo functions)
** center: Object whose arsenal will be modified
* "Preload": no parameters
* "AmmoboxInit": [ammobox, allItems, condition]
** ammobox: Object - Object which should get a virtual ammobox
** allItems: Boolean - (Optional, default false) true to make all items available
** condition: Code - (Optional, default  inline{ true }) condition for the Arsenal to be accessible. Available arguments are the same as in addAction's condition parameter:
*** _target: Object - object to which the action is attached or, if the object is a unit inside of vehicle, the vehicle
*** _this: Object - caller person to whom the action is shown (or not depending on condition)
*** _originalTarget: Object - original object to which the action is attached, regardless if the object/unit is in a vehicle or not
* "AmmoboxExit": [ammobox]
** ammobox: Object - the object to which the Arsenal was added

bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.title: BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo
bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.description:
Add virtual items to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the Arsenal.
If parameters 4 and 5 are used this function can replace BIS_fnc_addVirtualWeaponCargo, BIS_fnc_addVirtualMagazineCargo and BIS_fnc_addVirtualBackpackCargo.

syntaxes.code: [object, itemClasses, addItemsGlobal, arsenal, mode, itemType] call BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo

args.name: object
args.desc: object to which items will be added

args.name: itemClasses: Boolean, String or Array of Strings - item classes
addItemsGlobal
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to add items globally

args.name: arsenal
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to add Arsenal action

args.name:
mode: Number - (Optional, default 1) defines what the function will do, can be:
* -1 - remove given items
*  0 - return current content
*  1 - add given items

itemType: Number - (Optional, default 0) define the item type, can be:
* 0 - items
* 1 - weapons
* 2 - magazines
* 3 - backpacks

bis_fnc_target.title: BIS_fnc_target
bis_fnc_target.description:
File:A3 BIS_fnc_target.jpg300Target Board display
Handles the shooting targets in the Bootcamp DLC, statistics, animation, etc. (targets such as )

{! classwikitable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed stylemin-width: 50em
!+ Action/Parameter Table
! Action (String)
! Parameters (Array) arguments
!-
! initializeInitializes the target and sets it to the "up" position 
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! terminateDoesn't do anything !! 

!-
! animateAnimate the object to the given position ("up" or "down")
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* position: String - "up" or "down" (default)

!-
! getAnimationPhaseReturn Value: Number - 0 (up) or 1 (down) depending on current state
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! getAnimationPhaseStringReturn Value: String - "up" or "down" depending on current state
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
!getAnimatedSelectionReturn Value: String - the name of the "animatedSelection" from object config
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! hitHandles the hit event to animate the target down and up again
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* unit: Object - Unit which shot the target
* damage: Number - Amount of damage done to the target

!-
! hitPartHandles the hit event and stores the data
!
* partsList: Array - Contains list of all parts which got hit (see HitPart EH format) to format [target, shooter]:
** target: Object - Target object of type 'TargetBootcamp_base_F'
** shooter: Object - Unit which shot the target

!-
! getShooterDataIndexReturn Value: Number - index from Shooter Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShooterDataReturn Value: Array - all data from Shooter Data for specific unit
Format: 
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! setShooterDataSet Shooter Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* data: Array - Shooter Data

!-
! getShotsDataReturn Value: Array - Shots Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotsDataFromTargetsReturn Value: Number - total amount of shots hit
!
* targets: Array of Object - List of target objects of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotsDataWithFilterReturn Value: Array - Shot Data after custom filter
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* filter: String - One of "time", "distance", "weapon" or "direct"
* code: Code - Custom code to validate the shot. _this is the value of filtered data

!-
! setShotsDataSet Shots Data for specific unit
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target
* data: Array - Shots Data

!-
! getShootersDataReturn Value: Array - full Shooters Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! setShootersDataSet full Shooters Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* data: Array - Shooter Data

!-
! resetShootersDataRemove all data from Shooters Data array
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! getShooterTemplateReturn Value: Array - template for Shooter Data
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! getShotTemplateReturn Value: Array - template for Shot Data (see HitPart EH format)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* shooter: Object - Unit who shot the target
* projectile: Object - ("_bullet" not used)
* position: Array format Position - ("_position" not used)
* velocity: Array - ("_velocity" not used)
* selection: Array - ("_selection" not used)
* ammo: Array - ("_ammo" not used)
* vector: Array - ("_direction" not used)
* radius: Array - ("_radius" not used)
* surfaceType: String - ("_surface" not used)
* isDirect: Boolean - true if object was directly hit, false if it was hit by indirect/splash damage.

!-
! getShooterByUidReturn Value: Object - corresponding shooter unit
!
* uid: String - Player UID of unit who shot the target

!-
! uiOpenOpens the Target Board display
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! uiOpenToAllOpens the Target Board display for all connected players
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

!-
! uiOnLoadTriggered when display is opened (internal)
!
* display: Display

!-
! uiFillTableTriggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooters Data (internal)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* control: Control - "_listBox"

!-
! uiFillTableRowTriggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooter Data (internal)
!
* target: Object - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"
* control: Control - "_listBox"
* data: Array - Shooter Data
!}

bis_fnc_modulerespawnvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_moduleRespawnVehicle
bis_fnc_modulerespawnvehicle.description:
/*

	Description:
	Set vehicle respawn, compatible both with SP and MP.

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - vehicle
		1:
			NUMBER - respawn delay in seconds (default is 0)
			BOOL - true to remove vehicle respawn (further params are ignored), false to check if the vehicle is marked for respawn
		2: NUMBER - how long until the vehicle is automatically respawned after its crew leaves it (default is -1, i.e., disabled)
		3: NUMBER - number of time the vehicle can be respawned (default is -1, i.e., unlimited)
		4: CODE - code executed upon respawn. Passed arguments are [<newVehicle>,<oldVehicle>]. The old vehicle is deleted only after this code is completed.
		5: POSITION - type of respawn position:
			0 = where it started
			1 = where it was destroyed
			2 = on vehicle's side respawn marker (e.g., "respawn_vehicle_west")
			3 = on BLUFOR respawn marker
			4 = on OPFOR respawn marker
			5 = on Independent respawn marker
			6 = on Civilian respawn marker
			7 = on side respawn marker of unit which destroyed the vehicle
		6: NUMBER - position selection type (0 = random, 1 = newest, 2 = oldest)
		7: NUMBER - type of old vehicle deletion (0 = don't delete, 1 = delete, 2 = delete with an explosion effect)
		8: BOOL - true to show notifcation when the vehicle is respawned

	Returns:
	BOOL
*/

args.name:
logic: Object - the logic. Possible setVariable parameter:
* "value": Number - (Optional, default 0) wanted damage, in range 0..1
* "bodypart": String - (Optional, default "0") setHitPointDamage hitpoint name
vehicles: Array of Objects - list of vehicles
isActivated
args.desc: (Optional, default true) if true, the fuel is set

returns.desc: true when done, even if isActivated equals false

Covers the map except for a defined area. This function was designed to be used by the Modules framework, but it can also be used without the module. The effect does not move with the centerObject.
It is essential for the function to work that centerObject has the variable objectArea defined.
 inlinecenterObject setVariable ["objectArea", [sizeX, sizeY, rotation]]
* centerObject Object - Object which is used as center
* sizeX: Number -  Length in x in meters
* sizeY: Number - Length in y in meters
* rotation: Number - Rotation of the rectangle in degree
File:BIS_fnc_moduleCoverMap.jpg500

bis_fnc_showcuratorfeedbackmessage.title: BIS_fnc_showCuratorFeedbackMessage
bis_fnc_showcuratorfeedbackmessage.description:
Show feedback message when illegal operation is attempted in curator interface.

{! classvalign-top
! stylepadding-right: 2em 
Interface
* 000: Cannot exit Zeus interface
* 003: Cannot move camera outside the camera area
Placing
* 101: Placing objects is not available
* 102: Insufficient resources
* 103: Selected position is not in an editing area
Placing waypoints
* 201: Placing waypoints is not available
* 206: No objects, groups or waypoints selected
Editing
* 301: Editing entities is not available
* 303: Selected position is not inside editing area
* 304: One of the selected entities is not in an editing area
* 307: Players cannot be edited
* 308: The vehicle is full
!
Deleting
* 401: Deleting entities is not available
* 404: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area
* 405: One of selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it
* 407: Players cannot be deleted
 Destroying
* 501: Destroying entities is not available
* 504: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area
* 505: One of the selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it
* 506: No objects selected
* 507: Players cannot be destroyed
Syncing
* 609: At least one AI unit has to be present in synchronization
* 610: Cannot change player side (typo: "changle")
!}

args.name: messageInfo: Number or String - error ID, or text message to be displayed

/*

	Description:
	Generate spreadsheet with object classes and copy it to clipboard.
	The table will generate export code to be used in BIS_fnc_curatorObjectRegisteredTable

	Parameter(s):
		0 (Optional): ARRAY of STRINGs - supported addons (classes from CfgPatches). When empty, all preloaded addons will be added. Use empty string to export just the cost calculation.
		1 (Optional): STRING - format, can be "ods" or "xls"
		2 (Optional): STRING - name of sheet with cost calculation. When empty, the calculation will be inserted on top of the table
		3 (Optional): ARRAY of SIDEs or NUMBERs - filter only objects of listed sides or side IDs. Supported sides are west, east, resistance, civilian, sideUnknown and sideLogic
		4 (Optional): CODE - condition for class to be listed. Config path to the class is passed as an argument (default: {true})

*/

		2 (Optional): NUMBER - number of added challenges (default: 3)
		3 (Optional): CODE - condition for challenges to remain active {default: true}
		4 (optional):
			CODE or [CODE,STRING] - code executed upon completing all challenges and reward description
			Arguments passed to the code are:
				0: OBJECT - curator
				1: NUMBER - number of previously completed challenges by given curator
				2: STRING - parent task ID
		5 (Optional): STRING - parent task ID

	Returns:
	STRING - ID of parent task under which all challenge tasks are
*/

bis_fnc_initintelobject.title: BIS_fnc_initIntelObject
bis_fnc_initintelobject.description:
This function sets up an object as intel retrievable by the players by adding a "Take Intel" addAction to it.
When a player uses the action, they will play an animation to pick the object up and the object will be deleted from the mission.
The player and any defined recipients will then receive a diary entry which can contain a title, description and picture.
The diary entry will also contain a marker shortcut showing where the intel was found.
This function is similar to placing an intel object as Zeus, but the Zeus interface provides some extra options like:
* Which sides can interact with the action
* The picture, title and description used in the diary entry

When using this function from script there are several variables that need to be set up to acquire the same results (see the examples below).
Without this extra setup the functionality provided is minimal and only includes:
* The "Take Intel" action on the object
* The object can be picked up by a player from any side
* When picked up it will have no title or description and the picture will be a default exclamation mark
* The diary entry will only be given to the person who picked it up

There are some optional features of intel objects that can be used:
* The diary entry's description can be further enhanced by using the supported tags found on the createDiaryRecord page.
* There is also a scripted eventhandler called "IntelObjectFound" that can be registered  on the intel object. The event provides the parameters [object, caller] where object is the intel object and caller the person who picked it up.
* A Zeus who has the intel object registered as a curator editable object can also receive feedback that the intel has been picked up if the scripted eventhandler called "intelObjectFound" was registered on the curator module. The event provides the parameters [zeus, caller, object] where zeus is the curator module, caller the person who picked it up and object is the intel object.
The usage of these scripted event handlers is shown in .

args.name: object
args.desc: Object to place intel action on

bis_fnc_respawnrounds.description:
/*

	When "Rounds" respawn is used by only one side, wait until all its players are dead.

	Parameter(s):
		BOOL - true to force round end
		SIDE - use any side to return side affected by round system (based on description.ext respawnTemplates settings)
		ARRAY - empty array to return if a round is still on (players of more than one involved faction are alive)
*/

bis_fnc_displaycolorget.description:
Loads custom color settings from CfgUIDefault.

If variables are not stored in profileNamespace yet, the function will declare them.

{!
! stylevertical-align: top; width: 50% 
 A3 
{! classwikitable
!+  v1.99
! Tag !! Variable !! Description
!-
! rowspan5  "IGUI"
!"BCG_RGB" !! Backgrounds
!-
! "TEXT_RGB" !! Active Elements
!-
! "WARNING_RGB" !! Warnings
!-
! "ERROR_RGB" !! Errors
!-
! "TACTPING_RGB" !! Tactical Ping
!-
! rowspan2  "GUI"
! "BCG_RGB" !! Backgrounds
!-
! "TITLETEXT_RGB" !! Title Text
!-
! rowspan5  "Map"
! "BLUFOR" !! BLUFOR
!-
! "OPFOR" !! OPFOR
!-
! "Independent" !! Independent
!-
! "Civilian" !! Civilian
!-
! "Unknown" !! Unknown
!-
! rowspan2  "Subtitles"
! "Background" !! Subtitle background
!-
! "Text" !! Subtitle text
!}

! stylevertical-align: top; width: 50% 
 TKOH 
{! classwikitable
!+  v1.00
! Tag !! Variable !! Description
!-
! rowspan2  "IGUI"
!"IGUI_TEXT_RGB" !! HUD color RGB
!-
! "IGUI_TEXT_COLOR" !! HUD color RGBA
!-
! rowspan5  "GUI"

!-

!-
! "GUI_BCG_MEDIUM_RGB" !! button background RGB (darker version of GUI_BCG_RGB)
!-
! "GUI_BCG_MEDIUM_COLOR" !! button background RGBA
!-
! "GUI_BCG_ACTIVE_RGB" !! active button background color (e.g. focused buttons) RGB
!}

!}

The function also calls  and  Scripted Event Handlers in missionNamespace - see BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler and Arma 3: Scripted Event Handlers.

args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to keep original video aspect ratio (background color will fill the void), false to stretch

bis_fnc_locations.title: BIS_fnc_locations
bis_fnc_locations.description:
Creates or registers location logics (used in various modules, like Ambient Civilians, Ambient Civilian Vehicles or Warfare 2).

Upon registering, function will set following variables into location logic's variable space:
* "class" - unique class of location (either  or )
* "name" - name of location from config or setName command. If none is defined, class is used
* "type" - config type
* "neighbors" - config defined neighbor locations

If you are registering currently existing object and some of variables above is already stored in it, it will not be replaced.

args.name: types: String or Array of Strings
objects: Array of Objects or Locations - list of specific locations to be registered

bis_fnc_rotatevector2d.title: BIS_fnc_rotateVector2D
bis_fnc_rotatevector2d.description: This function returns a 2D vector rotated a specified number of degrees around the origin.

bis_fnc_spawngroup.title: BIS_fnc_spawnGroup
bis_fnc_spawngroup.description: Function which handles the spawning of a dynamic group of characters.  The composition of the group can be passed to the function.  Alternatively a number can be passed and the function will spawn that amount of characters with a random type.

syntaxes.code: [position, side, toSpawn, relPositions, ranks, skillRange, ammoRange, randomControls, azimuth, precisePos, maxVehicles] call BIS_fnc_spawnGroup

args.name: position: Array format Position - group's starting position

toSpawn - Can be one of:
* Array - list of character types
* Number - amount of characters to spawn
* Config - CfgGroups entry
relPositions: Array of Positions (Optional, default []) a list of relative positions
ranks: Array of Strings/Numbers - (Optional, default []) ranks (see BIS_fnc_setRank) - must be same size as toSpawn's array
skillRange: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default []) skill range format [min, max]
ammoRange: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default []) ammunition range (0..1) format [min, max]

randomControls: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default [-1, 1]) to format [minUnits, chance]:
* minUnits: Number - (Optional, default -1) amount of mandatory units
* chance: Number - (Optional, default -1) spawn chance for remaining units in range 0..1
precisePos
args.desc: (Optional, default true) forces precise position placement

bis_fnc_spawnvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_spawnVehicle
bis_fnc_spawnvehicle.description: Function to spawn a certain vehicle type with all crew (including turrets). The vehicle can either become part of an existing group or create a new group.

args.name: position: Array format Position - desired position
sideOrGroup: Side or Group - side or existing group

args.name: layerName
args.desc: Layer name. Parent function name is used automatically when param is nil.

bis_fnc_diagkeylayout.title: BIS_fnc_diagKeyLayout
bis_fnc_diagkeylayout.description:
/*

	Description:
	Exports default key layout to wiki template.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: STRING - category, can be one of following
		"" - all controls in game
		"All"
		"BasicInfantryControls"
		"Car"
		"Air"
		"Helicopter"
		"Submarine"
		"Buldozer"
		"UserActions"
	_this select 1: STRING - selection method, can be one of following
		"" - single tap
		"double" - double tap
		"LCtrl" - with left control pressed
		"RCtrl" - with right control pressed
		"LShift" - with left shift pressed
		"RShift" - with right shift pressed

	Returns:
	STRING - wiki export text (also copied to clipboard)
*/

bis_fnc_error.title: BIS_fnc_error
bis_fnc_error.description:
Log error message and display it (bottom of the UI). If it is called from a function, it'll include the function name before your content.
Output is: "profileName/log: ERROR: <your content>"

File:BIS_fnc_error.png750An error logged by BIS_fnc_error.

bis_fnc_exportcfgvehicles.title: BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehicles
bis_fnc_exportcfgvehicles.description: Export list of objects for Community Wiki (Assets).

args.name:
mode: String - mode, can be one of:
* "config" - copy the objects table to clipboard
* "screenshots" - create objects one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "Render" terrain.
* "screenshotsTest" - create objects one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)
sides: Array of Sides - only objects of these sides will be used
classes: Arrayof Strings- list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used
useAI
args.desc: true to use only AI units (soldiers, vehicles), false to use empty ones

args.name: arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default []) additional format arguments to fill notification's fields (, , , , )

syntaxes.code: [classes, duration1, condition1, duration2, condition2, showing, onlyFullHint, onlyOnce, useSound] call BIS_fnc_advHint

args.name: classes
args.desc: array in format ["hint main class", "hint class"]

args.name: duration1
args.desc: (Optional, default 15) duration of short hint in seconds

args.name: condition1
args.desc: (Optional, default "") condition for hiding the short hint

args.name: duration2
args.desc: (Optional, default 35) duration of full hint in seconds

args.name: condition2
args.desc: (Optional, default "") condition for hiding the full hint

args.name: showing
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true shows hint even if tutorial hints are disabled in game settings

args.name: onlyFullHint
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true shows full hint without using of short hint

args.name: onlyOnce
args.desc: (Optional, default false) show the hint in mission only once (true) or multiple times (false)

args.name: useSound
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true plays a sound when the hint is opened

bis_fnc_addcommmenuitem.title: BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem
bis_fnc_addcommmenuitem.description:
Add communication menu to the given unit.

The item will be available in the Communication menu and visualized in comm menu icon area.

syntaxes.code: [owner, itemClass, textArguments, expressionArguments, notification] call BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem

args.name: owner
args.desc: object to which the item belongs to

args.name: textArguments
args.desc: (Optional) additional info to display in the  attribute.  will be replaced by the first array element,  with the second and so on.

args.name: expressionArguments
args.desc: (Optional) similar to textArguments, just this time in the  attribute.

args.name: notification
args.desc: (Optional) notification class from . Empty string will disabled the notification.

bis_fnc_removecommmenuitem.title: BIS_fnc_removeCommMenuItem
bis_fnc_removecommmenuitem.description: Remove an item from the communication menu.

args.name: owner
args.desc: object to which the item belongs to

args.name: itemID
args.desc: item ID returned by BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem command

returns.desc: true when the item was removed

bis_fnc_loop.title: BIS_fnc_loop
bis_fnc_loop.description: Loop stacked code/function with timing and conditional control. Code and conditions are executed in non-scheduled environment.

args.name:
action: String - can be one of:
* "initialize" - Initializes game loop (not required as internal AUTO_INITIALIZE variable is set to true)
* "terminate" - Terminates game loop (required as internal AUTO_TERMINATE variable is not set to true)
* "itemAdd" - Adds an item to loop
* "itemRemove" - Remove item from loop with id "uniqueId"
* "onEachFrame" - internally used by "initialize"
* "itemExecute" - internally used by "onEachFrame"

parameters: Array - used with "itemAdd" and "itemRemove" action ("itemRemove" only takes id):
* id: String - loop unique id
* code: Code or String - code to be executed
* timer: Number - (Optional, default 0) delay between executions
* timerType: String - (Optional, default "seconds") can be "seconds" or "frames"
* conditionStart: Code - (Optional, default  inline{ true }) will wait until the condition is met to start the code
* conditionEnd:  Code - (Optional, default  inline{ false }) stops the loop as soon as the ending condition is met (after the end of code)
* executeOnce: Boolean - (Optional, default false)

bis_fnc_runlater.title: BIS_fnc_runLater
bis_fnc_runlater.description: Stack code/function that should be run later, after some time/frames or/and custom condition. Internally calls BIS_fnc_loop.

syntaxes.code: [id, code, timer, timerType, condition] call BIS_fnc_runLater

args.name: code: Code or String - Code/function that is executed later
timer
args.desc: The timer value (can be in seconds or frames)

args.name: condition
args.desc: The custom condition, code is only executed if timer is validated and condition is met

bis_fnc_buildingpositions.title: BIS_fnc_buildingPositions
bis_fnc_buildingpositions.description: Get all available positions within a building or structure.

bis_fnc_isbuildingenterable.title: BIS_fnc_isBuildingEnterable
bis_fnc_isbuildingenterable.description: Check whether a building or structure has available positions defined within model.

bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.description:
Stacks an event handler.  All event handlers accept user arguments, which are passed to the EH code in  variable. If the EH has own params returned in  variable as well, user arguments are appended to the end of  array. Note that if you try to add an empty EH, i.e. with empty code, it will simply be ignored.

{! classwikitable
!+ Supported Event Handlers
! Scripted Event Handler
! Mission EH Equivalent
! Description
!-
! "onEachFrame"
! EachFrame
! 
!-
! "onPlayerConnected"
! PlayerConnected
! rowspan2 Special variables , , , ,  are provided and are available in  array as well.
params ["_id", "_uid", "_name", "_jip", "_owner"];
!-
! "onPlayerDisconnected"
! PlayerDisconnected
!-
! "onMapSingleClick"
! MapSingleClick
! Special variables , , ,  are provided and are available in  array as well.
params ["_units", "_pos", "_alt", "_shift"];
!-
! "onPreloadStarted"
! PreloadStarted
! 
!-
! "onPreloadFinished"
! PreloadFinished
! 
!}

args.name: id
args.desc: custom id, a unique identifier. Adding same type of EH with the same id will overwrite existing

args.name: event
args.desc: event handler name, see description for supported EHs

args.name: code: Code or String. The String is treated as function name
arguments: Array of Anything - arguments to make available in code in  array

returns.desc: custom id on success or "" on failure

bis_fnc_removestackedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_removestackedeventhandler.description: Removes a stacked event handler with specified custom id.

args.name: key
args.desc: custom id, a unique identifier, also returned by BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler

args.name: event
args.desc: event handler name, see BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler fr supported event handlers

returns.desc: true on success, false on failure

bis_fnc_call.title: BIS_fnc_call
bis_fnc_call.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

bis_fnc_spawn.title: BIS_fnc_spawn
bis_fnc_spawn.description: Execute given code with or without parameter.

bis_fnc_objectvar.title: BIS_fnc_objectVar
bis_fnc_objectvar.description: Return a unique object variable. The variable is preserved after unit respawn.

args.name: varNameRoot
args.desc: (Optional, default "bis_o") - variable name root - a number will be added behind it

bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.title: BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.description:
Add a respawn inventory for respawn menu.
Available loadouts are defined in CfgRespawnInventory.

args.name:
target: Receiver of the respawn loadout
* Namespace - use missionNamespace to add the loadout to everyone
* Side
* Group
* Object

inventoryParams: Array or String
* String - CfgRespawnInventory class
* Array - format [class, number, limit]
** class: String - CfgRespawnInventory class
** number: Number - Number of players who can use this inventory (-1 = no limit, default)
** limit: Number - Limit for role assigned to given loadout (-1 = no limit, default) 
*** Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit.
*** If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used.

bis_fnc_removerespawninventory.title: BIS_fnc_removeRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_removerespawninventory.description: Remove a respawn inventory added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object

bis_fnc_addrespawnposition.title: BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition
bis_fnc_addrespawnposition.description: Add a respawn position for the  Respawn Menu.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object - receiver of the respawn position. Use missionNamespace to add the position to everyone

position: Array, Object or String
* Array - format PositionATL
* Object - specific object. When some crew positions are available and unlocked, players will be respawned on them, otherwise they will appear around the object.
* String - marker name
name
args.desc: (Optional) respawn name, can be text or link to localization key

bis_fnc_removerespawnposition.title: BIS_fnc_removeRespawnPosition
bis_fnc_removerespawnposition.description: Remove a respawn position added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition.

args.name: target: Namespace, Side, Group or Object

bis_fnc_respawntickets.title: BIS_fnc_respawnTickets
bis_fnc_respawntickets.description:
Manage respawn tickets used by Tickets respawn template.

When player dies, number of tickets is decreased by 1. The most local tickets are always used. Example: When you first add tickets to player's side, they will be affected. If you later define tickets also to player's group, they will completely replace the side tickets.

When player runs out of the tickets, his respawn is disabled. If you use also EndMission respawn template, the mission will automatically end once tickets in all name spaces are exhausted.

args.name:
target: Receiver of the respawn tickets. Can be of type:
* Namespace - use missionNamespace to set/get global tickets available for everyone
* Side
* Group
* Object
tickets
args.desc: added respawn tickets. When missing or set to 0, number of tickets won't be affected, which means you can use the function to simply get amount of tickets.

args.name: dynamicTarget
args.desc: when true, set/get tickets based on the target. target must be an Object.

returns.desc: remaining tickets in all name spaces

args.name: input: Side or Number - either side or side ID

bis_fnc_settask.title: BIS_fnc_setTask
bis_fnc_settask.description:
Set task parameters.
Create the task when it doesn't exist.

syntaxes.code: [taskId, target, description, (destination, state, priority, showNotification, isGlobal, type, visibleIn3D)] call BIS_fnc_setTask

args.name:
taskId:
String - Task ID
Array -  In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]

target: Task owner(s)
Boolean - true to set task of all playable units
Object - set task of a specific object
Group - set tasks of all objects in the group
Side - set tasks of all objects of the given side
Array - collection of above types

description:
Array - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"]
String - CfgTaskDescriptions class name, if empty string is used then CfgTaskDescriptions is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID

destination (Optional): Task destination
Object
Array - either position in format [x,y,z], or [object,precision] as used by setSimpleTaskTarget command

state (Optional): Task state
String - can be one of following:
"CREATED"
"ASSIGNED"
"AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
"SUCCEEDED"
"FAILED"
"CANCELED"
Boolean - true to set the task as current
priority (Optional): Number - priority. When a current task is completed, system select a next one with the larges priority >= 0
showNotification (Optional): Boolean - true to show notification (default), false to disable it
isGlobal (Optional): Boolean - true to set task globally (default), false to set it only locally
type (Optional): String - task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used
visibleIn3D (Optional): Boolean - true to make task always visible in 3D (default: false)

bis_fnc_param.title: BIS_fnc_param
bis_fnc_param.description: Load a script parameter. See Arma 3: Functions Library for detailed description.

syntaxes.code: [input, index, defaultValue, dataTypes, requiredCount] call BIS_fnc_param

args.name: defaultValue
args.desc: (Optional, default Nothing) default param (used when param is missing or of wrong type).You can overload default value by declaring variable BIS_fnc_<functionName>_<index> in Namespace where BIS_fnc_param is called from.BIS_fnc_paramIn is a variant of the function with overloading disabled.

args.name: dataTypes
args.desc: (Optional, default Anything) list of allowed type examples (e.g. ["",[],0,objNull])

args.name: requiredCount: Number or Array - (Optional) if value is Array, checks if it has required number of elements

bis_fnc_codeperformance.title: BIS_fnc_codePerformance
bis_fnc_codeperformance.description:
File:BIS_fnc_codePerformance.png300
Measures how much time it takes to execute given expression.
Results may vary based on overall performance; use this function to compare alternative scripting approaches rather than to measure specific values.
Upon function execution, window with results is opened. The user then has a choice to copy the result into clipboard or not.
This function is using diag_codePerformance command.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default []) arguments to pass into the code

args.name: display
args.desc: (Optional, default  inlinefindDisplay 46) display in which the message window with results will be opened. Use displayNull to disable the window

returns.desc: Average execution time of the expression

bis_fnc_endmission.title: BIS_fnc_endMission
bis_fnc_endmission.description: Ends mission with the specified ending. Always ends with a 4 seconds black out effect.

syntaxes.code: [nextMission, endingId, displayText, isSuccess, code] call BIS_fnc_endMission

args.name: displayText
args.desc: (Optional, default "") text displayed on black out

args.name: isSuccess
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to endMission, false to failMission

args.name: successCode
args.desc: code executed right before mission ends, only if isSuccess is set to true

bis_fnc_mp.title: BIS_fnc_MP
bis_fnc_mp.description: Send function for remote execution (and executes locally if conditions are met).

syntaxes.code: [params, functionName, target, isSpawn, isPersistent] call BIS_fnc_MP

args.name: target
args.desc: (Optional, default everyone) function will be executed only where unit is local

args.name: isSpawn
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for calling function using 'spawn' command (otherwise 'call' is used)

args.name: isPersistent
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for persistent call (will be called now and for every JIP client)

bis_fnc_missionflow.title: BIS_fnc_missionFlow
bis_fnc_missionflow.description: This function is automatically run in post-init by a CfgFunctions declaration. If the mission contains a  file, it will be loaded, otherwise an empty, default one will be used.

bis_fnc_showmissionstatus.title: BIS_fnc_showMissionStatus
bis_fnc_showmissionstatus.description: Show mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

bis_fnc_setmissionstatusslot.title: BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot
bis_fnc_setmissionstatusslot.description: Set  a slot for mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

syntaxes.code: [id, text, texture, color, fade, position, barHeight] call BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot

args.name: id: Number  - slot ID. Use -1 to assign it automatically
fade
args.desc: slot fade, 0 is fully visible, 0 hidden

args.name: position: Array in Position format - position top which camera moves after clicking on the slot
barHeight
args.desc: slot progress bar height in range <0;1>

bis_fnc_configextremes.title: BIS_fnc_configExtremes
bis_fnc_configextremes.description:
Scan config paths and return min and max values for each property.
Can be used only for properties of type Number and Array (value is considered to be the geometric mean of all numbers in the array).

args.name: paths: Array of Configs - paths to be scanned.
properties: Array of Strings - class names of properties to be evaluated.
propertyTypes: Array of Booleans - (Optional, default false) whether the property at the respective index should be evaluated and returned as a logarithmic number
propertyDefaults: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default 0) value to be used in cases where the property at the respective index is not defined

returns.desc: [minValues, maxValues] where minValues and maxValues are arrays respective to the properties array.

bis_fnc_didjip.title: BIS_fnc_didJIP
bis_fnc_didjip.description: Return whether or not the local player joined the game while it was already in progress.

bis_fnc_openfieldmanual.title: BIS_fnc_openFieldManual
bis_fnc_openfieldmanual.description:
Opens Field Manual in briefing (SP, MP Server, MP Client) and players's map or journal.
Selects the topic and hint passed as parameters.
Can apply a (search) filter if desired.

args.name: topic
args.desc: Class name of a topic that will be selected in the opened Field Manual (e.g. "Damage")

args.name: hint
args.desc: Class name of a hint that will be selected in the opened Field Manual (e.g. "HitDamage")

args.name: display
args.desc: (Optional) desired parent Display to open the Field Manual display under

args.name: filter
args.desc: (Optional) pre-filled search field filter in the opened Field Manual (recommended to use localized string)

bis_fnc_unitheadgear.title: BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear
bis_fnc_unitheadgear.description: Randomise headgear and facewear of a character.

args.name:
headgear: Boolean, String or Array - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* Boolean - if false, change nothing to the headgear
* String - valid Headgear class or a valid class from Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates
* Array - headgear list with individual probability

facewear: Boolean, String or Array - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* Boolean - if false, change nothing to the facewear
* String - valid facewear class or a valid class from Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates
* Array - facewear list with individual probability

bis_fnc_initvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_initVehicle
bis_fnc_initvehicle.description:
This function changes the textures, animation sources and/or mass of a given vehicle.
Unless explicitly mentioned , the function will restore the initial state of every animation sources of the given object (see ).

args.name:
variant: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to restore default texture source, false to skip texture source change
* Array - texture sources with their probability in format  inline["textureSource1", 0.5, "textureSource2", 0.5]
* String - variant class name - from  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles" or  inlinemissionConfigFile >> "CfgVehicleTemplates" (see CfgVehicleTemplates)
* Number - index of the texture source (same as the old system)

animations: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to restore init phase of every animation sources
* Array - animation sources with their probability in format  inline["animationSource1", 0.5, "animationSource2", 0.5]
* String - variant class name - from  inlineconfigFile >> "CfgVehicles" or  inlinemissionConfigFile >> "CfgVehicleTemplates" (see CfgVehicleTemplates)

mass: (Optional, default false)
* Boolean - true to set the default mass, false to disable the mass change
* Number - mass to remove/add to the vehicle

bis_fnc_sideisfriendly.title: BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly
bis_fnc_sideisfriendly.description: Determines if side B is friendly to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here:  Side relations.

returns.desc: True if side B is friendly to side A.

bis_fnc_sideisenemy.title: BIS_fnc_sideIsEnemy
bis_fnc_sideisenemy.description: Determines if side B is enemy to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here:  Side relations.

returns.desc: True if side B is enemy to side A.

bis_fnc_netid.title: BIS_fnc_netId
bis_fnc_netid.description: Extends MP-only netId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_objectfromnetid.title: BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId
bis_fnc_objectfromnetid.description: Extends MP-only objectFromNetId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_groupfromnetid.title: BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId
bis_fnc_groupfromnetid.description: Extends MP-only groupFromNetId functionality to SP

bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.title: BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.description: Export screenshots of objects for Eden Editor and Community Wiki to  directory. See Arma 3 assets.

syntaxes.code: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons, classes] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews

args.name: duration
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) duration in seconds for which an objects remains on the screen before its screen is captured

args.name:
type: String - (Optional, default "all") can be one of:
* "vehicles" - only characters and vehicles will be used
* "props" - only props will be used
* "all" - all objects will be used
sides: Array of Sides - (Optional, default all sides) list of sides. Only objects of these sides will be used
mods: Array of String - (Optional, default all mods) list of CfgMods classes. Only objects belonging to these mods will be used
addons: Array of String - (Optional, default all addons) list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used
classes: Array of String - (Optional, default all classes) list of CfgVehicles classes. Only these objects will be used

bis_fnc_taskalwaysvisible.title: BIS_fnc_taskAlwaysVisible
bis_fnc_taskalwaysvisible.description: Returns true if task is forced to be always visible (default: false).

returns.desc: Returns true if forced visible, otherwise false

args.name: date: Array  - date in format Date

bis_fnc_exportconfighierarchy.title: BIS_fnc_exportConfigHierarchy
bis_fnc_exportconfighierarchy.description: Export config hierarchy of given config.

bis_fnc_endmissionserver.title: BIS_fnc_endMissionServer
bis_fnc_endmissionserver.description: Ends the mission properly for all players in a multiplayer environment.

args.name:
endType: String - Class name of ending defined in CfgDebriefing.
Can be custom or one of dynamically calculated ones:
* "EveryoneWon" - Show "MISSION COMPLETED" to everyone
* "EveryoneLost" - Show "MISSION FAILED" to everyone
* "SideScore" - Show "YOUR SIDE WON" to side with largest score
* "GroupScore" - Show "YOUR GROUP WON" to group with largest score
* "PlayerScore" - Show "YOU WON" to player with largest score

bis_fnc_ambientanim.title: BIS_fnc_ambientAnim
bis_fnc_ambientanim.description: Play set of ambient animations on given unit. If the unit should react to combat, use BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat instead.

syntaxes.code: [unit, animationSet, equipmentLevel, snapTo, interpolate, attachToLogic] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnim

args.name: unit
args.desc: unit that will play the animations

args.name:
animationSet: String - the animation set to play. Possible values:
{!
!+ stylecaption-side: bottom  some values are missing due to duplicate results, e.g "STAND" does the same as "STAND1"
!- stylevertical-align: top
!
* STAND1
* STAND2
* STAND_U1
* STAND_U2
* STAND_U3
* WATCH
* WATCH2
* GUARD
* LISTEN_BRIEFING
* LEAN_ON_TABLE
* LEAN
!
* SIT_AT_TABLE
* SIT1
* SIT
* SIT3
* SIT_U1
* SIT_U2
* SIT_U3
* SIT_HIGH1
* SIT_HIGH
* SIT_LOW
* SIT_LOW_U
* SIT_SAD1
* SIT_SAD2
!
* KNEEL
* REPAIR_VEH_PRONE
* REPAIR_VEH_KNEEL
* REPAIR_VEH_STAND
* PRONE_INJURED_U1
* PRONE_INJURED_U2
* PRONE_INJURED
* KNEEL_TREAT
* KNEEL_TREAT2
* BRIEFING
* BRIEFING_POINT_LEFT
* BRIEFING_POINT_RIGHT
* BRIEFING_POINT_TABLE
!}

equipmentLevel: String - the equipment level of the unit. Possible values:
* NONE
* LIGHT
* MEDIUM
* FULL
* ASIS
* RANDOM
snapTo
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) the object where the unit will be snapped to

args.name: interpolate
args.desc: (Optional, default false) should try to interpolate into the ambient animation. Works only for some default stances

args.name: attachToLogic
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to attach the unit to the created logic object, forcing it in one position

bis_fnc_removescriptedeventhandler.title: BIS_fnc_removeScriptedEventHandler
bis_fnc_removescriptedeventhandler.description:
Removes scripted event handler with given name and id.
Additionally "ScriptedEventHandlerRemoved" scripted EH is called.

args.name: namespace: Namespace, Object, Group, Location, Boolean, Control or Display - namespace in which handler is saved

returns.desc: true if removed, false if didn't exist

bis_fnc_animateflag.title: BIS_fnc_animateFlag
bis_fnc_animateflag.description: Smoothly animates given flag from current position on the flag pole to the given position. When flag animation is done, the scripted event handler "FlagAnimationDone" is called.

args.name: phase
args.desc: desired animation phase 0...1 (0 - bottom of the flag pole, 1 - top of the flag pole)

args.name:
instant (Optional, default false): 
* Boolean - when true, animation is instant ("FlagAnimationDone" EH is not called in this case)
* Number - animation duration multiplier

bis_fnc_sethitpointdamage.title: BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage
bis_fnc_sethitpointdamage.description: Sets damage to HitPoint with dependency or not.

args.name: damage:  Number - amount of damage to apply

useDependency: Boolean - (Optional, default true) 
* true - distribute damage to dependent HitPoints as well
* false - apply damage to given HitPoint only

bis_fnc_getarea.title: BIS_fnc_getArea
bis_fnc_getarea.description: Extracts area information from trigger, marker, location or array

args.name:
param:
* Object - trigger
* String - marker
* Location - location
* Array - array in format [center, distance] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect]] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect, height]]

returns.desc: in format [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, height]

bis_fnc_admin.title: BIS_fnc_admin
bis_fnc_admin.description: Returns the admin state of a client the function is called on. Complements admin script command and used for self check on a local client.

bis_fnc_findallnestedelements.title: BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements
bis_fnc_findallnestedelements.description: Returns array of paths to all matching elements in deeply nested array, similar to BIS_fnc_findNestedElement but with all occurences.

args.name: target: Position or Object or String - Target position, can be object/position 3D or marker name
mag
args.desc: Magazine (if left empy, first magazine available will be used)

args.name: radius
args.desc: Radius of target area in meters

args.name: rounds
args.desc: Number of rounds to be fired

args.name:
delay: Array or Number - Delay between rounds:
* Array
** 1: Min delay
** 2: Max delay
* Number - Precise delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: Condition to end bombardment before all rounds are fired

args.name: safezone
args.desc: Safezone radius - minimal distance from the target position where shells may be directed at

args.name: position: Position, Object or String - Can be position, an object, or a marker
ammo
args.desc: (Optional, default "G_40mm_HEDP") Ammunition class, nil or empty string to use 40mm HEDP shells

args.name: radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) Radius of the area in metres

args.name:
rounds: Array - (Optional, default [1,20]) Number of rounds to be fired, can be:
* 0: Number of shells
* 1: Number of submunition
delay: Array or Number - (Optional, default 10) Delay between rounds in seconds, can be Number for precise delay or Array to set min and max delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: (Optional, default {}) Condition to end fire support

args.name: altitude
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) Altitude in metres where the submunition will be spawned

args.name: sounds
args.desc: (Optional, default [""]) Strings of sounds to be played on the incoming submunition

syntaxes.code: [target, ammo, radius, rounds, delay, conditionEnd, safezone, alt, speed, sounds] spawn BIS_fnc_fireSupportVirtual

args.name: target: Position, Object or String - Target position, can be object, position or marker name
ammo
args.desc: (Optional, default "Sh_82mm_AMOS") ammunition to be used (if left empty,  ammunition will be used)

args.name: radius
args.desc: (Optional, default 100) radius of target area in meters

args.name: rounds
args.desc: (Optional, default 10) number of rounds to be fired

args.name:
delay: Array or Number - (Optional, default 10) delay between rounds
* Array [min, max]:
** min: Number - min delay
** max: Number - max delay
* Number - Precise delay
conditionEnd
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline{ false }) Condition to end bombardment before all rounds are fired

args.name: safezone
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) Safezone radius - minimal distance from the target position where shells may be directed at

args.name: alt
args.desc: (Optional, default 250) Altitude where the shell will be created

args.name: speed
args.desc: (Optional, default 150) Descending velocity, in m/s. Default is 150, if you use flare as ammo, set it to lower value (1-5) to let it fall down slowly

args.name: sounds: Array of strings - (Optional, default [""]) Sounds to be played on the incoming shell

bis_fnc_stalk.title: BIS_fnc_stalk
bis_fnc_stalk.description:
Continuously set WP of one group to a different group to hunt it. It does not change the group's behaviour.
Script terminates if one of the groups is eliminated or if the optional condition is activated.

syntaxes.code: [stalker, stalked, refresh, radius, endCondition, endDestination] spawn BIS_fnc_stalk

args.name: stalker
args.desc: the group that will move towards the other

args.name: stalked
args.desc: the group that will be followed

args.name: refresh
args.desc: (Optional, default 10, minimum 5) time between waypoint updates

args.name: endCondition
args.desc: (Optional, default {false}) condition that if true stops stalker to follow stalked

args.name:
endDestination: String or Position or Object or Number - (Optional, default 0) destination stalker will go after endCondition is met (or stalked is killed)
* String - destination marker name
* Position - destination
* Object - destination
* Number
** 0: return to original group waypoints
** 1: search around their current stalking position, in a 50m radius
** 2: return to the original position before stalking

bis_fnc_weaponsentitytype.title: BIS_fnc_weaponsEntityType
bis_fnc_weaponsentitytype.description: Return object's weapons as defined in config. Scans also turrets and pylons.

args.name: class: String or Array of Strings - entity classes

bis_fnc_magazinesentitytype.title: BIS_fnc_magazinesEntityType
bis_fnc_magazinesentitytype.description: Return object's magazines as defined in config. Scans also turrets and pylons.

bis_fnc_getcfg.title: BIS_fnc_getCfg
bis_fnc_getcfg.description:
Smart-return config (extension for BIS_fnc_getCfgXXXX functions).
Can by called 2 ways:
* 1st way - passing config directly
* 2nd way - passing array of strings or config and strings

args.name: input: Config or Array - Can be Config path or array of strings with config names

bis_fnc_controlconfigs.title: BIS_fnc_controlConfigs
bis_fnc_controlconfigs.description: Return config paths to all display controls.

bis_fnc_showwelcomescreen.title: BIS_fnc_showWelcomeScreen
bis_fnc_showwelcomescreen.description:
Show welcome screen. Used in the main menu (works fine in Eden Editor).

File:BIS_fnc_showWelcomeScreen.jpg500

args.name: display
args.desc: Parent display where welcome screen is to be shown

args.name: forceLatest
args.desc: (Optional, default false) Show latest welcome screen automatically

bis_fnc_versioninfo.title: BIS_fnc_versionInfo
bis_fnc_versioninfo.description: Fills the first passed control with game type and version number, and positions both controls according to the game type.

args.name: gameTypeVersionControl - Control - Control for indication of game type (Stable/Dev) and version number (RscText)
modControl - Control - Control for indication of modded game (RscActiveText)

bis_fnc_exportguibaseclasses.title: BIS_fnc_exportGUIBaseClasses
bis_fnc_exportguibaseclasses.description: Export GUI macros and base classes to the clipboard.

args.name:
mode: String - Mode, can be:
"Default" - Classic base classes like RscText or RscPicture
"3DEN" - Eden Editor base classes like ctrlStatic or ctrlStaticPicture
"all" - All GUI base classes, including more exotic ones

returns.desc: Content of *.hpp file to be included in description.ext. The result is also copied to clipboard

bis_fnc_advhintformat.title: BIS_fnc_advHintFormat
bis_fnc_advhintformat.description: Return formatted texts of a CfgHints hint.

bis_fnc_limitammunition.title: BIS_fnc_limitAmmunition
bis_fnc_limitammunition.description:
Limits the number of magazines carried by individual unit. Each container (uniform, vest and backpack) can be limited separately or left untouched.
	The function limits the number of magazines of each unique ammo category in respective container. Items like First Aid Kit or Mine Detector are not affected by the functionSet the minimum and maximum values in an array, for example [0.5,1] will set the magazine count anywhere between 50-100% of default count.

args.name:
uniformMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in uniform. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

vestMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in vest. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

backpackMags: Array - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in backpack. Array in form:
*0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)
*1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

bis_fnc_limititems.title: BIS_fnc_limitItems
bis_fnc_limititems.description: Keeps or removes unit's items (including NVGs and binocular/designator) based on probability user sets.

args.name:
chanceNVG: Number - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep NVG in %
* 0 = Item is always removed
* 100 = Item is always kept
chanceBino
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep binoculars in %

args.name: chanceGPS
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep GPS in %

args.name: chanceMap
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep Map in %

args.name: chanceRadio
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep radio in %

args.name: chanceCompass
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep compass in %

args.name: chanceWatch
args.desc: (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep watch in %

bis_fnc_limitweaponitems.title: BIS_fnc_limitWeaponItems
bis_fnc_limitweaponitems.description: Keeps or remove unit's weapon attachments based on probability user sets. Apply for primary, secondary or handgun weapon separately.

args.name:
mode: Number - (Optional, default 0) Can be:
*1 = primary weapon
*2 = secondary weapon
*3 = handgun

chanceOptics: Number or Array in format ["itemClass",chance] - (Optional, default 50) Chance to keep optics from 0 to 100%

*If you use ["itemClassname",number], the function will add that attachment if it passes the check. If not, current will be removed.
chanceAttach: Number or Array in format ["itemClass",chance] - (Optional, default 50) Chance to keep side attachments from 0 to 100%
chanceMuzzle: Number or Array in format ["itemClass",chance] - (Optional, default 50) Chance to keep muzzle attachment from 0 to 100%
chanceUnderbarrel: Number or Array in format ["itemClass",chance] - (Optional, default 50) Chance to keep underbarrel attachment from 0 to 100%

bis_fnc_disableloading.title: BIS_fnc_disableLoading
bis_fnc_disableloading.description: Disables the load/restart button. Currently only for BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder used within the Prologue and Survive campaigns. Only works in single player.

bis_fnc_gridtopos.title: BIS_fnc_gridToPos
bis_fnc_gridtopos.description: Converts grid coordinates to world position.

args.name: gridPosition
args.desc: (Optional, default  inlinemapGridPosition position cameraOn) accepts both "024577" or "De82" format

bis_fnc_encodeflags.title: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags
bis_fnc_encodeflags.description: Encodes array of unique binary flags with indexes between 0-15 into a single scalar.

bis_fnc_decodeflags.title: BIS_fnc_decodeFlags
bis_fnc_decodeflags.description: Decodes a single scalar into array of unique binary flags with indexes between 0-15.

bis_fnc_deletecounter.title: BIS_fnc_deleteCounter
bis_fnc_deletecounter.description:
/*
	Author: 
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Delete given counter

	Parameter(s):
		0: 
			STRING - variable name of counter
			ARRAY in format [variableName,nameSpace], where nameSpace can be object, group or missionNameSpace/uiNameSpace
	Returns:
		NOTHING
*/

#define VAR_SPACES [currentNamespace, objNull, displayNull, controlNull, grpNull, locationNull, taskNull, teamMemberNull]

bis_fnc_paramreviveforcerespawnduration.description: Grabs server param into global variable. (bis_reviveParam_forceRespawnDuration)

args.name: input: Number or Side - Side ID or side

bis_fnc_areequalnotnil.title: BIS_fnc_areEqualNotNil
bis_fnc_areequalnotnil.description:
Compares all elements of passed array between each other and returns true is all are defined and identical.
Very fast, different from BIS_fnc_areEqual in that nil values will not be considered equal to each other.

args.name: anythings
args.desc: nil values won't be considered equal

bis_fnc_vrhitpart.title: BIS_fnc_VRHitpart
bis_fnc_vrhitpart.description:
Initialize hit effects on VR targets.
	grey - undamaged
	orange - damaged
	red - destroyed

args.name: time
args.desc: (Optional, default 30) Delay before hit parts are returned back to default

bis_fnc_synchronizedobjects.title: BIS_fnc_synchronizedObjects
bis_fnc_synchronizedobjects.description: Get all objects of given type directly synchronized to the given object. Works in Eden Editor too.

args.name: filter: String or Array of strings - Class name filter. 1 or more class name of objects we are interested in
preciseMatch
args.desc: (Optional, default true) - If true only precise class names are considered, if false inheritance is considered

bis_fnc_ffvupdate.title: BIS_fnc_ffvUpdate
bis_fnc_ffvupdate.description: Update Firing From Vehicle feature depending on condition defined in turret's config.

bis_fnc_basevehicle.description: Returns base vehicle (i.e., vehicle which is not just derivative of other with different textures / animations).

args.name: vehicleClass
args.desc: Use "" to skip createVehicle part and set components / textures only

bis_fnc_garage3den.title: BIS_fnc_garage3DEN
bis_fnc_garage3den.description: The code is identical to the one of BIS_fnc_garage, except that  is set to 1. For more information about the garage, visit BIS_fnc_garage

bis_fnc_initvehiclecrew.title: BIS_fnc_initVehicleCrew
bis_fnc_initvehiclecrew.description: Moves units into vehicle seats. When units don't exist, it will create them in a group of vehicle's side.

syntaxes.code: [object, params, deleteCrew, anySeat, agents] call BIS_fnc_initVehicleCrew

args.name:
params: Array - In format:
*0: crewType: Object or String - unit or unit type (will be created)
*1: role: String - Can be:
**"driver"
**"turret"
**"cargo"
*2: index: Number or Array - Cargo index or turret path
deleteCrew
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to delete existing crew

args.name: anySeat
args.desc: (Optional, default false) When desired seats are occuppied, move crew in the vehicle to any other available seat

args.name: agents
args.desc: (Optional, default false) Create crew as agents

bis_fnc_initvehiclekart.title: BIS_fnc_initVehicleKart
bis_fnc_initvehiclekart.description: Customise given kart and its driver.

args.name: livery
args.desc: (Optional, default Random) Kart livery. A integer from 0 to 9

args.name: raceTeam
args.desc: (Optional, default Matches the livery) Driver uniform

bis_fnc_loadvehicle.title: BIS_fnc_loadVehicle
bis_fnc_loadvehicle.description: Load vehicle look saved with BIS_fnc_saveVehicle.

args.name:
target: Array - in format:
*0: Namespace, Group or Object - Where the save will be saved
*1: String - Name of the save

target: Array - in format:
*0: Namespace, Group or Object - Where the save will be saved
*1: String - Name of the save
params
args.desc: (Optional, default []) Additional parameters to be saved

args.name: delete
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to delete the save

bis_fnc_setvehiclemass.title: BIS_fnc_setVehicleMass
bis_fnc_setvehiclemass.description: Set mass relative to the default vehicle mass (default mass being vehicle mass on first execution of this function).

args.name:
animationInformation: Boolean or Array - (Optional, default  inline[])
* Boolean - true to take current animations mass in consideration, false to set "raw" mass
* Array - animation sources and phases to format ["animationSource1", 1, "animationSource2", 0, ...]
massDifference
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) value to add to the mass (can be negative)

bis_fnc_getintersectionsundercursor.title: BIS_fnc_getIntersectionsUnderCursor
bis_fnc_getintersectionsundercursor.description: Returns intersections under cursor. For more information see lineIntersectsSurfaces.

syntaxes.code: [screenX, screenY, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2] call BIS_fnc_getIntersectionsUnderCursor

args.name: screenX
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) cursor's X position - see screenToWorld

args.name: screenY
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) cursor's Y position - see screenToWorld

args.name: ignoreObj1
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) first object to ignore

args.name: ignoreObj2
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) second object to ignore

args.name: sortMode
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true: closest to furthest, false: furthest to closest

args.name: maxResults
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) max results to return. -1 to return every result

args.name:
LOD1: String - (Optional, default "VIEW") primary LOD to look for intersection. Can be one of:
* "FIRE"
* "VIEW"
* "GEOM"
* "IFIRE" - ("I" stands for Indirect, almost identical to "FIRE")
* "NONE"
*  "PHYSX" - PhysX geometry LOD
*  "ROADWAY" - only works from the top
LOD2
args.desc: (Optional, default "FIRE") secondary LOD to look for intersection. See LOD1 for possible values

bis_fnc_getobjectbbd.title: BIS_fnc_getObjectBBD
bis_fnc_getobjectbbd.description: Get object boundingBoxReal max values and store them with setVariable ["BIS_EGSpectator_objectBBD", [maxWidth, maxLength, maxHeight]] for later calls.

bis_fnc_getname.title: BIS_fnc_getName
bis_fnc_getname.description: Returns name of a unit. Name of unit is stored in it is namespace so it can be retrieved later, mainly for when unit dies. Name is stored in the variable BIS_fnc_getName_name.

args.name: object
args.desc: Object whose name should be returned

bis_fnc_getnetmode.title: BIS_fnc_getNetMode
bis_fnc_getnetmode.description: Returns the current net mode as a string.

bis_fnc_getangledelta.title: BIS_fnc_getAngleDelta
bis_fnc_getangledelta.description: Returns the smallest difference between two angles in degrees.

bis_fnc_egobjectivevisualizer.title: BIS_fnc_EGObjectiveVisualizer
bis_fnc_egobjectivevisualizer.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

bis_fnc_egobjectivevisualizerdraw.title: BIS_fnc_EGObjectiveVisualizerDraw
bis_fnc_egobjectivevisualizerdraw.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

syntaxes.code: [mode, [spectator, whitelistedSides, allowAi, allowFreeCamera, allow3PPCamera, showFocusInfo, showCameraButtons, showControlsHelper, showHeader, showLists]] call BIS_fnc_EGSpectator

args.name:
mode: String - Function mode, can be:
* "Initialize"
* "Terminate"
See the in-game Functions Viewer to see all the possible values. The following parameters are for "Initialize".
whitelistedSides
args.desc: (Optional, default: []) sides that can be spectated

args.name: allowAi
args.desc: (Optional, default: false) whether AI can be viewed by the spectator

args.name: allowFreeCamera
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether free camera mode is available

args.name: allow3PPCamera
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether 3rd Person camera mode is available

args.name: showFocusInfo
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether to show Focus Info stats widget

args.name: showCameraButtons
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether or not to show camera buttons widget

args.name: showControlsHelper
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether to show controls helper widget

args.name: showHeader
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether to show header widget

args.name: showLists
args.desc: (Optional, default: true) whether to show entities / locations lists

returns.desc: the return value depends on the mode. For "Initialize" and "Terminate" a Boolean indicating successful execution is returned.

bis_fnc_egspectatorcamera.title: BIS_fnc_EGSpectatorCamera
bis_fnc_egspectatorcamera.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

args.name:
step: Number - in range 0..3, steps being:
* 0: closed terminal
* 1: case opened
* 2: antenna up (but closed)
* 3: antenna opened and transmitting.

bis_fnc_dataterminalcolor.title: BIS_fnc_dataTerminalColor
bis_fnc_dataterminalcolor.description:
Set Data Terminal colors for its different steps. Steps are:
# closed terminal
# opening terminal
# emitting terminal.

Default step colors are "blue", "orange", "green".
See BIS_fnc_dataTerminalAnimate to animate a terminal.

args.name:
step1color: String - step 1 color.  Can be one of:
* "blue"
* "orange"
* "green"
* "red"
* "purple"

If not set, the selection color will simply not be changed.

returns.desc: false if data terminal is null, true if the script ends properly

bis_fnc_3denexportoldsqm.title: BIS_fnc_3DENExportOldSQM
bis_fnc_3denexportoldsqm.description: Export current mission (usually in Eden Editor) in 2D Editor format to the clipboard.

returns.desc: old SQM is copied to the clipboard

bis_fnc_3denexportterrainbuilder.title: BIS_fnc_3DENExportTerrainBuilder
bis_fnc_3denexportterrainbuilder.description: Gets all empty vehicles placed in the currently opened Eden mission and converts data into the format used by the Terrain Builder.

bis_fnc_3denvisionmode.title: BIS_fnc_3DENVisionMode
bis_fnc_3denvisionmode.description: Toggle or set Eden Editor vision mode. Has to be executed while Eden interface is opened.

args.name:
mode: Number - Can be:
* -2: restore the current mode
* -1: toggle mode
*  0: Normal
*  1: Night vision
*  2: Thermal

bis_fnc_3dentoolbar.title: BIS_fnc_3DENToolbar
bis_fnc_3dentoolbar.description: Interacts with the Eden Editor toolbar

returns.desc: Returns true if it was added successfully

bis_fnc_3dengrid.description: Handles action when grid button is pressed in the toolbar in Eden Editor.

args.name:
input: Array - Array in form:
0: Control
1: Config - Path to control

bis_fnc_3dencamera.title: BIS_fnc_3DENCamera
bis_fnc_3dencamera.description:
Moves Eden's camera depending on one of two modes:
* "random" - A random position over land preferring non forested areas
* "selected" - The current selected Eden entity or users cursor position if nothing is selected

bis_fnc_3denmoduledescription.title: BIS_fnc_3DENModuleDescription
bis_fnc_3denmoduledescription.description: Used to display module description in the attribute window.

bis_fnc_3dendrawlocations.title: BIS_fnc_3DENDrawLocations
bis_fnc_3dendrawlocations.description: Internal function used by Eden Editor to draw locations.

bis_fnc_3denlistlocations.title: BIS_fnc_3DENListLocations
bis_fnc_3denlistlocations.description: Used in the locations display in Eden Editor. Internal use only.

args.name: path
args.desc: Path in format [<categoryClass>,<tutorialClass>], classes are from Cfg3DEN >> Tutorials

args.name: index
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) index of step at which tutorial starts

args.name: oneStep
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to show only one step, without ability to go forward or backward

bis_fnc_3denentitymenu.title: BIS_fnc_3DENEntityMenu
bis_fnc_3denentitymenu.description: Excutes actions available in the entity menu (context menu).

bis_fnc_3dencontrolshint.title: BIS_fnc_3DENControlsHint
bis_fnc_3dencontrolshint.description: Used by Eden to display control hints for the current Eden operation as seen in the bottom right corner of the Editor display.

args.name:
mode: String - case-sensitive, can be one of:
* "show" - Shows controls hints
* "hide" - Hides controls hints
* "toggle" - Toggles controls hints

bis_fnc_3denshowmessage.title: BIS_fnc_3DENShowMessage
bis_fnc_3denshowmessage.description:
Shows a pop-up message.
In order to skip any optional parameter in between other parameters, send nil as parameter.

syntaxes.code: [text, title, buttonOK, buttonCancel, icon, parentDisplay] call BIS_fnc_3DENShowMessage

args.name:
buttonOK: String, Boolean or Array - (Optional, default "") can be one of:
* String - button's text
* Boolean - show button or not
* Array - in format [String or Boolean, Code]:
** String or Boolean - same as above
** Code - code executed when button is pressed

buttonCancel: String, Boolean or Array - (Optional, default "") can be one of:
* String - button's text
* Boolean - show button or not
* Array - in format [String or Boolean, Code]:
** String or Boolean - same as above

icon
